story:
Go Anywhere. Take Charge.

The ONLY compact, completely “off-grid” (Solar/Grid/Batteries/Fuel Cell or any combination) recharging solution for devices that charge via a USB port (cell phone, GPS, MP3 Player, camera). A must-have in an emergency.Take it on-the-go to recharge your devices absolutely anywhere.

Pick a perk (listed on the right!), get a very cool product, and support 21st century learning for kids in Africa. Visit www.buzzbarsuite.com to see the very cool colors. For every 25 units sold, we donate one to Asante Africa Foundation. 

If you travel frequently, or go "off-grid" for any length of time, you are going to need a power solution for your portable electronics. The BuzzBar Suite provides a very simple, compact power solution that works anywhere.  All in a nice, stackable package. Whether you're camping, working for long periods in remote locations, or simply expecting the unexpected, the BuzzBar Suite can be a life-saver.


For every 25 BuzzBar Suite units we sell, we'll donate 1 to Asante Africa Foundation which aims to provide children in deeply rural East African schools with access to technology. 

See below for full details on how the BuzzBar Suite works.

How it works:



The heart of The BuzzBar Suite is the BuzzBar – a compact lithium-ion battery that can store enough energy to recharge any device that uses USB. What makes the BuzzBar so unique is that it is the ONLY product that can be recharged using a variety of energy sources. You can plug it in to a wall outlet (grid), or use solar power (BuzzSol), fuel cells (BuzzCell), and even AA and AAA (BuzzBat) batteries. It's small enough to slip into your purse, backpack, briefcase, or even your back pocket.

That pretty much makes the BuzzBar the perfect on-demand power solution for any scenario.

We've even designed the BuzzBar Suite so up to 3 BuzzSol solar panel attachments (additional units sold separately) can be chained together for faster charging in the sun. The BuzzSol panels stack neatly together for ultra-compact storage.

The BuzzBar provides enough energy to recharge a typical smartphone, tablet, GPS, or digital camera, making The BuzzBar Suite an essential addition to your travel and disaster preparedness kits.

The BuzzBar Suite will also include BuzzCell  – a compact fuel-cell technology that you can take anywhere and use day or night. You'll be able to order fuel cell cartridges for about $1 each (projected pricing) and send used cartridges back to us for refilling and re-use.

Who needs a BuzzBar?

You do. Everyone should expect the unexpected. When the power goes out, especially in a disaster, you absolutely need a way to keep your mobile phone charged. Add The BuzzBar Suite to your disaster preparedness kits and stay safe. Visit ready.gov for more information about how to keep yourself and your family safe in the event of a disaster. We bet you can think of a few occasions when you wished you had a BuzzBar handy! 

Live a little greener.

Think about this: You charge your mobile phone every single day. Save a little on your electric bill and harvest free energy from the sun to power your phone with the BuzzBar Suite. The BuzzBar recharges in the sun with the BuzzSol solar panel attachment. So, you can charge the BuzzBar during the day, and charge your phone at night.



Your Questions Answered!

How fast can the BuzzBar charge my device?

The BuzzBar charges your device at up to the USB (2.0) standard. That is fast! Faster than older computers. The BuzzBar itself will output ~ 15Wh or 4400 mAh of energy, which is up to two to three full charges of an average smartphone.

How long does the BuzzBar take to fully charge via BuzzSol?

It depends on the amount of sun, but a single 2W BuzzSol solar panel should be able to charge the BuzzBar in about 8 hours. 3 panels with good irradiance would charge the BuzzBar at about the same speed as a wall outlet (i.e. fast!). 

How long does the BuzzBat take to fully charge via BuzzBar?

4 AA together with 2 AAA batteries in the BuzzBat will not fully charge the BuzzBar. The BuzzBat is an emergency solution which can be used when all other sources of power are exhausted or unavailable. For example, if the power fails at night, you can pilfer the batteries from gadgets around the house to get an emergency charge for your cell phone. One or more batteries will do the trick! 

How long does the BuzzCell take to fully charge the BuzzBar?

BuzzCell is currently being designed to charge BuzzBar to 50% (about one cell charge) within 4 hours. The BuzzCell is expected to be available in Q4 2014.

The first BuzzCell units will ship to indiegogo donations at the appropriate level!

What’s the warranty on the BuzzBar Suite?

Neah Power absolutely guarantees the BuzzBar Suite to be completely free of defects for 6 months. See our website for warranty and registration information.

Can I buy a BuzzBar Suite and donate it directly to Asante Africa Foundation?

Yes! You can also choose to purchase a BuzzBar and donate it directly to Asante Africa Foundation. Together we can transform worlds!


Why we need your help:

Neah Power is endeavoring to bring this product to market as fast as possible. We believe there's a strong demand for a simple device that can enable people to go farther and travel longer with their vital electronics. There's nothing quite like the BuzzBar Suite anywhere else.

We think The BuzzBar Suite is a great idea, and we need your help to prove there's demand. Your contributions at this early stage will help create volume demand to help with manufacturing as we ramp up. Our prices are expected to increase beyond this indiegogo campaign when we offer it on the website.

Schedule

In Early 2014 we took initial orders for the first 200+ BuzzBar only and BuzzBar Suite units. As of the end of August 2014, we started shipping to meet those commitments, so we have high confidence in the product. These products were designed with HVM (high volume manufacturing) in mind, and we need certain volumes to make the product cost effective. 

We are currently working on integrating the BuzzCell (fuel cell option) into the BuzzBar Suite. We are building and testing various components and expect to start shipping the BuzzCell in Dec 2014. 

BuzzBar Suite units ordered through this campaign are expected to ship latest by 30 - 45 days of completion of the campaign.


Any questions?

Please let us know if you have any questions, comments or suggestions!

Email us at custsvc@buzzbarsuite.com

story:
We have collectively worked in the service industry for our entire careers (going on 30 years), providing some type of service to a customer base.  It is through our professional experience and training that we have developed a solid understanding of what it means to provide exceptional customer service, and to exceed client expectations.

Over the past 11 years, we have worked as independent real estate professionals, providing brokerage, project management and consulting services.  In order to accomplish the goals of our clients, we must engage, qualify, and rely upon the services of other service professionals.  What we have come to realize is that the process of qualifying these professionals, in order to feel comfortable/well informed enough to make hiring decisions in high stakes situations, is time consuming, inefficient, and considerably risky due to the lack and reliability of information available or provided.  We have also discovered that there is a lot of mediocrity out there in terms of the level of service provided, and that this mediocrity translates into a lack of accountability, diligence, responsiveness, and many other what we consider, “key competencies” that every service professional should possess.  Wouldn’t it be nice if there was a more efficient and reliable way to qualify service professionals?  Wouldn’t it also be nice if there was some standard to which all service professionals were upheld, to both eliminate mediocrity, and to reward those who strive for excellence?

We, as well as many others, have been affected by these deficiencies in the service industry.  For the past two years we have worked to develop solutions to the above mentioned problems.  Our solution is Service Score (svcscore.com).

Let’s look at each problem in a bit more detail to better understand how Service Score provides a solution:

PROBLEM 1 – TIME CONSUMING, INEFFICIENT & RISKY QUALIFYING PROCESS:  Unless you get a referral from a very trusted source (emphasis on very because one person’s opinion of quality is not necessarily another’s), the process of gathering information to qualify service professionals is both time consuming and inefficient.  From our experience, this process usually begins with an Internet search for a specific type of service or service professional (for example, Civil Engineers in San Francisco), followed by a screening procedure that requires the reference of multiple resources (company website, Yelp, etc.) in order to gather enough information to feel confident in further engagement via phone or email.  Often times the pre-qualifying phone call or email isn't sufficient alone.  Additional confidence in the hiring process is likely only achieved after collecting feedback from professional references, so a list of such references must be compiled and contacted.  The problem is that we are typically only provided access to positive endorsements when fully informed and less risky decision making requires the review of both good and bad references.

Service Score, like other review sites, relies on data from those who evaluate service professionals with whom they have worked.  This is where the similarities end.  Utilizing an efficient 5 step review process, specific and relevant information is requested and collected from the reviewer about the service professional and overall experience, as opposed to the more common practice among review sites of allowing general, unguided and often emotional reviews that lack factual information necessary for decision making in high stakes situations. 

Review information can be accessed through a free search by service professional’s name, company name, type of service, keyword, or any combination of these parameters.  The search results will yield the following per service professional:

1.  Contextual evaluations of past assignments

2.  How they scored on 11 Key Competencies, aka their “Service Score” (See Problem 2 below)

We strongly believe that those writing reviews should exercise the same level of accountability that they expect from the service professionals that they hire.  In other words, Service Score will not allow anonymous reviews.  Reviewers must stand behind their reviews and are encouraged to be a professional reference.  Accordingly, the search results will also yield:

3.  Access to professional references (both the good and the bad)

Coupled with professional experience/qualifications that service professionals can upload to the site as part of their “Service Profile", all of the information needed for informed decision making is in one place.  To summarize, Service Score is a validated, searchable database of service professionals’ experience, key competencies, professional references, and evaluations of past assignments. 

PROBLEM 2 – NO STANDARD:  In today’s world, there are numerous standards or process/procedural guidelines put in place to ensure quality and consistency in the deliverables.  Why is there no such standard to ensure quality and consistency in the level and type of service provided by those hired to perform/deliver a service?  Without such a standard, there really isn’t any mechanism for quality control, or repercussions for that matter, if the standards are or aren’t upheld.  Through the use of a rating/scoring system based on 11 Key Competencies relevant to all service professionals, Service Score aims to create this standard. 

Through the review process, evaluators will score service professionals with whom they have worked on any applicable key competency listed below:

1.  Accountable

2.  Ethical

3.  Pleasant to deal with

4.  Communicates & listens effectively

5.  Diligent/goes above and beyond

6.  Knowledgeable/experienced

7.  Progressive/solution oriented

8.  Responsive

9.  Flexible

10.  Efficient

11.  Punctual

The scoring system is based on a scale of 1 to 10, with 10 being “exceptional” and anything below 5 being “poor”.  The score per individual competency, per review is then added together to come up with that service professional’s overall “Service Score”.  The higher one’s Service Score, the higher up that individual would fall on a search results page, thus incentivizing quality service (or a higher Service Score) to give one the best chance of getting selected for future assignments, and rewarding those who consistently provide quality service.  In addition, those searching will be able to see how a specific individual scored per key competency, which will inevitably factor into the hiring decision making process.  Over time, a service professional’s Service Score will become a standard, something that those looking to hire will look at and weigh with importance, and that service professionals will take seriously as it will affect their livelihoods.

THE IMPACTS:  Aside from those benefits already described in detail above, Service Score will also prove to have an impact in the following ways:

1)  Access to better and more reliable data will facilitate fully informed hiring decision making, and will ultimately help mitigate mistakes in the hiring process, which cost employers time, money, and resources.

2)  Comprehensive and relevant reviews about individuals.  Most reviews today are about organizations as a whole rather than those individuals that make up a company and actually interface with the customers.  Those reviews that are about individuals do not highlight enough relevant/reliable information to allow for fully informed decision making.

3)  Service Score will establish a fair ranking system.  Today’s search offers an unfair exposure advantage to those companies/individuals with large marketing budgets.  Through a Service Score search, the order in which the results are displayed is actually based on merit (the highest Service Score), or a combination of merit and professional experience/qualifications.

4)  The platform encourages and facilitates resolution between service professionals and their customers.  Not only can service professionals respond to or clarify negative reviews in the form of a review rebuttal, but should such resolution occur, a negative review can be removed from that service professional’s profile, thereby raising their overall Service Score.

5)  Litigation mitigation.  Often times the only recourse in dealing with a service professional that lacks accountability is a long, drawn out and expensive legal process.  The vision is that one’s Service Score will carry enough weight and influence that service professionals will put in the time and effort necessary to resolve issues with their customers and avoid a blemish to their Service Score.

Ultimately, we are calling for a new system/structure that will empower both service professionals and their customers, and will elevate the service industry as a whole.  We cannot accomplish this mission without your contributions and support (monetary and other).

NEXT STEPS:  We have spent the last two years working on the preliminary design and functionality of the Service Score website.  We are now at the stage where we need to hire a developer to build the web based interface and start beta testing.  It has been determined that we will need at least $50,000 to accomplish this next step. 

The website will have three main functions:  1) It will be the database that will accept the input and collection of review information.  2) It will allow for the creation of a Service Profile page to highlight service professionals’ experience/qualifications and other details.  3) It will be the search interface, allowing the input of search parameters so that those who are seeking can find a type of service or service professional.

Unfortunately, we don’t have a physical product that we can offer in exchange for a funding contribution.  What we can offer is: 1) Appreciation and recognition as a funding partner, broadcast through the Service Score homepage and 2) If you are a contributing service professional, a premium Service Profile page which offers additional functionality and benefits (for example posting rebuttals to reviews) from the standard free profile page.  See "Perks" section for more details.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:  If you can’t make a monetary contribution, there are other equally important ways that you can help:  1) Spread the word about Service Score so that we can reach our funding goal.  2) If you are a service professional, encourage your clients to review your past assignments once the site goes live.  3) Once the site goes live, write reviews (both good and bad) about those service professionals that you have worked with, and be a professional reference.

story:
We have a new committed and confirmed investor for $30,000. We ARE going to manufacturing and all pre-sales will be honored. So take part in our IndieGoGo campaign and get your MyRingGuard for 20+% off today!

Our Story

My name is Rachel Owens. I am an avid runner and I constantly run alone in parks and sometimes in the dark. I wanted to have a way to let my family and friends know if I was hurt or be able to call for help in case I was attacked. I thought that the best way to do this would be in the form of a ring because regardless of the injury, or god forbid an attack, nothing or no one could stop me from touching my thumb to my index finger. With the help and support of my father, who spent years in the technology space, I was able to understand that this was actually doable by having the ring connect to a smart phone application through blue tooth and have the phone send a text message with a GPS location to pre-set contacts. And, with that - plus a lot of blood, sweat, and tears - MyRingGuard was born!

 

The Impact

MyRingGuard is no longer about me. We have spent two years developing a working ring prototype and the application requirements (now in alpha version for Android). With the help of backers we can bring our ring past prototype stage and have the hard tooling built, the Android application programming refined to make it user friendly, and then we will have a usable product available for all.


This product will allow for anyone, anywhere in the world with an Android phone: a lone walker, your daughter in college, night shift workers (hospital employees, restaurant employees) that have to walk through dark parking lots on their way home, public transit commuters, etc. to turn on an app and put on a ring before heading out and at the press of a button send a text to pre-set emergency contacts with a Google link to your exact location.

   

MyRingGuard Needs your Help

We have a great product but we NEED the help of early supporters, purchasers, and product promoters to raise the last $30,000 to bring this product/service to market quickly! For everyone who contributes $39 or more before December 15, 2011 you will receive custom gift cards for each ring that you pre-ordered that you can use as stocking stuffers to let your loved ones know that they are one of the first in the world to have the gift of safety delivered by MyRingGuard.


Be A Contributor

Advance purchase your MyRingGuard today at a deeply discounted price giving you an opportunity to receive it and use it before it is on-sale anywhere else.

 

Be A Promoter

You can also give the gift of safety to others by helping to promote the MyRingGuard product and mission to your friends and family to help us get that much closer to reaching our $30,000 goal. Please share my story and project on facebook, twitter, through email, any way that you are ready willing and able because the more people that hear about it, believe in it, and pre-purchase it, the faster we can get this product onto my finger and yours.
story_txt:
We have a new committed and confirmed investor for $30,000. We ARE going to manufacturing and all pre-sales will be honored. So take part in our IndieGoGo campaign and get your MyRingGuard for 20+% off today!Our Story
My name is Rachel Owens. I am an
avid runner and I constantly run alone in parks and sometimes in the dark. I
wanted to have a way to let my family and friends know if I was hurt or be able
to call for help in case I was attacked. I thought that the best way to do this
would be in the form of a ring because regardless of the injury, or god forbid
an attack, nothing or no one could stop me from touching my thumb to my index
finger. With the help and support of my father, who spent years in the
technology space, I was able to understand that this was actually doable by
having the ring connect to a smart phone application through blue tooth and have the phone send a
text message with a GPS location to pre-set contacts. And, with that - plus a lot of blood, sweat, and tears - MyRingGuard was
born!   
The
Impact
MyRingGuard is no longer about me.
We have spent two years developing a working ring prototype and the application requirements (now in alpha version for Android).
With the help of backers we can bring our ring past prototype stage and have
the hard tooling built, the Android application programming refined to make
it user friendly, and then we will have a usable product available for all.
This product will allow for anyone, anywhere in the world
with an Android phone: a lone walker, your daughter in college, night shift
workers (hospital employees, restaurant employees) that have to walk through dark
parking lots on their way home, public transit commuters, etc. to turn on an
app and put on a ring before heading out and at the press of a button send a
text to pre-set emergency contacts with a Google link to your exact location. 
    
MyRingGuard Needs your Help

We have a great product but we NEED the
help of early supporters, purchasers, and product promoters to raise the last
$30,000 to bring this product/service to market quickly! For everyone who contributes $39 or more before December 15, 2011 you will receive custom gift cards for each ring that you pre-ordered that you can use as stocking stuffers to let your loved ones know that they are one of the first in the world to have the gift of safety delivered by MyRingGuard.

today at a deeply discounted price giving you an opportunity to receive it and

 can also give the gift of safety to others by helping to promote the MyRingGuard product and mission to your friends and family to help us get that much 
closer to reaching our $30,000 goal. Please share my story and project on facebook, twitter, through email, any way
that you are ready willing and able because the more people that hear about it,
believe in it, and pre-purchase it, the faster we can get this product onto my finger
and yours.

story:
LoRa is a wireless technology developed to create the low-power, wide-area networks (LPWANs) required for machine-to-machine (M2M) and Internet of Things (IoT) applications. The technology offers a very compelling mix of long range, low power consumption and secure data transmission and is gaining significant traction in IoT networks being deployed by wireless network operators.

A network based on LoRa wireless technology can provide coverage that is greater in range compared to that of existing cellular networks. In fact, many mobile network operators have chosen to complement their existing cellular/wireless networks with a LPWAN based on LoRa technology because it is easy to plug into their existing infrastructure and also allows them to offer their customers a solution to serve more IoT battery-operated applications.

Dragino Lora IoT Kit is designed to facilitate beginners and developers to quickly learn LoRa and IoT technology. It help users to turn the idea into a practical application and make the Internet of Things a reality. It is easy to program, create and connect your things everywhere. A number of telecom operators are currently rolling out networks, but because LoRa operates in the open spectrum you can also set up your own network. The LoRa IoT kit will show how to build LoRa network, and how to use the network to send data from a LoRa sensor node to the cloud server. When used as a private LoRa network, the LoRa gateway will connect your other LoRa nodes up to 5km however expect up to 10km range (when in line of sight) when connecting your LoRa node to a LoRa gateway!

For the past months we've worked hard to get the LoRa IoT Kit to the final stages of development. We have got some users to start using LoRa IoT Kit. To make the final step and start mass-production, we need your help. If you back us, you will speed up the LoRa IoT Kit production and receive one of it in 01/2017, but you'll also receive one yourself in 03/2017. So to start to build your own LoRa Network and examine the IoT technology, we are trying to provide a full solution to connect LoRa to different cloud server  there’s nothing like what Dragino LoRa IoT Kit can provide.

 

The Dragino Lora IoT Kit are formed by LG01 ,Arduino,LoRa Shield,LoRa GPS Shield, multiple sensors and other related accessories.

Lora Gateway LG01

In general, gateway is a device to connect different types of network. The LG01 is a LoRa Gateway to bridge the LoRa wireless network and IP network. The main feature of it is to:

  • The head to form a LoRa network.
  • Get data from LoRa Device in LoRa Network via LoRa wireless and process/send to IoT server in IP network via WiFi/Ethernet/3G/4G etc.
  •  Get command from IoT Server and send it to LoRa device.

Arduino

Arduino is an open-source electronics platform based on easy-to-use hardware and software. It's intended for anyone making interactive projects.More info please click here. In the LoRa Kit ,We provide the Arduino Uno for you. Arduino Uno is a microcontroller board based on the ATmega328P (datasheet).

 

LoRa Shield is to add LoRa wireless to an Arduino board so to build a LoRa sensor node.

About this product: : http://wiki.dragino.com/index.php?title=Lora_Shield

 

LoRa GPS Shield is to add GPS and LoRa wireless to an Arduino Board to build a LoRa sensor which also include geography info.  

About this product: http://wiki.dragino.com/index.php?title=Lora/GPS_Shield

 

Sensors

DHT11: Basic temperature and humidity sensor.

Ultrasonic Sensor: Use to check if there is object in front of it.

Photosensitive sensor: monitor the ambient light.

Flame sensor: Detector of a flame or fire.

Relay: Control the power of a device.

Buzzer: Create FireAlarm.

LED:LEDs to show status.

 

 

 

 

 

Dragino LoRa Kit is targeted at IoT applications functioning over LPWANs, that are required to transmit data at a low bit rate, over a long range, using low power battery operated devices.

 

Dragino LoRa Kit  is ideal to  prototyping  IoT applications such as:

  • Automated Meter Reading;
  • Home and Building Automation;
  • Wireless Alarm and Security Systems;
  • Industrial Monitoring and Control;
  • Long range Irrigation Systems;
  • GPS tracker,etc.

 

Dragino LoRa IoT kit is easy to START

We are providing friendly step by step examples to let you getting start and get funs with it in a few minutes!

Dragino LoRa IoT kit is easy to DEVELOP

The LoRa sensor node is based on Arduino. There are millions examples ready in the internet, these examples cover variety sensors / applications.

The LoRa Gateway is based on OpenWrt, a well developed embedded Linux system, there is more than 3,000+ ready packages which use can use for their applications.

Dragino LoRa IoT kit is easy to maintain

The Dragino LoRa Gateway support auto-update/ auto-provisioning feature. This help users easily maintain their LoRa network.

Dragino LoRa IoT kit is easy to manufacture

The LoRa node and LoRa module base on module solution. we have made all the difficulty things in a module so if user want to make their own products, they can easy to make it in low cost ,low risk and short time.

 

                            

We believe that open source products are the best to spread and improve technology. The LoRa IoT Kit is also Open Source software and hardware project User and developer can be a part of their evolution.  Everyone has the opportunity to work with them, use them and change them the way they desire. You will not only get the LoRa IoT Kit but also its full hardware design including schematic, circuit diagram; full source code including bootloader, system, applications. You are able to control EVERY BIT of your Dragino LoRa IoT Kit.

 

 

 

 

 

In Dragino LoRa IoT Kit, you can get:

  • Necessary hardware to start with IoT projects for studying, evaluating.
  • Learning the Arduino code and some other mcu knowledge.
  • Learning how to use the commonly used sensors.
  • Learning the basic knowledge of Linux.
  • Learning the basic construction of IoT and how it works.
  • Learning the LoRa wireless technology.
  • Learning how to build a LoRa network.
  • Learning how to use your sensor network to communicate with different IoT servers.

 

For customers to be more convenient to use Dragino LoRa IoT Kit, we will provide a number of examples on how to use this suite, and we will continue to improve and public new examples. 

Examples includes:

  • How to use LoRa to receive / send data collected by a variety of sensors.
  • How to use the kit to build LoRa wireless network.
  • How to use the kit to interact with a variety of IoT servers.
  • How to encrypt the data collected by the sensor.
  • How to transmit data reliability.
  • How to group the node or gateway in LoRa network.
  • How to optimize the code to support 100+ nodes.

 

LoRa is a great technology with a lot of potential, especially because anyone can set up a network and get started building long range IoT network with a relatively small investment. We hope our LoRa IoT Kit will help you get started, and would love to see what you build with LoRa technology.

 

Dragino WiKi

Dragino LoRa IoT Kit User Manual

LG01 LoRa Gateway Datasheet, User Manual, Source Code,

LoRa Shield Datasheet, WiKi, Hardware Source

LoRa/GPS Shield Datasheet, WiKi, Hardware Source

Arduino Site

OpenWrt Site

Contact Dragino: support@dragino.com

You can also join our GoogleGroup by: http://www.dragino.com/support/googlegroup.html

 

The design goal of LoRa kit is to let more people know/learn about LoRa and IoT technology .IoT are all around us, we hope the LoRa Kit could bring more joy and convenience to your life and work. Once the crowdfunding project successfully, we will present a part of the product as a gift to those who have the idea to build their own LoRa network and willing share their projects to public.we have prepare 10 sets for this purpose. If the final crownding funds is double, we will prepare 20 sets and so on. You can submit your application to us by mail info@dragino.com, qualified beta applications will mostly be selected randomly. After the results are announced, we will send our LoRa kit to your address free of charge.(The application content include:Name,job, reasons for application,phone number, address ,zip code  and your plan to use and share)

 

The LoRa wireless system makes use of the unlicensed frequencies that are available worldwide. The most widely used frequencies / bands are:

  • 868 MHz for Europe
  • 915 MHz for North America, Korea, Japan, Australia, New Zealand
  • 433 MHz band for Asia, South Africa

So when ordering the Dragino LoRa Kit, please fill in which frequency you require, so we can make sure to send you the right hardware.

 

Time Line

 

 

Dragino Technology Co., Limited is founded by experienced engineers in 2010. We are specialists in electronic product design, developing and manufacturing. 

Dragino locates in Shenzhen, China. Where is one of the biggest electronic products design, sourcing and manufacturing centers in the world.  We focus on the Internet of Things industry and keep evaluating new technology on improving user experience in IoT solutions. We provide OEM/ODM service to worldwide clients. We have a set of offshore products and development kits to help clients to test, design and produce innovation IoT products in the shorter time, lower cost and lowest risk.   

Dragino dedicates to promote Open Source IoT solution. Our Open Source products are sold world widely and gain good name in the Open Source Internet of Things filed.

We aim to become a trusted and helpful partner for our clients and get the success in the Internet of Things market together. 

The Dragino LoRa Kit has been under development for four months,thousands of LoRa nodes are currently being used by beta-users, we’ve finished the development of the Dragino LoRa Gateway, the prototypes are fully functional and ready to go into mass production. The production will take place in Shenzhen,China.

However, there’s always a small risk involved while producing hardware. If something bad happens, the shipping will be delayed for several weeks and this is the only risk. We will do our best to make sure that the production is normally carried out,and we will make delivery at an earlier time after quality inspection.

 

  1. How will the devices be shipped?

     Perk with value higher than $100 will be shipped via express (DHL, Fedex, UPS, Aramex etc).

     Perk with value lower than $100 will be shipped via register post mail. 

     Early Bird will be shipped via express(DHL,Fedex, UPS, Aramex etc.).

story:
CURRENT UPDATE: We were previously funded on Kickstarter and successfully delivered the first round of Relic XR flashlights to backers Worldwide!  We are now currently in production with our second batch and we will begin delivering rewards right at the end of this campaign.  Pre-order now at special early bird rates!

ZEROHOUR RELIC XR

ZEROHOUR XR is a compact USB rechargeable tactical flashlight with variable control ring, tail-cap switch, and waterproof battery backup all-in-one. Our first project, ZEROHOUR XD, set new standards for flashlights by offering the ultimate integration of light and power, and on that foundation we’ve built a new device that is smaller and lighter yet gives you even more control:

Tactical-Grade Compact Flashlight

Constructed with aircraft aluminum and achieving a 1,000 lumen output with the game-changing Cree XLamp XP-L LED, ZEROHOUR XR continues our dedication to best in class design materials.

Featuring an all-new variable control ring that allows maximum flexibility in choosing brightness from 0 to 1000 lumens, plus the option to click into XR's preset modes (10 lumens, 1000 lumens, Strobe, and SOS).

Micro-USB Rechargeable Battery Backup

Keep ZEROHOUR XR with you wherever you go for that extra boost of backup power: its 3400mAh lithium-ion battery provides at least a full charge for your smartphones and cameras.

Our newly-designed, waterproof center ring untwists for easy access to the 2.1 amp port to charge your devices, and micro-USB port to charge the flashlight.

Versatile Design

ZEROHOUR XR incorporates many highly requested new features, including a tail-cap switch with momentary-on click setting, multiple battery configurations (18650 and CR123), anti-roll clip, removable stainless steel head and tail bezel, and large tail-cap holes for paracord support.

Coming in at 6.25 inches and 6 ounces, our lighter XR is highly adaptable to your needs, fits standard 1” bike mounts, weapon mounts, or belt holsters, and is easy to tuck away in your backpack, purse, or pocket.

Whether you're indoors or outdoors, on the go or on the job, ready for adventure or just keeping safe, ZEROHOUR XR is the perfect choice to power and light your way.

ZEROHOUREVOLUTION

"Kickstarter illuminates goal for flashlight company” - OC Register

"CES 2014: Startups steal the show” - CNet

"The ZeroHour XD is one of the most versatile flashlights we saw at the Outdoor Retailer Summer Market last week” - Gizmag

What a difference a year makes! From an idea we developed after a rough trip to Central America, launched on Kickstarter, debuted at International CES, and delivered to our backers across the world, we are so happy that ZEROHOUR XD has been a success.

As we began thinking about our next ZEROHOUR product, we knew we wanted to build a more compact, everyday carry version of the XD. Our first product was based on features that WE needed, but we wanted our new ZEROHOUR to reflect what YOU needed.

We reviewed comments and messages to find the most-requested features that didn’t make it into the XD. We reached out to our fellow “flashaholics" on flashlight discussion forums for feedback. We made it our goal to squeeze as much as possible into a smaller, more affordable flashlight that still maintained the high standards we built our name on. After months of meetings and lots of coffee, we came up with a design that includes the best of the best, adds our own ZEROHOUR twist, and absolutely makes us proud.

FEATURES

SPECIFICATIONS

  • USB battery backup (3400mAh capacity)
  • Click-type tail-cap switch
  • Mode Selector Ring (adjustable 0 to 1000 lumens)
  • Dual-output mode with momentary-on
  • Strobe and SOS settings
  • CREE XP-L LED emitter
  • Compatible with 2 x CR123, 2 x rechargeable CR123, or 1 x protected 18650 rechargeable battery
  • Removable stainless steel head and tail bezel
  • Large tail-cap holes for paracord support
  • LED battery indicator
  • Deep grooves for enhanced gripping
  • MIL-A-8625, Type III, Hard-anodized
  • Micro-USB rechargeable
  • Modular head and body tube features
  • Serial Number for Product Registration & Warranty
  • RoHS CE Certifiable

Built with the latest "game-changing Cree® XLamp XP-L,” a high-density class discrete LED that improves on the performance of its predecessor by 50%. ZEROHOUR XR shines dangerously bright, providing plenty of confidence and security for its size and weight.  

Cycle through five different mode positions on ZEROHOUR XR's innovative variable brightness control ring:

1. Dual Output: Press the tail-cap half way for momentary-on at 10 lumens. Fully click for constant-on at 10 lumens. Click twice more within two seconds to jump to high (1000 lumens).

2. Stand-by/USB: From position one, turn one-click clockwise to set to stand-by. This activates the Micro-USB and USB output ports, which can be used to recharge ZEROHOUR XR or send power from the battery backup to your devices.

3. Variable Brightness: This next setting allows you to select any desired brightness from 0 to 1000 lumens. Click the control ring clockwise into this position from stand-by, and slowly turn to adjust brightness.

4. SOS; Click past the 1000 lumen variable brightness to reach emergency SOS mode.

5. Strobe: The final click clockwise activates strobe, a non-lethal self-defense feature. This 1000 lumen strobe can temporarily blind an assailant, which can be followed up with a strike from the stainless steel bezel (either head or tail side) to neutralize a threat.

 

POWER

Simply plug your device into ZEROHOUR XR's 2.1 amp USB output port to charge most electronic devices with USB charge ports, including mobile smartphones, MP3 players, digital cameras, portable speakers and many Bluetooth-enabled devices.

One 18650 lithium-ion battery provides 3,400 mAh of power, or 1-2 full charges for most smart devices. ZEROHOUR XR also supports 2 x CR123 batteries (rechargeable or non-rechargeable, not included). Our quality, trusted brand-name battery cells are manufactured by Panasonic.

ZEROHOUR XR can be used to charge any rechargeable mobile USB device. Here is a list of popular mobile devices and their battery capacities:

  • Samsung S7: 2800mAh
  • iPhone 7: 1810mAh
  • iPhone 7+: 2915mAh
  • HTC m8: 2600mAh
  • GoPro HERO5: 1180mAh
  • Nexus: 2300mAh 
  • Sony: 2330mAh 
  • LG: 3000mAh

Recharge your ZEROHOUR using the Micro-USB port, supplied Micro-USB cable, and any standard 5V 1A adapter.

DESIGN

ZEROHOUR XR's sleek yet rugged enclosure withstands extreme conditions, delivers emergency power to your devices with its integrated battery backup, and can be easily taken apart to change, replace, or upgrade components.
story_txt:
CURRENT UPDATE: We were previously funded on Kickstarter and successfully delivered the first round of Relic XR flashlights to backers Worldwide!  We are now currently in production with our second batch and we will begin delivering rewards right at the end of this campaign.  Pre-order now at special early bird rates!
ZEROHOUR RELIC XR
ZEROHOUR XR is a compact USB rechargeable tactical flashlight with variable control ring, tail-cap switch, and waterproof battery backup all-in-one. Our first project, ZEROHOUR XD, set new standards for flashlights by offering the ultimate integration of light and power, and on that foundation we’ve built a new device that is smaller and lighter yet gives you even more control:
Tactical-Grade Compact Flashlight
Constructed with aircraft aluminum and achieving a 1,000 lumen output with the game-changing Cree XLamp XP-L LED, ZEROHOUR XR continues our dedication to best in class design materials.

Featuring an all-new variable control ring that allows maximum flexibility in choosing brightness from 0 to 1000 lumens, plus the option to click into XR's preset modes (10 lumens, 1000 lumens, Strobe, and SOS).

Micro-USB Rechargeable Battery Backup
Keep ZEROHOUR XR with you wherever you go for that extra boost of backup power: its 3400mAh lithium-ion battery provides at least a full charge for your smartphones and cameras.

Our newly-designed, waterproof center ring untwists for easy access to the 2.1 amp port to charge your devices, and micro-USB port to charge the flashlight.

Versatile Design
ZEROHOUR XR incorporates many highly requested new features, including a tail-cap switch with momentary-on click setting, multiple battery configurations (18650 and CR123), anti-roll clip, removable stainless steel head and tail bezel, and large tail-cap holes for paracord support.
Coming in at 6.25 inches and 6 ounces, our lighter XR is highly adaptable to your needs, fits standard 1” bike mounts, weapon mounts, or belt holsters, and is easy to tuck away in your backpack, purse, or pocket.
Whether you're indoors or outdoors, on the go or on the job, ready for adventure or just keeping safe, ZEROHOUR XR is the perfect choice to power and light your way.
ZEROHOUREVOLUTION
"Kickstarter illuminates goal for flashlight company” - OC Register
"CES 2014: Startups steal the show” - CNet
"The ZeroHour XD is one of the most versatile flashlights we saw at the Outdoor Retailer Summer Market last week” - Gizmag
What a difference a year makes! From an idea we developed after a rough trip to Central America, launched on Kickstarter, debuted at International CES, and delivered to our backers across the world, we are so happy that ZEROHOUR XD has been a success.
As we began thinking about our next ZEROHOUR product, we knew we wanted to build a more compact, everyday carry version of the XD. Our first product was based on features that WE needed, but we wanted our new ZEROHOUR to reflect what YOU needed.
We reviewed comments and messages to find the most-requested features that didn’t make it into the XD. We reached out to our fellow “flashaholics" on flashlight discussion forums for feedback. We made it our goal to squeeze as much as possible into a smaller, more affordable flashlight that still maintained the high standards we built our name on. After months of meetings and lots of coffee, we came up with a design that includes the best of the best, adds our own ZEROHOUR twist, and absolutely makes us proud.
FEATURES


SPECIFICATIONS

USB battery backup (3400mAh capacity)
Click-type tail-cap switch
Mode Selector Ring (adjustable 0 to 1000 lumens)
Dual-output mode with momentary-on
Strobe and SOS settings
CREE XP-L LED emitter
Compatible with 2 x CR123, 2 x rechargeable CR123, or 1 x protected 18650 rechargeable battery
Removable stainless steel head and tail bezel
Large tail-cap holes for paracord support
LED battery indicator
Deep grooves for enhanced gripping
MIL-A-8625, Type III, Hard-anodized
Micro-USB rechargeable
Modular head and body tube features
Serial Number for Product Registration & Warranty
RoHS CE Certifiable

Built with the latest "game-changing Cree® XLamp XP-L,” a high-density class discrete LED that improves on the performance of its predecessor by 50%. ZEROHOUR XR shines dangerously bright, providing plenty of confidence and security for its size and weight.  
Cycle through five different mode positions on ZEROHOUR XR's innovative variable brightness control ring:
1. Dual Output: Press the tail-cap half way for momentary-on at 10 lumens. Fully click for constant-on at 10 lumens. Click twice more within two seconds to jump to high (1000 lumens).
2. Stand-by/USB: From position one, turn one-click clockwise to set to stand-by. This activates the Micro-USB and USB output ports, which can be used to recharge ZEROHOUR XR or send power from the battery backup to your devices.3. Variable Brightness: This next setting allows you to select any desired brightness from 0 to 1000 lumens. Click the control ring clockwise into this position from stand-by, and slowly turn to adjust brightness.4. SOS; Click past the 1000 lumen variable brightness to reach emergency SOS mode.5. Strobe: The final click clockwise activates strobe, a non-lethal self-defense feature. This 1000 lumen strobe can temporarily blind an assailant, which can be followed up with a strike from the stainless steel bezel (either head or tail side) to neutralize a threat. POWERSimply plug your device into ZEROHOUR XR's 2.1 amp USB output port to charge most electronic devices with USB charge ports, including mobile smartphones, MP3 players, digital cameras, portable speakers and many Bluetooth-enabled devices.One 18650 lithium-ion battery provides 3,400 mAh of power, or 1-2 full charges for most smart devices. ZEROHOUR XR also supports 2 x CR123 batteries (rechargeable or non-rechargeable, not included). Our quality, trusted brand-name battery cells are manufactured by Panasonic.ZEROHOUR XR can be used to charge any rechargeable mobile USB device. Here is a list of popular mobile devices and their battery capacities:
Samsung S7: 2800mAh
iPhone 7: 1810mAh
iPhone 7+: 2915mAh
HTC m8: 2600mAh
GoPro HERO5: 1180mAh
Nexus: 2300mAh 
Sony: 2330mAh 
LG: 3000mAh
Recharge your ZEROHOUR using the Micro-USB port, supplied Micro-USB cable, and any standard 5V 1A adapter.DESIGNZEROHOUR XR's sleek yet rugged enclosure withstands extreme conditions, delivers emergency power to your devices with its integrated battery backup, and can be easily taken apart to change, replace, or upgrade components.

story:
REMOVU S1 is the world's most versatile 3-axis gimbal made for GoPro cameras. The S1 can be mounted anywhere a GoPro can be mounted. Mount it to your body, a bike, a helmet, wherever you would mount a GoPro. The S1 also comes with a detachable hand grip that is equipped with a wireless joystick remote, which will allow you to control your gimbal from a distance. REMOVU S1 is simply the best gimbal that anyone could ask for.

UPDATE: All backers now get a FREE S1 Hard Case. See our updates for details

 

Stabilize your scenes

Using three brushless DC motors and rotary sensors, the S1 delivers extremely stabilized professional shots, in any kind of activity. And with it's unique mounting capabilities, you are now able to get stable footage from angles that you never could before.
 

Control your angle wirelessly

 

REMOVU S1 is fully controllable from a distance using the detachable wireless remote control. The wireless remote control is equipped with a joystick to allow you to change the cameras position and orientation.
 

KEY POINTS


 

 

Stabilization Modes


 

Wireless Remote Control

REMOVU S1 is equipped with a detachable wireless joystick remote control that uses wireless technology. Using the 5-way jog key wireless remote, it will allow you to wirelessly control the angle of the camera, and change the modes on the gimbal.
 

 

One-Click Mounting System

With our revolutionary one-click mounting system, you can easily mount and unmount your camera. We will make additional housings for other action cameras in the future.

 

Detachable Handle Bar

 

 

The detachable handle bar and the mount clip provide maximum versatility.

 

Rainproof

We have designed this device to withstand harsh weather, so rain won’t stop you from getting your shots. The motors and body are specially designed to be water resistant. The S1 also comes with a custom waterproof housing for your GoPro camera. This waterproof housing protects your GoPro from rain and snow.
 

OLED Display

REMOVU S1 has two OLED displays that indicate the mode that you are currently using and the S1 battery level. These OLED displays are on both the body and the handle grip, so you can always see what mode you are in and change settings with ease.

 

PERKS

 

 

 

 

All of the S1 perks come with one S1 body, handheld grip with detachable remote, one battery and a battery/remote dock charger. The shipping cost is included in the price.
 

 

Where we are in development

We have produced our first design sample this month, and we are currently working on the stabilization technology. We will keep you updated on our progress throughout the campaign.

 

Production and Delivery Schedule
 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Where the Money Goes?

We have finished designing the external and internal structure of the device, but we need your help to bring the most sophisticated stabilization and controllability to the gimbal. We will use your contributions to bring this top quality gimbal to market.

 

Where is REMOVU produced?

REMOVU S1 is designed and will be produced in South Korea by our own highly skilled professionals and engineers.  It is our passion to deliver the finest and the most stable product to our valuable customers and ensure 100% satisfaction. 

 

Frequently Asked Questions

Q: Does this work with the HERO4 Session camera? What other cameras does this work with?
A: Yes. We will make a housing for Hero4 session camera, and also Xiomi Xi camera in the future. 

Q: Which GoPro cameras will work with the S1?
A: HERO3, HERO3+ and HERO4 (including HERO4 Session). 

Q: Can the S1 use the GoPro waterproof housing?
A: We will include a customized waterproof housing for GoPro camera to use with the S1. We are developing a customer waterproof housing and not using the GoPro housing, so that we can reduce the weight, which will provide higher performance to the gimbal motors.

Q: Why is the GoPro not in a housing?
A: The S1 will come with two housings, a frame housing and a custom waterproof housing. We are still designing the waterproof housing and will post images and videos as we proceed in the campaign.

Q: Is the S1 waterproof? Why isn't it waterproof?
A: Since gimbal stabilizers do not function properly underwater, we made S1 rainproof.

Q: Where is some sample footage?
A: We will post sample footage shortly.

Q: How much does the S1 weigh with and without the hand grip?
A: It weighs about 382g with the hand grip, and 302g without it.

Q: What is the size of the S1 (width, height, length)?
A: Width : 4 cm, Height : 6 cm, Length : 26 cm 

Q: How do I charge the battery?
A: The package includes a dock charger that charges both the battery and the remote control.

 

Q: How long does the battery last?
A: It is still a little early to tell, but it will be around 3~4 hours.

 

 

Risk & Challenges

We are committed to bringing you the finest product, and won't settle for anything less. Quality control will be at the top of the list and the most important issue. We will work closely with our manufacturing partners to ensure that the REMOVU comes to fruition in perfect form and function in a timely manner.

We are dedicated to our project timeline and will keep you informed on the status of our progress on a regular basis. We really appreciate your consideration.
 

Press

For press inquiries, please contact ashton@essel-t.com

 

Legal Notice

REMOVU is a trademark of Essel-T Co., Ltd., registered in the U.S. and other countries. 
REMOVU S1 is made to work with GoPro's Hero® cameras.
GOPRO and the GoPro logo are trademarks of GoPro, Inc., registered in the U.S. and other countries.

story:
Andrew Hartley

Everyone knows and loves the legendary Andrew "Kid Thunder" Hartley.  He has entertained for years with his action packed fights and online hijinx.

He has not made a lot of money being the 24-fight professional that you would expect.

In fact, what he has made throughout his career doesn't even add up to a decent salary for one year.

Andrew was forced to give up what he loved doing (boxing) and went into the medical field as a male nurse.  Unfortunately there were co-workers jealous of him and his fame as a worldly recognized athlete, Andrew was let go.

With not many fighters reluctant to accept his challenge, Andrew is forced to stay in the gym training day and night for a fight.  A fight to enshrine his legacy and to pay his bills.

Andrew is a loving and supporting father.  It is not always easy to be able to put food on the table for his children. But he finds a way.  

For all of the years he has put his life on the line to entertain us, it may be time for us to give back.  

 

GOAL

Everyone knows that phone bills are expensive.  Andrew's phone bill is $50 per month.  We are asking for as much help as possible to assist Andrew in covering those expenses.

Andrew hosts the popular radio show "The Kid Thunder Diaries" as well as he weekly prayer line every Sunday morning to help troubled youth go on the straight and arrow.

Without a phone, Andrew will be unable to do those things as well as speak to family and friends.

Andrew's main source of internet interactions are through his phone.

The Impact

Without Andrew's presense, that will leave thousands of sad people without hearing from their hero.

Andrew's children will be unable to contact their father.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

Get the word out and make some noise about Andrew;'s dilema.

story:
I am trying to save up for this Macbook Pro on my wishlist! But they are so expensive..! So thought I would set up this page to try and gather a bit of help.

If you would like to get me anything for my 25th Birthday this year just send a donation to here instead :)

I want to learn Video Editing properly and hopefully broadcasting will be much faster too, my current laptop is dying and blue screens constantly and I can't do anything practical or upload on it anymore! I want to make high end pics/vids for you guys!! >.<

Most people usually buy something off my wish-list for my birthday, this year can i ask if you can donate something to this instead please? This means i can use your generosity wisely.. :) Every donation small or large is appreciated so so much! Rewards will obviously be a given!! :) ♥

Thankyou to everyone that wants to help!! :) 
(Birthday is on 22nd July btw) ^_^
