story:
Think about your computer at home - the more you use it, the hotter it get's, right? Now imagine all the computers all over the world and how much heat they generate. That heat is energy - energy that could be made useful if we just made use of it. Project Exergy is about generating heat from computers to heat and cool our homes and buildings . 


"HENRY" - the proof of concept

This is Henry - he is a high-performance prototype computer that captures and thermally stores the heat he generates … enough heat to keep a 1000 square foot apartment warm and cozy while he crunches data to help support cancer researchers at Stanford’s Folding@Home project.


Henry consistently hits the temperatures we need to make domestic hot water, space heating, and power desiccant-driven air conditioning. Built with off-the-shelf parts, he’s running at the extremes of what he can reliably do on a daily basis. 

DAREHENRY - the next prototype

Future generations of “DareHenry” will be super energy efficient and energy productive by capturing and storing more than 90% of the heat generated by the internal components. DareHenry will also be modular, easy to maintain, and programmed so that we can customize its performance to suit your needs.

Computers create a lot of heat when in heavy use. Manufacturers traditionally created ways to prevent potential over-heating by cooling processors using fans to neutralize the heat generated. Project Exergy flips this concept by creating computers that are meant to run as hot as possible, and then store that heat energy for use in your home and office. It's a radical, yet simple concept - and when it gains momentum, it will be the biggest energy revolution in a generation!

As of today, data centers consume 2-3 % of all electricity produced in the US. On the other hand up to 60% of energy used in American homes is the heat for hot water and living space. Combining the two together - growing computation loads and existing needs for heat - and you see the path to achieve both more efficiently.

Our mission on IndieGoGo is to build an engaged community to support and spread the idea of exergy – energy productivity – maximizing energy and its co-benefits. Project Exergy believes some of these co-benefits are: economic productivity, resource efficiency, and adaptability.

Do you know that 30-50% of the energy that goes into data centers is used to cool down the servers? What if instead of using all that energy to keep the servers cool we focused on the heat benefits from the servers? We can achieve this if we move those servers, or rather the computation loads thy support, to places where that heat is needed, like your home or business.

As Seen On 

New Scientist - The computer that crunches cloud data to heat your home

The Times - Heat from computers could cut energy bills for wired households

Surfing the Web to Heat Your Home

Heat Your Home With Data Project Exergy makes you love an overheated laptop

Project Exergy wants to build a home computer that also heats your house

Startup Looks to Computing to Heat Buildings Project Exergy hopes to capture waste heat from computers to warm homes and offices.

Soon we could be heating our houses using the wasted energy created by our computers

Project Exergy: Using cloud computing to heat homes

Friends and Partners

 Scott and Julie at Solar Roadways have shown us that people ARE willing to vote with their dollars for the future they want to see. All the way to the White House and a mention in the President’s recent State of the Union speech is proof that the little guys can still have a big impact, thanks for being a force for change and a serious inspiration Scott and Julie! Check out this video (above) from Scott Brusaw at Solar Roadways about why we need your help!

This project has been so much fun - we’ve learned a whole heck of a lot and made many friends along the way. We’re very thankful for the help and support our friends (and strangers) have provided us. In particular, we’d like to send a very warm thank you to the Clark County Skills Center and their pre-engineering students who have helped design high temperature, custom parts for Henry. The students have also given us great feedback and tips along the way too. 



We also have to give our friend Shaul, Daniella and the family at Dick’s Hardware in Manhattan a big thank you. He and his team have helped us find and build so many of the little and big parts and pieces we needed for the first prototype. Shaul was a little skeptical at first but I think it’s safe to say he is now one of our biggest fans. And, no Shaul - we’re still not going on the shark tank! 


A big thank you to Demian and Scott from Ryder's Alley! These two have given us free reign to use their motorcycle shop, tools and machinery to build our high temperature computer in the heart of Manhattan. As you can imagine, it’s a little tricky to find a place to turn a wrench in the city... it’s even harder to find a place to fabricate a computer powered water heater! 


Perks



Meet Team Exergy 

 

With 15 years of experience in all aspects of commercial energy efficiency programs – design, management, implementation and marketing – as well as a strong understanding of the Energy Efficiency policy and regulatory environment, Lawrence Orsini is well versed in the inner workings of the energy industry. Lawrence’s broad industry experience runs the gamut, from field auditing to managing relationships with Fortune 100 utility and corporate clients, affording him a unique ability to draw connections between policy driven utility energy efficiency program requirements and bottom line driven business spending. 

Julianna Wei is a mechanical engineer with experience in building energy, policy research, and project management. She has led extensive outreach and advocacy activities with industry stakeholders, regulatory agencies and building science researchers. Julianna also dabbled in renewables and worked for a utility-scaled solar PV manufacturer and developer. Julianna is enthralled by the core concept of combining and aligning two important issues of our times – energy and computation. She's ready to connect the dots between technologies and people through the project. 

John Lilic is a crypto-economic advocate, having been an early Bitcoin adopter inspired by block chain technology and a proponent of distributed, decentralized, cryptographically secured peer to peer networks. The synergy between combined heating and computation and distributed computing is of particular interest. John considers it a privilege to work on this project. 

Bill Collins is a Finance professional with decades of experience in investment banking, structured finance, and environmental markets. Working as a derivatives specialist in Asia, Bill used his creativity and knowledge of financial markets to spot unique and innovative ways to help his customers (large government, state and private counterparties) identify and manage complex financial risks. This knowledge and skill set was subsequently leveraged in the international carbon markets. For seven years, Bill led a team at EcoSecurities tasked with sales, trading and risk management of the largest private sector carbon project portfolio. Bill serves on OneEnergy Renewables’ Advisory Board. 

Chris Paulsenis a master tradesman with 25 years of prototyping, manufacturing and tooling experience in advance composites. His work provides support for experimental, aviation, marine, recreational, infrastructure, educational and defense applications. A few example projects from his diverse repertoire include carbon fiber masts for Americas Cup racing yachts, wing parts for Boeing 787s in maintenance repair operations, faux architectural elements for thematic effects, and molds for composites and urethane foams for energy efficient homes. As a master mold maker, Chris will channel his creative and maker energy to build functional yet aesthetically pleasing prototypes. 

With years of experience in the energy industry solving technical problems, Sri Puranamhas a strong understanding of the physics of energy generation and storage. Over the last decade, Sri has worked with aircraft and automobile engines improving their efficiency, developed detailed models for electrochemical and battery systems and used facial recognition software to study fluid motion. As Project Exergy starts making inroads with its distributed generation model, Sri will be helping develop the technical backbone for the project. 

A cinema lover, producer, shooter, director and editor with a hands-on approach, Sasha Santiago is a film-maker who’s consistently evolving with the times. He explores the connected world we live in, quickly prototypes ideas and moves in turn with its digital media consumption changes and preferences. To be part of a team that’s on the forefront of a game changing concept that would affect the way the world consumes energy, Sasha sees Project Exergy as an vast and immersive canvas that will inspire and ignite many discoveries, including distributed generation. 


Credits:

Kids from the future: 

Sam Poon - Grey shirt 

Sofia Roma Rubino - pink shirt 

Mitchell Tobin - blue shirt 

Screenplay: 

Aaron Gonzalez 

Director: 

Sasha Santiago http://www.sashasantiago.com/ 

Prototype Render: 

Jonah Friedman http://www.jonahfriedman.com/ 

Music - the Exergy Theme: 

Giacomo Lamparelli https://soundcloud.com/giacomo-lamparelli

Photos: 

Arin Crumley https://arincrumley.wordpress.com/

As a master mold maker, Chris will channel his creative and maker energy to build functional yet aesthetically pleasing prototypes. 
With years of experience in the energy industry solving technical problems, Sri Puranamhas a strong understanding of the physics of energy generation and storage. Over the last decade, Sri has worked with aircraft and automobile engines improving their efficiency, developed detailed models for electrochemical and battery systems and used facial recognition software to study fluid motion. As Project Exergy starts making inroads with its distributed generation model, Sri will be helping develop the technical backbone for the project. 
A cinema lover, producer, shooter, director and editor with a hands-on approach, Sasha Santiago is a film-maker who’s consistently evolving with the times. He explores the connected world we live in, quickly prototypes ideas and moves in turn with its digital media consumption changes and preferences. To be part of a team that’s on the forefront of a game changing concept that would affect the way the world consumes energy, Sasha sees Project Exergy as an vast and immersive canvas that will inspire and ignite many discoveries, including distributed generation. 

Credits:

Sofia Roma Rubino - pink shirt 
Mitchell Tobin - blue shirt

Aaron Gonzalez

Sasha Santiago http://www.sashasantiago.com/

Arin Crumley https://arincrumley.wordpress.com/

story:
Most phone charger's are boring, get lost all the time and offer zero excitement allowing the phone to easily get BORED!  

       ( This is the REAL reason they break, get lost & hate you all the time!!!)

The RoKnDoK by RustRidge-Studios is a sick wall mounted  speaker/charging dock made of plasma cut steel that sync's your favorite jam's with L.E.D. lights for any device - phone - tablet - ipod - mp3.               

Designed and built 100% here local in our northern Utah shop,    created to bring the cool experience of the rock concert to your home, office, game-room or any place you want to make cooler.  With a handful of  current designs and new ones being created now all the time,  YOU can be part of the Revolution-Of-Change for the unbearable boring charging ritual.    Break the mundane task in charging & storing your device.

       

    

I have been working with metal and wood for many years and enjoy reinventing new things out of old things.

  

               

 

                 I am always sketching out drawings looking to create something original that has not been out there before. I really love the concert scene and wanted to bring some of the visual and sound back home with me. Combining technologies together that create that atmosphere is the ultimate goal.    

         

       RoKnDoK  is a unit that simply hangs on any wall close to any power outlet,  included with every unit is a set of custom cover plates that allow you to drop your power cord through the wall and come out close to the outlet so there are no tacky cords hanging down from the RoKnDoK.

     






                

    With help from the contributors (YOU GUYS),  Our goal of having everyone enjoy and entertain with the RoKnDoK can be reached. 

Without your support, streamlining the circuit board production would take a lot more time.

    We've come a long way within the last 6 months designing our product.  Engineering of the working prototype are  complete on the first 5 designs. 

Now we need your help to bring RoknDoK to the rest of the world.  By contributing to our campaign, You'll be casting your vote to how we reinvent the charging and storing of our devices so every morning you'll know where it is fully charged and ready to go.



     

         

 


Some of our initial risks include the manufacturing delays and the size of initial orders. To streamline the production of our circuit boards through local channels, without the larger quantities could increase cost which would slow production. That is why it is so important for YOUR help. 

If we run into any bumps along the way, you will be the first to know so you will be in the loop on how we will fix these problems if they arise.


               

      



           If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • You can still get the word out and make some noise about our campaign by sharing through your favorite social media channels.
  • Also you can use the Indiegogo share tools!

We would really appreciate ANYTHING you could do to help get the word out!!


              

           

  


                   

                       

           On each unit is a shelf space to fit almost any device - Phone-Tablet-ipod-Mp3-etc...          Once in position, simply plug in the provided Y-Splitter Audio Cord to your devices audio-jack (headphones).            One side of the Y-Splitter goes to your speakers and the other side to the L.E.D. Control-Circuit which is mounted on the back of the RoKnDoK unit.                

Then plug in your devices favorite charger cord (not provided), Your speakers power cord and the L.E.D. Control-Circuits power cord to your extension cord.               ( Most components use a low  12volt  power supplies)

   Pull up your favorite rock'n jams and your good to go...


WHATS INCLUDES:

   * Each wall mounting  RoKnDoK includes LED lights and control circuit, Y-splitter for speakers. Cover plate for wall access.

WHAT YOU WILL NEED TO PROVIDE:

   * Your own devices charger ( there are too may specific styles for us to provide it)

   * Your own small portable speakers - shelf areas differ per unit but are roughly      4"w X 2"d.     ( PC speakers work great and the sub woofer can be placed low next    to your power outlet for a much nicer sound)

   * Strong mounting bracket or screw ( best if mounted on a wall stud, THESE ARE HEAVY UNITS aprox. - 20lbs)

* Small extension cord with multiple outlets

 



          

   



      

              



               



           * Add $30 for anywhere outside U.S.

story:
Explainer Video


Summary

TipsTree is a sharing network, designed for the online bohemians and dreamers. It is a sharing network that connects you with other people who value similar kinds of experiences. 

TipsTree enables you to have a visual representation of how your life grown as a tree by categorizing your experiences on different twigs. Life is all about growing through meaningful experiences.

How does TipsTree Work?

Choose a branch to categorize and add a twig for your experience, for example if you are traveling to Europe then you should choose the traveling branch and add a special twig title about your experience. 

With TipsTree, you aren't sharing an isolated experience; you are sharing the tree of your life. You can post text, images, videos- even lists, making each post as comprehensive and memorable as the experience. When your followers click on your tree, images and videos for each branch are available in your feed, as well as a unique map showing your experience locations.

Interested in another member's experience? TipsTree makes it easy to search experiences. Simply click on the map and filter by tags. You can also follow other members based on common experiences. 

You can even use TipsTree as a way to share your professional experience, using it as a CV for potential employers or clients. Businesses can also share company events or updates on their own tree. As your business grows and the people you employ and the products you develop grows; your tree grows!

Your contribution will help us develop an even faster website, as well as a new mobile app - so that it's even easier to document and share experiences on TipsTree.

ScreenShots

Tree Profile

Profile Page

Feed

Risks & Challenges

Whether or not we reach our financial goal, we will push this project forward because our hearts believe TipsTree simply must happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • You can start to share your tree of your life.
  • Sharing TipsTree with people who you think different as you do. 

New kind of social network, social media and social networking platform.

story:
Success! Funded! 

We have blown past our goal! Most of our customers had to order directly from us and we have blown way past our initial goal.   

We also have accepted investment and have several more offers rolling in. 
Thank you for supporting this amazing technology, and we couldn't have done it without you!
  
For more info, visit www.translatelive.com/ILA

 

 

 

 

 

Live automated language translation uses state of the art Translate Live artificial intelligence. Works when you speak or type through the software on ILA devices.  The app tracks only the talking time while it's translating, so 30 minutes of "talk time" can last for up to 3 hours. The included 1 year service plans with 30 mins per month for the ILA's roll over till you reach the total 360 mins. After that, 1 year renewal plans start at only $99.

The 2-device real-time translation lets you verify the accuracy of the conversation as it is seen on the two screens: 

 

 

 

 

 

Supporting accents and dialects is one of the reasons ILA is so much more accurate than any other translation products on the market. Picking an accent/dialect ensures the speech-to-text engine to be more accurate and translate better.

Translating to/from the following 120 languages, accents and dialects are supported:

 

 

 

 

 

ILA Pro adds real-time communication capabilities to your business. No more awkward waiting time for translation. The pre-loaded ILA software on two screens on both sides of the device helps to make the translation faster and easier since it is ready to go.

 

 

 

 

ILA Pro

 

  1. Press the button and start speaking in your preferred language.
  2. Your speech shows up in text format for you to ensure it’s correct.
  3. The translated text shows up to the person on the other side with the option to be read out loud.
  4. The second person presses the button to respond in their preferred language.

 

 

​

 

The ILA devices and service can benefit several groups with disabilities including but not limited to Deaf, Hard Of Hearing, Blind and Deaf/Blind individuals.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

If your organization would like to order 5 or more ILA’s or would like to talk to us about integrating TranslateLive into your current systems please contact us at sales@translatelive.com.

 

We are also looking for ILA resellers globally so if interested please send us an email.

 

 

 

 

 

Our goal is and always has been to make it easier for everyone to communicate, no matter their language or ability. We hope you will continue to support us during this exciting time and be sure to tell everyone about the ILA devices. These products will only get better over time since the software and server-based updates will be automatic for everyone no matter when they get their ILA devices. 

 

From all of us who were involved in the creation and making of the ILA, we would like to truly thank everyone who has backed this project. This wouldn’t be possible without your support. 

We can’t wait until the day you open and use your ILA for the first time and are AMAZED!

story:
The one commonality we are share is our collective consciousness. Our ability to connect globally instantly from anywhere at anytime via mobile app, makes this a landmark time in our history.

We may all experience having the same or very similar ideas, shared visions, epiphanies, in some cases dreams, and even premonitions in close proximity time wise to one another. Each of us connected, though we may be separated by thousands of miles, oceans, mountains and continents.

Here is a example of the Collective Consciousness Mobile App. Display



Now is the time:

For the first time ever, together with your help, support and participation using The Collective Consciousness mobile app.  we can measure, explore, and map our collective consciousness in realtime, on a global scale.

Having measurable indisputable evidence of our collective consciousness could bring about dramatic and possibly far reaching changes in all areas of the humanities, and potentially, every other area of living.


The Collective Consciousness Mobile App.

Connecting our collective consciousness like never before.

Be it the arts, science or technology, we all share in the larger vision, a collective consciousness. Have you ever had an idea or dream come into fruition? Have you ever made a prediction that came true? Do you feel this phenomenon now growing exponentially? You are not alone.

Together using the Collective Consciousness Mobile App. we can identify, measure and map our collective consciousness in realtime on a global scale.

The Goal: Connecting our collective consciousness like never before.

The Objectives: Create a social media mobile app and algorithmic software. Identify, measure and map our collective consciousness.

Let Your Consciousness Stream: Easily post and share your thoughts, visions, dreams, hypotheses, predictions, concepts, ideas and connect with other contributors.

Each Collective Consciousness Mobile App. participant will have access to forums, groups, collected data, interviews with special guests and featured participants. The Collective Consciousness Mobile App. will collect and process bio algorithmic data created in realtime from participants input.

Let's Play a Game: Random number data generated from games and puzzles played by participants will be added to input data representing sub conscious contribution. A graphic color meter will reveal a measured global collective consciousness, more detailed analysis will be separated categorically.

No Membership Required: Become a basic user and remain private.

Become a Member: Network with others, join and form groups. Choose to be visible to other members or remain private.

Looking forward to your participation.

Thank You.

The Collective Consciousness Mobile App.

Connecting our collective consciousness like never before.


A few words about the author of this campaign.

Christopher Bejole is a musician, recording artist, producer and author.

How we are all connected has always been his passion.

story:
**** Please use our updated FIXED FUNDING campaign link below ****

Please click here for the FIXED Indiegogo campaign

 : The SolarCooler :

The world’s first solar-powered refrigerating cooler

A new technology revolutionizing Vaccine Transport and redefining the beach cooler

We have developed a revolutionary technology that we hope will significantly impact how vaccines are transported around the world.  

Help us get the Solar Refrigeration movement off the ground! We believe that in this era, access to refrigeration is not a privilege, but a right for the entire world to enjoy.  This is why we have worked so hard designing  and refining our technology into a portable rugged package for anyone to use.  Whether you are transporting valuable vaccines across the globe, or keeping your beer cold on a relaxing summer day.

: Adopt a Vaccine SolarCooler in Action :

There are many ways that you can help us make a difference.  we are offering the opportunity to sponsor a pilot run of our first Vaccine SolarCoolers thought medical camps in Africa.  as an individual, you can sponsor the Vaccine SolarCooelers by having your name or phrase printed on the cooler for $2 per letter.  for example "in loving memory of Helen Taylor" printed on the side of our Vaccine SolarCooler will help get this project off the ground.  if you are a corporation and want to be a sponsor, you can put a logo on the cooler for $100 per square inch.  Each sponsor will be able to track their Vaccine SolarCoolers through their journey, and receive photo updates of the SolarCoolers in action.

: Robin Hood business model :

A percentage of each SolarCooler sale will go towards providing those in developing countries without the luxury of a power grid with their very own SolarCooler.

______________________________________________________________________

Are you an Explorer, Tailgater, boater, or overall gadget buff?

Below is some information on the consumer version of the SolarCooler!

Who needs ice? Make your own with the power of the sun! Enjoy refrigeration that’s clean, green, and free!

...Did we mention it can also power your USB and 12v DC accessories? 


Check out the production model with optional beach wheel kit, featured at CES:


*more images in our gallery section

Below is an image of the early prototype:

*more images in our Gallery section.

How can you help?

This development has gone as far as it can go, and now we need your help!  The SolarCooler is ready for production, but that last funding hurdle still needs to be jumped.  This is where you guys come in:  if enough people purchase a SolarCooler, I can flip the switch on for manufacturing not only the recreational cooler, but the cooler that will make medical vaccine transport possible.

We need to sell a minimum of 250 coolers to break even on the costs of materials and tooling that it takes to produce the SolarCooler.  Once we reach our goal (and hopefully, exceed!), we can start cranking away on manufacturing and shipping!

The Impact:

So what's the impact that portable, solar-powered refrigeration can have?  Good question… its huge, and the benefits span much further than cold beer for the beach.  We intend implement our technology into the cold chain, transporting vaccines safely around the world and into the hands of those in need.  Much of this world is without the luxury of a power grid at their fingertips, and we plan on providing these developing countries with the basic need of refrigeration for their perishables and medications.  Aside from this, we can also bring light into their home at night by powering LED lighting that’s plugged into the SolarCooler.

And in the consumer market, our goal is to change how the world perceives refrigeration and power.  In this day and age, we believe everyone should have the luxury of portable refrigeration. The SolarCooler allows you to be free to explore, camp, boat, tailgate, and hit the beach without worrying about ice or running out of cell phone battery. Need ice for a game, day drink, or margarita? The SolarCooler will make the ice AND power the blender.

Interested in technical details on how this baby works?

We use our advanced power path management circuity to harmonize the load demands of the refrigeration process, the inflow of photovoltaic energy, and energy storage in the internal batteries.  The SolarCooler uses a highly efficient variable speed vapor-compression refrigeration cycle.  Our solar panels are high quality flexible and durable.

You can find lots more information about how the SolarCooler works in our Gallery section.  If you are still curious, please feel free to call or email us.

that in this era, access to refrigeration is not a privilege, but a right for the
 entire world to enjoy.  This is why we have worked so hard designing  and refining our technology into a portable rugged package for anyone to use.  Whether you are transporting valuable vaccines 
across the globe, or keeping your beer cold on a relaxing summer day.: Adopt a Vaccine SolarCooler in Action :There are many ways that you can help us make a difference.  we are offering the opportunity to sponsor a pilot run of our first Vaccine SolarCoolers thought medical camps in Africa.  as an individual, you can sponsor the Vaccine SolarCooelers by having your name or phrase printed on the cooler for $2 per letter.  for example "in loving memory of Helen Taylor" printed on the side of our Vaccine SolarCooler will help get this project off the ground.  if you are a corporation and want to be a sponsor, you can put a logo on the cooler for $100 per square inch.  Each sponsor will be able to track their Vaccine SolarCoolers through their journey, and receive photo updates of the SolarCoolers in action.: Robin Hood business model :A percentage of each SolarCooler sale will go towards providing those in developing countries without the luxury of a power grid with their very own SolarCooler.______________________________________________________________________Are you an Explorer, Tailgater, boater, or overall gadget buff? Below is some information on the consumer version of the SolarCooler!Who needs ice? Make your own with the power of the sun! Enjoy refrigeration that’s clean, green, and free!...Did we mention it can also power your USB and 12v DC accessories? Check out the production model with optional beach wheel kit, featured at CES:*more images in our gallery sectionBelow is an image of the early prototype: 
*more images in our Gallery section.How can you help?
This development has gone as far as it can go, and now we need your help!  The SolarCooler is ready for production, but that last funding hurdle still needs to be jumped.  This is where you guys come in:  if enough people purchase a SolarCooler, I can flip the switch on for manufacturing not only the recreational cooler, but the cooler that will make medical vaccine transport possible. 
We need to sell a minimum of 250 coolers to break even on the costs of materials and tooling that it takes to produce the SolarCooler.  Once we reach our goal (and hopefully, exceed!), we can start cranking away on manufacturing and shipping!
The Impact:
So what's the impact that portable, solar-powered refrigeration can have?  Good question… its huge, and the benefits span much further than cold beer for the beach.  We intend implement our technology into the cold chain, transporting vaccines safely around the world and into the hands of those in need.  Much of this world is without the luxury of a power grid at their fingertips, and we plan on providing these developing countries with the basic need of refrigeration for their perishables and medications.  Aside from this, we can also bring light into their home at night by powering LED lighting that’s plugged into the SolarCooler.
And in the consumer market, our goal is to change how the world perceives refrigeration and power.  In this day and age, we believe everyone should have the luxury of portable refrigeration. The SolarCooler allows you to be free to explore, camp, boat, tailgate, and hit the beach without worrying about ice or running out of cell phone battery. Need ice for a game, day drink, or margarita? The SolarCooler will make the ice AND power the blender. 
Interested in technical details on how this baby works?
We use our advanced power path management circuity to harmonize the load demands of the refrigeration process, the inflow of photovoltaic energy, and energy storage in the internal batteries.  The SolarCooler uses a highly efficient variable speed vapor-compression refrigeration cycle.  Our solar panels are high quality flexible and durable.You can find lots more information about how the SolarCooler works in our Gallery section.  If you are still curious, please feel free to call or email us.

story:
2014-04-19 Update: We are currently in the planning phase of a second production run. Please visit our site and register if you'd like to be notified when preorders start.

2013-09-08 Update: Thank you all for a great campaign.

2013-08-22 Update: More units of M1 available now.

2013-08-19 Update: If you didn't get a chance to pre-order before 600 units on Indiegogo SOLD OUT, send us a message.

2013-08-17 Update: All 600 Units On Indiegogo Sold Out!


NO ODD Top Cover

 

Who is NCASE?

We are a couple of guys with an interest in hardware and design that connected while discussing what we wanted from a small form-factor (SFF) computer case. We felt that the available cases were either too big, too limited, or too lacking in the aesthetics department. So we set out to design our own SFF case, with input from the community of hardware enthusiasts at [H]ardForum. After months of R&D, through numerous iterations, then a successful prototype crowdfunding campaign and product testing, we've arrived: the NCASE M1 is ready for production!

Now is your chance to own the first ever case developed with direct community involvement - by and for the users. Your support in bringing this project into reality will help show case manufacturers that this kind of community-oriented development can work and result in better products.

If you supported us during the prototype campaign or during development, thank you!

 

The NCASE M1

The M1 is a mini-ITX, small form-factor case that doesn't sacrifice compact dimensions to support high-end hardware. Thanks to its innovative design, the M1 is able to support some of the most powerful PC components available, while still allowing tremendous build flexibility in a surprisingly small footprint. With its refined, understated aesthetics and quality all-aluminum construction, the NCASE M1 is the premiere choice for the discerning enthusiast.


High performance in a small footprint

In terms of performance-per-liter, the M1 surpasses every other case of its size. With support for long graphics cards (12"+) and high-performance CPU coolers, it sets a new benchmark for small form-factor cases.

This remarkable space efficiency is thanks to the careful arrangement of internal components: to minimize height while maintaining support for large CPU coolers, the power supply is mounted at the front, with an internal power cable routed to the rear. An opening cut in the front of the chassis allows for a graphics card to use virtually the entire length of the case, and makes installation of long cards much easier. Other space-saving features include the vertically-mounted slim optical drive (or optionally, an additional 2.5" drive), which uses the otherwise unoccupied space behind the front panel.

A standout feature is the capability to mount a dual 120mm radiator internally, providing the ultimate in high-end CPU cooling - an unprecedented feature in a case of this size, unmatched even by cases twice as large! This level of cooling performance has never been seen in an SFF before, and truly sets the M1 apart from other SFF cases.


The freedom to build

Unlike most SFF cases which only allow a limited selection of configurations and components, the M1 was designed from the outset with flexibility in mind. Whether it's a multitude of drives, high-performance air cooling, or even custom water cooling, the M1 gives you the freedom to choose what's important in your build.

This flexibility is exemplified in the multi-use space at the bottom of the case, which has integrated mounts for up to two 120mm fans, but may also be used for a variety of combinations of 3.5" drive, 2.5" drives, and 80/92mm fans. There's even a third expansion slot - for fan controllers, for example, or to use a dual-slot graphics card and second expansion card (on boards that support it, e.g., Mini-DTX).

Another example is the multi-function side bracket that can be configured for more airflow using its dual 120mm fan mounts, or for additional 3.5" hard drives with the removable drive cage.

Building an SFF can often be a challenge, but the M1 makes it straightforward, thanks to the removable exterior panels. All four exterior panels - front, top, left and right - are virtually toolless and easily removed, while staying firmly secured when attached.

The versatility of the M1 is without peer in the world of SFF cases, and allows the freedom to tailor a build to a variety of tastes.


Design, refined

Special attention was paid to the aesthetic design of the M1: from the sleek, subtly-angled front panel, to the virtual absence of visible screws - no detail was overlooked.

With an elegantly understated design, the M1 will appeal to those whose taste runs towards a more refined aesthetic. The brushed aluminum exterior flirts with minimalism, yet retains an identity and sense of purpose. Rather than detract from it, the air vents on the top and sides incorporate the needed cooling into the case in a symmetric, cohesive whole. Aside from the air vents, the simple, linear slot for the top-loading optical drive is the only other feature at the top of the case.

 

Specifications


Dimensions: 240 * 160 * 328mm, 12.6L (250 * 160 * 338mm overall)
Motherboard support: Mini-ITX, Mini-DTX
Liquid cooling support: Single 120mm or 240mm slim radiator
PSU: SFX, ATX (limited)
Drives:
3 x 3.5" mounts:

  • 1 on case floor
  • 2 in removable side bracket (cannot be used with dual radiator)

3 x 2.5" mounts:

  • 1 inside chassis front
  • 1 behind front panel (in place of optical drive)
  • 1 on case bottom (in place of 3.5" drive)
  • included double-stacking bracket allows 2 x 2.5" drives on one mount (depending on drive thickness)

Vertically mounted slim slot-load optical drive


Fans:

  • 4 120mm fan mounts
  • 2 on side bracket
  • 2 on case bottom (in place of 3.5" drive)
  • 1 x 80/92mm fan mount (bottom)
  • 1 x 80/92mm fan mount (rear)

Front ports: 2 x USB 3.0, microphone and headphone jacks
Power button: red/blue power/drive activity LED
Material: aluminum

 

Size restrictions and recommendations:

CPU Cooler:

  • Top-down coolers are recommended.
  • Height restriction: 130mm
  • Cooler cannot extend past the top of the board by more than 10mm. For many larger coolers, this limits motherboard choice to those with centrally-located sockets.
  • Large coolers that extend past the front of the board will prevent the 3.5" HDD cage from being used.

Watercooling:

  • Sealed liquid coolers or integrated pump/block and radiator/res recommended.
  • Single 120mm or 240mm radiators only.
  • Thinner radiators only (under 40mm).
  • Fans in push/pull are not recommended due to space constraints.

GPU:

  • Rear exhaust cards recommended.
  • Max length: 12.5" (slots 1 & 2), 11" (slot 3)
  • Max width:
    -For cards up to 11.5" in the first or second slot: 5.5" (4.7" at the PCIe power connectors)
    -For cards up to 12.5" or cards in the third slot: 4.4"

Power supply:

  • SFX up to 130mm, modular or non-modular.
  • ATX support via included bracket is limited to 140mm non-modular PSUs with cards longer than 200mm. ATX PSUs are not recommended due to limited room for long cables. Caution: the AC inlet orientation on some ATX power supplies may prevent the angle plug from fitting, please check carefully. See this image.

 

 

Feature images:

 

 

 

 

 

Example hardware installations:

 

 

 

 

 

Silver exterior images:

 

 

 

 

 

Additional images:

 

 

 

*Images are for illustrative purposes only. PC components shown are not included. All trademarks are the property of their respective owners. Coke can not included.

 

FAQ

Q: Why is the M1 shipping in January?

A: It take more than 70 days to manufacture and ship the M1 into USA, where we send to customers. We chose a late delivery date to be conservative and mindful of potential problems that are unforeseeable.

 

Q: Will I be able to get the final production M1 shipped to Europe/elsewhere? 

A: Yes.

 

Q: What about Duty and VAT for shipping to Europe/elsewhere? 

A: The buyer is responsible for all fees.


Q: Will the M1 be available to buy some other way than through participating in the production campaign?

A: We have no plans at this time to make the M1 available beyond the crowdfunding campaign.  We are currently planning a second production run, with preorders on our website beginning in late April/early May, and production beginning in June. Visit our site and register your email if you'd like to be notified.


Design/Compatibility Questions


Q: Mini-ITX boards only have one expansion slot and video cards usually only use two, so why does the case have three slots?

A: To accomodate the following:
- GPUs with triple-slot coolers
- Slot mounted accessories, e.g. fan controllers
- Mini-DTX motherboards (which allows a second card in addition to a dual slot GPU)
- Drives / fans / cables (not wasted space if third slot is left unused)



Q: Since it has three slots already, why not just add one more and make it microATX?

A: MicroATX boards are not just one more slot, they are also much longer than Mini-ITX (244mm vs. 170mm). The extra space required for an mATX board is occupied by the power supply; changing the design to accommodate the larger board would necessitate an unacceptable increase in size (and would result in a layout very much like the Silverstone SG09).


Q: Will the Swiftech H220 fit? Will the Corsair H100 fit? Can two closed-loop liquid coolers be installed in the case?

A: The M1 is compatible with both the Swiftech H220 and Corsair H100. It's unlikely that two single 120mm closed loop coolers will fit, however


Q: What thickness of radiator will fit?

A: It's best to stay with slim radiators only (i.e., under 35mm thick), though thicker may fit.


Q: Can a radiator be mounted on the bottom?

A: It's possible, but it's DIY territory. It would require GPU watercooling, a slim radiator (30mm), and slim fans.


Q: Will a pump and/or reservoir fit inside the case?

A: Depending on the parts used, it's possible to mount certain pumps and/or reservoirs internally.


Q: Can a modular ATX power supply be used?

A: A longer GPU will hit the modular plugs, so that's the limiting factor.



Q: What is the case made from?

A: Anodized 1.5mm aluminum.



Q: Who will be manufacturing the case?

A: Lian Li.


Q: Will it come with fan filters?

A: Yes, filters are included.

story:
NOW AVAILABLE ON OUR ONLINE STORE

Our Indiegogo campaign is over, but you can still order your own TargetVision Wireless Spotting Camera on our website at www.targetvision.myshopify.com 

Thanks again to all of our contributors.  We will be shipping no later than March 26th.  Please allow 1-2 weeks for shipping and delivery for new orders from our website.

We will be adding more products and accessories over the next several weeks so stay tuned!



THE STORY

As you’d expect, the story of TARGETVISION began on a gun range, where the founders, Clay, Richard and James, were practicing their marksmanship.  The year was 2012.  

As the frustration of having to use a spotting scope and having to wait for other shooters to change a target took hold, the founders began brainstorming ways that they could simplify and enhance the range experience while improving their skills at the same time.  Why do we have to use spotting scopes, isn’t there an easier way to see our shots?  Why can’t something tell us which shot was our most recent? -- And thus, The idea for TARGETVISION was born.

The founders envision a new kind of shooting experience where technology is used to not only simplify the shooting experience, but to enhance it as well.  Imagine being able to stay set on your rfle and clearly seeing you shot up to a mile away, an app that could always tell you which shot was your last, taking snapshots or recordings of your shooting session and saving them to review later or share with friends, never having to go down range again to change a target, and playing darts or battleship with your friends and having an app to keep track of and score your shots.  Those are just some of the things that you can look forward to from TARGETVISION. 

WHAT IS TARGETVISION?

TARGETVISION is a fixed lens, portable, battery powered, wireless target camera that can be viewed from a phone, tablet or laptop. With a range of one mile, a run time of 16+ hours and a starting price of $1295. TARGETVISION is the perfect companion for long range shooters, competitive shooters, and people who are looking for a more interactive and entertaining shooting experience. This unit is able to clearly see .17 caliber bullet holes and larger at any distance up to a mile. TARGETVISION consists of two pieces, the transmitter/camera and the receiver. The transmitter sits down range about 10-15 feet from the target and can be moved within that range to adjust the field of view. The receiver is built into the carrying case and sits next to the shooter while shooting.

SET UP - COULD IT BE ANY EASIER?

TARGETVISION replaces the spotting scope and may even be easier to setup.  In three easy steps you could be up an going with your very own TARGETVISION . 

1. Power -- Turn on the TARGETVISION camera and receiver 

2. Connect -- Connect your phone or tablet to your TARGETVISION system’s WiFi network

3. Aim -- Take TARGETVISION down range with you when setting up your target and aim the camera throught the app to get the exact view that you want

4. Enjoy -- Shoot with an ease and enjoyment you couldn’t have imagined possible! - this one doesn’t really count as a step ;)

FEATURES

Revolutionizing the shooting experience one feature at a time

See your target with a clarity and ease never possible before.  Increase your trigger time and reduce the variables.  With TARGETVISION you never have to get off of your gun to see where you hit, just glance over at the screen and immediately know where you hit.

Shot Recognition - Always know which shot was your last.  Shot recognition highlights and numbers each shot so you always know which shot was your most recent

Multiple Users - TARGETVISION allows multiple people to log into one camera system and view the same target.  This is a great tool for training, shooting with a group, or showing off...

Multiple Cameras - View multiple cameras at one time or scroll through them as you change targets or train multiple shooters

Snapshot/Record - Take snapshots and record your shooting sessions to review later or share with friends.

Share - Share your photos and videos through messaging, Facebook, and other social media.

Group Marking - Keep track of your groups with the easy to use group marking feature.  This will color code each group of shots that you designate as you shoot.

Shooting Sessions - Keep track of how you shoot each time you go to the range by creating albums that categorize your pictures and videos while allowing you to add information about where you were, how far you were shooting, and any other custom information that you would like to include.



We began developing TARGETVISION almost two years ago and have come a long way since then.  We are finally ready to share our product with the world and we hope you enjoy it as much as we do.  Below you will find pictures of some of our initial prototypes.

R1

R2

R2.1

R3


We are finally ready to launch our product and we need your help to do so.  We manufacture all of our units in our shop in Houston, Texas.  This has its advantages and disadvantages, but what it really means is that we don't have to raise a ridiculous amount of money to get TARGETVISION into your hands.  We have already refined our design and our manufacturing process, so if you pledge for a unit you're going to get a unit!

The primary reason that we are using Indiegogo is to help raise awareness around  our launch and to help plan our first production run as accurately as possible.  You can help us with this by sharing our campaign with your friends and spreading the word through social media.

We are looking forward to a great campaign and hearing your feedback about our design and product!


We have developed a proprietary long range link methodology that allows us to communicate at such long distances.

• How does my device connect to the system? 

Via WiFi, each system has a unique WiFi name that coordinates to the unit serial number. You connect to your systems network and then use the app to view the camera.

• How do you compare to the competition?

There are a few key differences between our system and the others that exist:  

1. TARGETVISION is the ONLY system that is able to be viewed on a smartphone and tablet

2. We have the longest run time of 16+ hours

3. The system is extremely easy to set up 

4. Our app. With shot highlighting and marking options, the ability to zoom in and out, record and capture images, and share via facebook, text or email, no other system comes close when it comes to capability 

5. High resolution camera

• What if I shoot the camera?

Unfortunately, our systems are not bullet proof. If the system was to be shot it would have to be sent in for repair or be replaced.  It is unlikely that you will hit the camera though, because it sits on the ground and does not have to be directly in front of the target (or the path of the bullet).

• Is the system waterproof?

The case is waterproof and the camera is weather resistant. It will survive a rainstorm but not a flood.

• What is your warranty?

We offer a one year warranty against manufacturing defects.

• Does the camera sit on my shooting bench?

No, the camera sits down range about 10-15 feet from the target and can be moved within that range to adjust the field of view. The receiver is built into the carrying case and sits next to the shooter while shooting.

• What if I don’t have cell service?

No Problem!  TARGETVISION doesn’t require cell service.  Our system creates it’s own WiFi network that your phone or tablet then uses to view the camera.  It is important to know, however, that your device will lose the ability to connect to or use any internet based services when connected to TARGETVISION because TARGETVISION’s WiFi does not have a data connection and when WiFi is enabled, cellular data is disabled. 

• Where do I add money for international shipping?

When you select a contribution level, you're prompted to enter in the total contribution amount just below.  This is for people that want international shipping, or if you want to toss a few extra bucks our way just to be nice.

What if I forgot to add international shipping?

After the project is funded and we're ready to ship, we'll contact each contributor to confirm shipping details.  If you didn't add shipping when you contributed, you can add it then.
story_txt:
NOW AVAILABLE ON OUR ONLINE STOREOur Indiegogo campaign is over, but you can still order your own TargetVision Wireless Spotting Camera on our website at www.targetvision.myshopify.com Thanks again to all of our contributors.  We will be shipping no later than March 26th.  Please allow 1-2 weeks for shipping and delivery for new orders from our website.We will be adding more products and accessories over the next several weeks so stay tuned!THE STORYAs you’d expect, the story of TARGETVISION began on a gun range, where the founders, Clay, Richard and James, were practicing their marksmanship.  The year was 2012.  As the frustration of having to use a spotting scope and having to wait for other shooters to change a target took hold, the founders began brainstorming ways that they could simplify and enhance the range experience while improving their skills at the same time.  Why do we have to use spotting scopes, isn’t there an easier way to see our shots?  Why can’t something tell us which shot was our most recent? -- And thus, The idea for TARGETVISION was born.The founders envision a new kind of shooting experience where technology is used to not only simplify the shooting experience, but to enhance it as well.  Imagine being able to stay set on your rfle and clearly seeing you shot up to a mile away, an app that could always tell you which shot was your last, taking snapshots or recordings of your shooting session and saving them to review later or share with friends, never having to go down range again to change a target, and playing darts or battleship with your friends and having an app to keep track of and score your shots.  Those are just some of the things that you can look forward to from TARGETVISION. WHAT IS TARGETVISION?TARGETVISION is a fixed lens, portable, battery powered, wireless target camera that can be viewed from a phone, tablet or laptop. With a range of one mile, a run time of 16+ hours and a starting price of $1295. TARGETVISION is the perfect companion for long range shooters, competitive shooters, and people who are looking for a more interactive and entertaining shooting experience. This unit is able to clearly see .17 caliber bullet holes and larger at any distance up to a mile. TARGETVISION consists of two pieces, the transmitter/camera and the receiver. The transmitter sits down range about 10-15 feet from the target and can be moved within that range to adjust the field of view. The receiver is built into the carrying case and sits next to the shooter while shooting.SET UP - COULD IT BE ANY EASIER?TARGETVISION replaces the spotting scope and may even be easier to setup.  In three easy steps you could be up an going with your very own TARGETVISION . 1. Power -- Turn on the TARGETVISION camera and receiver 2. Connect -- Connect your phone or tablet to your TARGETVISION system’s WiFi network3. Aim -- Take TARGETVISION down range with you when setting up your target and aim the camera throught the app to get the exact view that you want4. Enjoy -- Shoot with an ease and enjoyment you couldn’t have imagined possible! - this one doesn’t really count as a step ;)FEATURESRevolutionizing the shooting experience one feature at a timeSee your target with a clarity and ease never possible before.  Increase your trigger time and reduce the variables.  With TARGETVISION you never have to get off of your gun to see where you hit, just glance over at the screen and immediately know where you hit.Shot Recognition - Always know which shot was your last.  Shot recognition highlights and numbers each shot so you always know which shot was your most recentMultiple Users - TARGETVISION allows multiple people to log into one camera system and view the same target.  This is a great tool for training, shooting with a group, or showing off...Multiple Cameras - View multiple cameras at one time or scroll through them as you change targets or train multiple shootersSnapshot/Record - Take snapshots and record your shooting sessions to review later or share with friends.Share - Share your photos and videos through messaging, Facebook, and other social media.Group Marking - Keep track of your groups with the easy to use group marking feature.  This will color code each group of shots that you designate as you shoot.Shooting Sessions - Keep track of how you shoot each time you go to the range by creating albums that categorize your pictures and videos while allowing you to add information about where you were, how far you were shooting, and any other custom information that you would like to include.We began developing TARGETVISION almost two years ago and have come a long way since then.  We are finally ready to share our product with the world and we hope you enjoy it as much as we do.  Below you will find pictures of some of our initial prototypes.R1R2R2.1R3We are finally ready to launch our product and we need your help to do so.  We manufacture all of our units in our shop in Houston, Texas.  This has its advantages and disadvantages, but what it really means is that we don't have to raise a ridiculous amount of money to get TARGETVISION into your hands.  We have already refined our design and our manufacturing process, so if you pledge for a unit you're going to get a unit!The primary reason that we are using Indiegogo is to help raise awareness around  our launch and to help plan our first production run as accurately as possible.  You can help us with this by sharing our campaign with your friends and spreading the word through social media.We are looking forward to a great campaign and hearing your feedback about our design and product!We have developed a proprietary long range link methodology that allows us to communicate at such long distances.• How does my device connect to the system? Via WiFi, each system has a unique WiFi name that coordinates to the unit serial number. You connect to your systems network and then use the app to view the camera.• How do you compare to the competition?There are a few key differences between our system and the others that exist:  1. TARGETVISION is the ONLY system that is able to be viewed on a smartphone and tablet2. We have the longest run time of 16+ hours3. The system is extremely easy to set up 4. Our app. With shot highlighting and marking options, the ability to zoom in and out, record and capture images, and share via facebook, text or email, no other system comes close when it comes to capability 5. High resolution camera• What if I shoot the camera?Unfortunately, our systems are not bullet proof. If the system was to be shot it would have to be sent in for repair or be replaced.  It is unlikely that you will hit the camera though, because it sits on the ground and does not have to be directly in front of the target (or the path of the bullet).• Is the system waterproof?The case is waterproof and the camera is weather resistant. It will survive a rainstorm but not a flood.• What is your warranty?We offer a one year warranty against manufacturing defects.• Does the camera sit on my shooting bench?No, the camera sits down range about 10-15 feet from the target and can be moved within that range to adjust the field of view. The receiver is built into the carrying case and sits next to the shooter while shooting.• What if I don’t have cell service?No Problem!  TARGETVISION doesn’t require cell service.  Our system creates it’s own WiFi network that your phone or tablet then uses to view the camera.  It is important to know, however, that your device will lose the ability to connect to or use any internet based services when connected to TARGETVISION because TARGETVISION’s WiFi does not have a data connection and when WiFi is enabled, cellular data is disabled. • Where do I add money for international shipping?When you select a contribution level, you're prompted to enter in the total contribution amount just below.  This is for people that want international shipping, or if you want to toss a few extra bucks our way just to be nice.
What if I forgot to add international shipping?After the project is funded and we're ready to ship, we'll contact each contributor to confirm shipping details.  If you didn't add shipping when you contributed, you can add it then.

story:
We have revolutionized the traditional power strip with the POWERQUBE. The POWERQUBE is a revolutionary, electrical power and charging system that allows you to charge up to 9 devices simultaneously through 3 USB ports and 6 electrical outlets. The sleek design of the POWERQUBE means you don’t have to try to hide it.  

The POWERQUBE is a smart device.  The custom designed and patented USB PC board is engineered with the capability to independently interpret and negotiate the charging demand for any device plugged into any of the USB plugs, simultaneously. The USB plugs have the capability to quick-charge three iPads independently, and simultaneously.  THE POWERQUBE TRULY IS A SMART DEVICE! 


The POWERQUBE is compact enough that you can place it on your desk, conference table, kitchen counter, nightstand, and dorm room desk; anywhere you need power management and USB charging capabilities. At 5 inches by 2 inches, it can easily fit into your backpack or briefcase.

The POWERQUBE is the only product on the market today that allows you to plug in 9 devices at one time.  The POWERQUBE allows you to charge 3 iPads via the 3 USB ports simultaneously! How does it do that you ask? It’s a smart device that senses the power requirements for each device and negotiates the power to each USB port independently; ELIMINATING the need to mark the USB ports with "Standard" and "Tablet" indicators on the POWERQUBE.

With 5 feet of cable and a flat wall plug, you can easily plug in the POWERQUBE behind a desk or piece of furniture and still put the device directly on your desk, conference table, countertop or nightstand with ease.

THE POWERQUBE STORY

In January of 2011, GENIE PRODUCTS LLC began the creative process of designing a 21st century electrical charging device geared towards personal electronic devices: tablets, smart phones, iPods™, iPads™, iTouches™ etc.  The idea was to build a power charging system that would solve multiple problems that exist with the traditional power strip.  Sounds simple, and it is, however the traditional power strip has not been updated to meet modern demands for almost 30 years.  The first prototype included a retractable power cord, a multi-tap AC plug-in, and one USB port.  

Through the creative process, POWERQUBE started to build significant momentum and a local design engineering firm, Advance Design LLC, was hired to evolve the original prototype.  Keeping with the original idea of a retractable cord, and additional AC plug-ins, two additional prototypes were developed.

Through intensive consumer testing, we have finally evolved to what we have today, the POWERQUBE.  The POWERQUBE is a revolutionary 21st century charging device that brings the power source off of the floor, and places it on the desktop, countertop, nightstand, and or kitchen counter.  No more crawling on the floor to find an available plug or power source; we have already solved a huge challenge that has never been addressed with the traditional power strip.  

WHY THE POWERQUBE?! - FEATURES AND BENEFITS OF THE POWERQUBE

Think of the current household in the United States, and in all developed countries: multiple cell phones, iPads®, iPhones®, iTouches®, iPods®, and laptop computers.  All of these devices need to be charged throughout the day and at night.  Now think about the next problem at hand, all of these chargers have very short charging cords.  The typical Apple® charging cord is less than 40 inches long, the average cell phone charging cord is less than 50 inches long, it is almost impossible to use these devices while they are charging, and you NEVER have one central charging station where you can charge all of these devices at one time.  The POWERQUBE™ is a compact device, 5 inches by 2 inches, and can easily fit into your backpack or briefcase for travel.  Incorporated in the POWERQUBE™ is an additional feature that the traditional power strip does not address: charging via USB plugs.  

All mobile and tablet devices in today’s world are charged via USB plugs; again simple, but not solved with the traditional power strip.  The POWERQUBE™ has three USB charging outlets, and can charge, but not limited to, all Apple®, Android®, and Samsung® devices via the USB plugs. 

PROVEN CONSUMER MARKET RESEARCH IN WORLDWIDE 

Global Consumer Market research has been conducted with the POWERQUBE.  The functionality, practical application, and cosmetic appeal of the POWERQUBE have all been received exceptionally well.  POWERQUBE units have ALREADY been pre-sold in 12 countries across the world.  Demographics range from 14 to 79, with 58% male and 42% female.  Over 2,000 consumers worldwide have been surveyed.  Consumers worldwide have stated that the POWERQUBE meets demands that have never been addressed and that they have been seeking to solve for years.  POWERQUBE has been tested and proved in both concept and design worldwide.

POWERQUBE INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY AND PATENT PROTECTION

The experienced Indianapolis based law firm of Brannon & Robinson has been retained to ensure POWERQUBE™ intellectual property and patent protection worldwide, including China, Hong Kong, Canada, Japan, South Korea, Taiwan, India, Singapore, UAE and the EU.  Multiple patents have been filed for both design and utility for the POWERQUBE™, as there is tremendous value within the intellectual property that has been developed.  

A custom power supply and power conversion board have been configured and built exclusively for the POWERQUBE™. Patents have been filed for both board configurations as well. The POWERQUBE™ name and logo are being trademarked worldwide.  Trademark applications have been filed in all countries China, Hong Kong, Canada, Japan, South Korea, Taiwan, India, Singapore, UAE and the EU.    

Brannon Robinson (BR) is the result of two merging law firms, Brannon Sowers & Hughel PC and Robinson & Doss, LLC in 2011. BR is an intellectual property firm with a strong commitment to business and grounded in legal business principles. The Brannon firm began in 2008 with their first objective to build an intellectual property law firm staffed with experienced attorneys having a higher level of technical training and research experience than the norm. Their second objective was to provide the best intellectual property services available at costs substantially below most major law firms. As an IP law firm, BR provides full IP services in the areas of patent, trademark, copyright, trade names, cybersquatting, anti-counterfeiting, brand strategy, entertainment, and right of publicity law. 

As an IP and business law firm, BR takes the level of organization, capitalization, planning and protection to the next level for IP clients. 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

We are looking to raise at least $25,000 for research and development of our pipeline products, and for ETL certification of the POWERQUBE.  We have invested significant dollars thus far in our protoyping and in final development of the POWERQUBE; We are ready to mass maunfacture the POWERQUBE!  We are finalizing our molds and assembly process with our manufacturer; as all of this is finished and paid for!  What we want to do is deliver product to you before the Christmas Holiday, and advance our R&D process for our pipeline products that we want to launch early next year.

What you get is an early delivery POWERQUBE, before the Christmas Holiday, (POWERQUBE makes the perfect gift as well) and a deeply discounted price from what the POWERQUBE will be sold for at retail.

All dollars made from this campaign will be reinvested into our company for R&D and for product certifications.

POWERQUBE IMPACT

The POWERQUBE will make your life easier and so much more convenient!  No more looking for your power adapters, no more crawling on the floor to plug in your devices, no more slow charging with knock-off generic devices (you know what I am talking about...) with the POWERQUBE; it solves all of these dilema's and more!!  This product will be distributed throughout the world, and truly is a one-of-a-kind device!  

YOU will love your POWERQUBE!  I guarantee it!!

ABOUT THE CREATOR

At age 54, Scott Weaver, Co-Founder and CO-CEO of Genie Products, LLC has over 34 years’ experience owning and managing a wide variety of businesses.  Scott began his career in the state & local consulting field.  By 37 he was a partner at a large regional Big 12 accounting firm. 

In 2002 he co-founded a Venture Capital firm  in Indianapolis and over the next 8 years oversaw 17 transactions that ranged from industrial processing and painting, publishing, quality services, adaptive mobility manufacturing, IT services, for profit health related schools, pet product manufacturing and distribution, flag pole manufacturing and distribution, retail, wholesale grocery distribution, transportation, and real estate.

In addition to Genie Products Scott has interest in a regional wholesale grocery company, a trucking company, a text messaging and alert company, and an IT company.

Scott is active in the local community and serves on several boards.

Scott states: "Genie Products, and specifically the POWERQUBE, is the most exciting venture that I have ever been affiliated with.  I truly believe the POWERQUBE, as well as the next generation of devices in the POWERQUBE family, will revolutionize the way we charge our smart devices and better organize our charging world!" 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us get the word out about the POWERQUBE REVOLUTION!

If you cannot pledge for one of our perks today, please tell your friends about us via Facebook, twitter, or emailing our campaign link!

PLEASE use the Indiegogo share tools!
