The formula is simple: battery voltage × battery current × 90% ÷ 5V (when using 5V/1A output port, or 5.2V when using 5.2V/2.4A port). "90%" is the average efficiency of the internal boost circuit. 








User Interface - Advanced Information

With the increase of battery charge-discharge cycles, the full-charge capacity of the battery will decrease, due to the process of Li-ion. In the advanced information screen, you can not only check the charge-discharge cycle number, but also the full-charge capacity. You can roughly determine the health of the battery pack through these two variables. 
Nowadays, when you travel by air or another form of transportation, security personnel may check the design capacity and other information of your mobile power - and only compliant ones can be taken. 
We mark the design capacity of the battery pack, battery manufacturer/model, chemical type of the battery, production date, serial number and so on. Some information will simultaneously be indicated on the shell too. 





Operation - The Simpler, The Better


While it seems as if the DreamCharger has a rich functionality and information indicator screen, it's actually very easy to use our device. This provides you with a winning product that packs high-power and a soft learning curve. 
We designed only one recoil-slide switch for DreamCharger as a power and function switch, considering that when you put a mobile power device in your bag or pocket, a push-switch may cause a malfunction trigger more easily. 

How to Discharge: The only thing you need to do is connect your device to the DreamCharger, and then short-slide the switch until DreamCharger is turned on. When the discharge is over (when your devices have been charged to 'full'), you'll have no need to manually turn off the DreamCharger. It will shut down automatically after 30 seconds, once detecting the end of the discharge.How to Charge: When you want to charge the DreamCharger, simply connect an adapter to the charge port of DreamCharger. It will automatically turn on, begin to charge, and then automatically stop when charged to full.In fact - you can charge the DreamCharger at anytime that you like. However the DreamCharger cannot be charged when being discharged simultaneously. DreamCharger would then stop discharging, and change its status to charging preferentially. 
Switching Between Different Screens: Simply short-slide, or slide and hold for one second, then release. All screens can be switched by using this method. 

Low Self-Discharge - More Capacity Can be Maintained for Longer Periods of Time
Self-discharge comes from two aspects: one is battery self-discharge, and the other is the leakage current from the internal circuit, when it shuts down. SANYO UR18650F batteries (which the DreamCharger equips) has a very low self-discharge rate. 
What we have to do is minimize the leakage current when shutting down. Through our continued exploration and testing, the leakage current is reduced to less than 1uA (0.001mA). Benefiting from these two aspects, the remaining capacity can be maintained for a long time, even if you don't use the DreamCharger for a long period of time. 


Security - The Most Important Aspect of Mobile Power
Lithium is a highly reactive chemical compound, and the protection of the DreamCharger's batteries is highly important. We've placed security as a top priority from the very beginning of the DreamCharger project. Overall, the security aspect of DreamCharger can be divided into two categories of protection. The first category of protection is the high level of input/output protection. 
This includes input voltage/current protection, output current protection, and delayed start of charging protection. This is a conventional protection. 
The second category is the low level of comprehensive protection for batteries, including better voltage/current protection, thermal protection, and charge-time protection. This level of protection generally isn't necessary unless the DreamCharger malfunctions. 
 Of course, if all protection fails, there's a primitive layer of protection which the SANYO UR18650F itself provides. 
Input Protection: This protection will come into effect from the very moment that you connect a charger to the DreamCharger. The protection circuit will continue to detect the input voltage, then stop charging immediately, and disconnect the external charger once it's detected that the input voltage is higher than 6V. When you plug a damaged charger into the DreamCharger, this situation could occur.
The "automatic recognition circuit" that we've mentioned above can also be considered a form of input protection. DreamCharger will determine the type of charger that you connect to, and will then control the maximum input current, in order to protect the external adapter from being damaged. 
Delayed Start of Charging Protection: We can say that we're the first group of innovators in history to add this form of protection to mobile power. Many people may recognize the experience of the moment that you plug certain household appliances into a wall socket, and you see sparks appear. This happens because, in the absence of the plug being fully inserted into the socket, there's a relatively large contact resistance between the plug and the socket. If the device begins to work in maximum consumption at once, the large current combining with the large contact resistance will product a large amount of heat at the contact point - thereby damaging the plug or socket. 
The maximum charging current for DreamCharger is 2A, which isn't exactly a small current. If the DreamCharger begins charging with such a large current at once, it may cause a similar failure. 
So we performed a little improvement through starting the charging only after a short period of detecting the charger, once the plug has been fully inserted. This can protect your port contactor from burn or damage, because of the excessively large current and contact resistance. 
Output Protection: This protection comes into effect from the moment which you connect the DreamCharger to load. The protection circuit will continue to monitor the output current of 5V/1A and 5.2V/2.4A ports, and will then limit the output current once it's detected that the output current is greater than 1A or 2.4A. The OLED screen will indicate which port is overloading or short circuiting. 
DreamCharger can then automatically restore output when you eliminate the overload or short circuit. This usually happens when you connect a large power consumption device into the 5V/1A port. This can be easily resolved by reconnecting the device to the 5.2V/2.4A port, which meets almost all of the specifications of handheld devices. 






Cell Voltage Protection: This protection is commonly referred to as "overcharge protection" or "overdischarge protection." It could be dangerous when improper charging causes cell voltage to become too high. It could also cause damage to the cell when excessive discharging causes cell voltage to become too low, too. The cell voltage protection circuit ensures that cell voltage stays within the normal, allowable range, and cuts off the connection of cell and circuits immediately once it's detected that the voltage is out of range. 
The cell voltage will continue to rise by the charge procedure when you charge the DreamCharger. The internal charging circuit will control the cell voltage from exceeding 4.2V. The protection circuit will activate once it's detected that the cell voltage is higher than 4.35V, even if the charging circuit is failing.
Conversely, the cell voltage will decrease when DreamCharger is discharging by the decrease of the remaining capacity. Normally, DreamCharger will stop discharging and indicate a "too low remaining capacity" message on the OLED screen, when the remaining capacity becomes too low. However, if the software crashes or other anomalies occur, leading to the automatic stop due to discharge failure, the protection circuit will immediately activate, when detecting that the cell voltage is lower than 2.3V. 
Cell Current Protection: There has to be a certain limitation for the current flown into or out of the cell, otherwise danger may occur, and the cell could be damaged if this limit is exceeded. The cell current protection circuit will disconnect the battery and circuit immediately, once it's detected that excessive charging or discharging of the current occurs. 
When charging the DreamCharger, charging circuit controls the current maximum of 2A. But even if the charging circuit fails, the protection circuit will disconnect the cell from the circuit once it's detected that the charging current has exceeded 3A. Conversely, the protection circuit will disconnect the cell from the circuit once it's detected that the discharging current exceeds 6A - especially when short circuits occur. 
Cell Temperature Protection: There are different requirements of charging and discharging temperatures which are set by different types of battery chemistries, and manufacturing processes. Excessive temperatures can obviously be dangerous, and too low of temperatures may damage the cell. The cell temperature protection circuit will stop charging or discharging immediately once it's detected that the temperature of the cell is out of the allowable range. For the SANYO UR18650F, the temperature range for charging is 0℃ ~ 40℃ (32℉ ~ 104℉),
and for discharging is -20℃ ~ 60℃ (-4℉ ~ 140℉). The cell temperature protection circuit will continuously monitor the cell temperature, and will stop charging or discharging immediately once the temperature exceeds the allowable range, while also indicating a temperature message on the OLED screen. 
Tip: In some emergency situations, you may need the DreamCharger to work outside of the permitted temperature range. You can temporarily make the DreamCharger work outside the allowable range if necessary. However, we strongly recommend against this practice. The method of how to achieve this function will be indicated in the instruction manual. 





Charging Duration Protection: The charging duration from empty to full will not exceed over 16 hours, when even connecting the DreamCharger to a standard USB 2.0 port (which only provides 500mA maximum current). The charging duration protection circuit will stop charging once the charging duration reaches approximately 26 hours if the charging circuit detects failure. Overcharging could cause danger. 
Pressure Valve Protection: This ultra-low level of protection is provided by the SANYO UR18650F itself. We know that explosions are caused instantly, and generate enormous pressure. The pressure valve of the 18650 Li-ion cell is typically designed in a  position near the positive electrode. Once the cell's internal pressure rises to a dangerous level, the pressure valve will then disconnect the positive electrode and release its internal pressure. It will permanently damage the cell once this protection is triggered, but can guarantee the cell from facing danger. SANYO UR18650F has the most stable quality of pressure valve on the market, and we couldn't find that this type of Li-ion cell had experienced any form of explosion or spontaneous combustion ever before. 



Tip: Although we've mentioned many types of protection, they can also be divided into hardware and software-levels of protection. Hardware-level protection has no need to rely on the software running. This means that even if the software crashes, the hardware-level protection will still be active. It's the most reliable form of protection. The software-level protection needs to rely on the software running, and will fail once the software crashes. All the types of protection listed above are hardware-level protection except the cell temperature protection. The cell temperature protection is a software-level protection. 






DreamCharger Disassembly (Updated on 12/15/2014)

Please find more details behind DreamCharger in the "Updates".


We'll continue to update, such as the disassembly, technical details, the ways we intend to ensure high-quality for you, etc.








A Dancing DreamCharger without its "Coat" (Updated on 12/17/2014)




 
What We Need & What You'll Get We need your help, 
but we're going to help you out too. Here are the details of what we 
need to turn the dream of DreamCharger into a reality for you:  We're aiming for an overall campaign fundraising goal of $10,000. We've
 been so focused on perfecting the immaculate quality of the world's 
greatest mobile power source, that our costs have become a little bit 
high. We're mainly raising this money to craft a superior, high-quality mold 
that we will use to produce all future DreamChargers, Additionally, the money that's raised will also go towards the equipment, materials, packaging, and 
expenses associated with creating the first round of DreamChargers. Our 
team truly hopes that you can help. We also hope that you can give us 
your feedback and thoughts on the DreamCharger. We're open to hearing 
what you have to say. Please reach out to our team with any comments, 
questions or kind words. 

Here are the PERKS of donating to our campaign. 



$1 - You took away a little bit of knowledge on the science behind mobile power generation. 




$5 - Turn on your DreamCharger in style! We will compile the Software that you can display Your Very Own Logo on, each time that the DreamCharger is turned on. Logo needs to be any 128 x 64 dot matrix image in monochrome that you send to us. 

Please design your logo or have a friend create one for you (per the specified format requirements) then send it to us. 









$50 - You'll receive our EARLY BIRD DreamCharger & 0.5 Meter Type-A USB to Type-Micro USB Cable. This early bird package includes shipping charges at this price. You'll pay a flat price of $50, for a limited time only. This package is limited to the first 50 buyers. 


$50 - You can become one of the first users of DreamCharger in the world. You'll receive a Standard Edition DreamCharger & 0.5 Meter Type-A USB to Type-Micro USB Cable.
 This cable can be used to charge the Dreamcharger by connecting an 
adapter to it, or for directly charging your devices if they contain a type-micro charging and communication port. Enjoy the DreamCharger's 
powerful experience that's completely different from any other mobile 
power in the world. Add $7 for 
international delivery. Shipped free in China. 

Customers can choose their favorite color of DreamCharger by coordinating the correct color code (by typing R+R or B+W etc. when ordering this perk). 









$60 - For the hardware enthusiasts out there, you'll receive an Indiegogo Limited Edition CRYSTAL Version of the DreamCharger.
 This will be a DreamCharger with a fully transparent shell*, so that 
you can see the SANYO UR18650F cells and all internal components 
clearly. Only 100 of these will be created. You'll acquire a piece of 
DreamCharger history by choosing this campaign donation package. 
International postage not included. Add $7 for international delivery. Shipped free in China. 

        *Mirror-like cover will still be translucent. 










$95 - You'll receive Two Standard Edition DreamCharger's & Two 0.5 Meter Type-A USB to Type-Micro USB Cables. Give a DreamCharger package to a friend or family member, and make their day. Add $12 for international delivery. Shipped free in China. 




$225 - You're getting Five DreamChargers. You're a very social guy or girl with many friends! It would be pretty embarrassing if your DreamCharger were to be snatched by one of your friend's (when you were showing them its beauty). You can simply order enough DreamChargers to allow each of your friends to "rob" them from you. We'll customize the software to display one logo for you for free, so that they'll never forget that their DreamCharger was "robbed" from you! 
Please select your favorite DreamCharger colors by indicating the correct color codes when ordering this perk. International postage not included. Add $25 for international delivery. Shipped free in China. 




$2250 - Here's the Small Business Pack. You operate a small company, and want to treat your employees extremely kindly. You'll receive 50 DreamChargers shipped to you with your own free logo added. Worldwide free shipping included. 







FAQ:
1. Q.) Why does the DreamCharger equip three battery cells, but not more or less?
A.) Less cells, like two, only have 5200mAh of design capacity, which seems to be too small. Conversely, more cells - like four (because it will have a larger design capacity) means that the larger dimensions and weight will take a longer time to charge to full. When considering these factors, we decided that it would be the more appropriate choice to equip the DreamCharger with three cells. 
2. Q.) Why not design the adapter inside of DreamCharger so that it can charge by being plugged directly into a wall socket?
A.) This would increase a lot of electrical components, especially the inclusion of a transformer - which would also greatly increase the dimensions and weight of the DreamCharger. It would have become very hot when the adapter circuit works, which may shorten the life of the battery cells. 
3. Q.) Why not design a LED flashlight on DreamCharger?
A.) A small size LED lamp leads to a low luminous. A high luminous LED lamp has a larger size, and a higher temperature when it works. This LED lamp may need a larger and more-complex cooling component, which can not be put into the DreamCharger. At present, most mobile phones also provide a flashlight function. So we thought that a low luminous flashlight isn't totally necessary. 

4. Q.) Why does the DreamCharger not have a short movie?
A.) Since
 we've already exceeded our budget and costs associated with developing 
the DreamCharger, we've decided that it's too expensive to make a short 
movie for the DreamCharger. We're saving this money, and we instead find
 it more appropriate to use the majority of our funds on creating 
high-quality molds and components. We will eventually add a simple video
 to our YouTube, so please keep an eye on our channel.
5. Q.) Why do some details of the DreamCharger in some of the pictures not look clear enough?
A.) That's
 because almost all of the DreamCharger's pictures are taken of our one 
and only prototype. Rather than using 3D software rendered pictures, we 
wanted to keep the DreamCharger's appearance more realistic. The actual 
appearance of the DreamCharger in future production will appear much 
better than the pictures shown in this campaign. 
6. Q.) Why are there no words or patterns printed on the DreamCharger's shell?
A.) This
 is only a prototype. We will print our logo, the specifications and a 
lot of other information on DreamCharger's shell once the time comes for
 mass production. In fact, there will be a complete product package when
 we mail them to our customers. The package will include the cable, 
instruction manual, packaging materials and so on. 
7. Q.) How many DreamChargers should I buy to be able to customize my own logo?
A.) You
 just need to purchase one DreamCharger in this campaign to be able to 
customize your own logo for display on it. Or, if you purchase five or 
more DreamChargers at one time, your logo that you design will be added 
for free. You'll just need to send us the picture of the logo. In the 
future, we will require a minimum order quantity for logo customization.
 
















  Risks & Challenges  Our team has solved all of the difficulties which arise when engineering powerful technology. Through creating, designing and launching the DreamCharger, we've been able to do the all of the "dirty work" for you. 
Our next step will be to build the mold of the DreamCharger and then begin with our production supply - which is a much easier process compared to all of the problems which we've already solved. 
Here's a breakdown of our team members skills so that you can feel safe and secure in knowing that we have the knowledge and expertise to deliver you the highest-quality mobile chargers in the world. 

Jin is the hardware engineer and project manager of DreamCharger. He is a self-proclaimed geek who loves all things related to mobile power and technical electronic hardware. 
 
Lin is our software engineer who's great at C, C++, Java and many more computer languages.

Zeng is the structural engineer behind DreamCharger, who has successfully developed the structures of more than 200 products throughout his career. 

Together, we have more than 10 years of combined work experience in our respective fields. 

With our combined experiences, technological knowledge and extreme dedication to mobile chargers - it can be said that there's zero risk involved in delivering the DreamCharger "dream" to our customers. 

Timing is the only obstacle that we're working against - and we plan on delivering the DreamChargers in April of 2015 at the latest. 
We will be providing multiple updates and follow-up plans to keep our customers informed of all DreamCharger related news. 

This will be a flexible campaign. We will begin all of the above 
procedures in advance of kicking the goal. Even if the campaign "fails" - the DreamCharger will still be brought to life. Donated funds will go 
towards crafting a high-quality mold, buying equipment, materials, and 
operating costs. 



 
  Other Ways You Can Help Some of you just won't be able to contribute, and that's okay! That doesn't mean that you can't help: 
Please spread the message. Tell your family, friends and anyone else in your life about our campaign. 

E-mail this link to all of your friends who love their mobile phones and other technologies.
 Post this Indiegogo campaign URL to Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Pinterest, Tumblr, or any other social media website which you may be apart of. 
 Use the Indiegogo share tools to more easily share this campaign!


Disclaimer (Posted on 12/23/2014)
Delivery of perks are subject to best efforts and not guaranteed. This is to set reasonable expectations for our contributors/donors.

story:
About the Project


This is a project created focusing on the persons willing to learn website design but are confused of where to start and not getting enough resources anywhere and are feeling lost.

The project will basically be a guide for an individual on how to become a website designer. Also, he/she does not need to have any prior knowledge of design or Photoshop, only willingness and dedication would be enough.

During this project, I will be creating a video series totally focused on designing websites by using Photoshop. The video series will be distributed into a certain amount of videos.

These videos will include introductory lessons on Photoshop and also instructions on detailed use of some Photoshop tools used to design a website.

Along with that the video series will also include videos where I would be designing 5 industry standard websites and would be explaining and showing how we can achieve the results and be capable of creating similar designs.

The best part, once the full video series is completed, it will than be uploaded on YouTube and would be made public so that whoever is looking for learning videos related to website designing today or in future, he/she would be able to make use of the videos and help take their first step to become an awesome website designer.

Breakdown of the Video Series

On the first 7 videos (Approximately) we will be discussing and learning about the following:

  • Brief discussion about web design

  • Get to know the Photoshop interface

  • Talk about pixel and resolution and why it is important for web designing

  • Introduction to Layers and Groups in Photoshop for website designing

  • We get into learning the initial tools used for web designing -  Move Tool -  Shape Tool - Marquee Tool - Pen Tool - Brush Tool - Eraser Tool

  • Rulers and Guides and how we can use them for web designing

  • Viewing and Navigating in Photoshop -  Cascading - Tiling -  Zoom

  • Transformation of shapes and elements and best practices

  • Introduction to the character panel

  • Brief on color theory and it use, gradients and their use in web designing

  • Brief on Typography and its use in Web Designing

  • Usage of images in web designing and best practices

  • A look into the layer blending option and how we can use it

Next on there will be 25 (Approximately) more videos for the 5 industry standard websites which we will be designing.

As an estimate each website will consists of 5 videos of it.



Selected Sites for the Series (5 From the List)

The Sites have been selected bearing the amount of skill we could learn while designing them.

http://www.arsenal.com

http://circleswp.wpengine.com/

http://renovation.progressionstudios.com/

http://demo.goodlayers.com/kingpower/

https://demo.proteusthemes.com/carpress/

http://www.pixel-industry.com/html/mixed/wide/index.html

http://demo.martanian.com/wordpress/frisieur/

http://macaroon.html.themeplayers.net/onepage.html


HERE IS HOW YOU CAN CONTRIBUTE AND HELP


Alternative ways for you to be a part of it

  • Share the word with your friends, family and colleagues.
  • Burst the Social Media with this project and yes you can also use the Indiegogo share tools.

The Impact

By helping build this library, you would be opening doors for people who:

  • Are looking to learn the skill of Web Designing for Free.
  • Could Learn this skill and use it to make a living out of it.


A little something about myself:

I am a self taught freelance graphic designer currently working on outsourcing websites like Elance, Upwork and 99designs.

I have more then 7+ years of experience of working on this competitive industry and have worked for client's all over the world.

I started my journey on December 2008 working at the back office of "Mavrick Software and Telecom Service" in Bangladesh and slowly moved up on to lead the team of web designers in the company. It was till July 2014 when I decided to move on and start working independently and part ways with "Mavrick Software and Telecom Service".

Since then I have been freelancing and till date have worked for 1700+ hours on successfully completed projects and that can be seen on my Elance and Upwork Account Profile.

Personally I prefers most to work mainly on web based application but also am comfortable on working and producing graphics for the print industry.

MY FREELANCE PROFILES:

ELANCE

UPWORK

story:
Meet the most powerful Power Bank

SoWi is the most powerful Powerbank designed and built by experienced engineers, and SoWi integrates all the power needs you need.For example：Charge your laptop、Charge up to 5 devices at the same time、Car jump starter、Connecting inverter.

Powering Your Laptop

Up to 65W of PD output for charging your laptop

6 Hours=Half-Month

Fully charged only 6H, Can Powering your phone up to 15 days

UP to 10W Wireless Charging

Wireless charge output 5V /2A，Suitable for all mobile phones that support wireless charging.

                                

Powering multiple devices at the same time

Universal compatibility

Charge all your devices at maximum speed in one-go

Port Function Introduction&Specifications

SoWi normal version has up to 4 USB ports (including 1 QC3.0 and 3 5V/2.4A USB ports), 1 PD interface (TYPE-C), 1 DC interface of 14.8V/5A；SoWi Wireless version has up to 3 USB ports (including 1 QC3.0 and 2 5V / 2.4A USB ports), 1 PD interface (TYPE-C), 1 14.8V / 5A DC interface and 10W wireless charger.So, SoWi can simultaneously power 5 devices simultaneously.

 

Car Jump Starter

Can provide instantaneous 12V / 300A current to start your engine

Product safety

SoWi uses a variety of technologies to ensure the safe use of its products.

                       

AC output

Connect the inverter through the DC interface to experience more usage scenarios

3W Flash Light

The flashlight has three gear positions: HIGH, LOW, SOS flash

story:
Improve your life with Whemsy. 

Improving your life isn’t a small feat - but that doesn’t mean you should spend hours searching the internet for ineffective ways to do it. We think you should do it your way, in your own time - with an app that you can rely on.

Whemsy is a new startup that helps you to do exactly that - it’s lets you improve your life, one task at a time. Whemsy takes advantage of the technology we have in the 21st century to completely change the way you handle your habits and goals. We already have an Android and iOS app - and now it’s time for us to expand.

Whemsy features:

  • A huge library of habits and goals to deploy in your life - there are truly dozens of brilliant goals and more are added each day.
  • Social motivation and social interaction - Whemsy is focussed on your friends. You can provide and receive motivation for your goals, it’s just so easy.
  • Your life, played like a game - Whemsy features game-like properties, making achieving your goals easier - and much more rewarding.

Self-improvement just isn't working in this day and age - and we believe that Whemsy is the best solution to solve this.

The key to reaching goals is taking actions

Being a productivity lecturer, I saw just how excited people became at the thought of improving their lives - but excitement just wasn’t enough to make a truly lasting change.

So - it was in my blood to take action, and that is exactly what Whemsy helps you to do. Whemsy is a life-management application built to handle routines, tasks and habits in a beautiful way. Our innovative application puts forward a set of tasks that must be accomplished in-order to reach your goal.

Fun fact:
We believe that goals are split into 5 categories: (W)ealth, (H)ealth, (E)motion, (M)ind and (S)ocial achievements.

Souround your actions with friends

Our friends give us motivation for great things - things that can push us to be better people, to ourselves and to the people around us - Whemsy takes this a step further - giving you a place to host new ventures, and your friends a place to send you motivation wherever they are.

The truth is: Whemsy is most effective when your friends are on the network - but that doesn’t mean you can’t be a lone-wolf. Absolutely anyone from around the world can give you motivation for anything, big or small. Support from real human beings can mean so much more than doing it alone, and making changes can be a lot easier.

Whemsy+Encyclopedia = Whemsypedia

We’re collecting advice from the people that matter the most - our users. We are a crowdsourced encyclopedia of life-improvement tips and a place that everyone can contribute towards. Each habit you strive towards features inspirations, tips and other ideas that users from all over the world can add to, it’s social... taken to a whole new level. Everyone is sharing their ideas, so why not share yours?

Your path, your choices. It’s your life afterall

We are all different, full stop - and that’s why Whemsy has been designed to cater for everyone. Whemsy puts your life into a higher gear, giving you freedom to alter and change the course of the actions you take.

If life is a game, shouldn’t Whemsy be too?

You’ve heard the phrase ‘life is just a game’; and so is Whemsy. Actually, it’s slightly more complicated than that. We try to beat our highscores and we constantly try until we beat the game... and that’s why Whemsy’s points system is so effective. You can earn achievements, unlock challenges, win awards, take on missions and view secret tips - this truly is a game of life.

So, what is Whemsy?

Good question. This is how Whemsy works:

  • Read suggestions from users from all around the world on how to combat specific tasks - hundreds of minds are better than one, right?
  • Take action by deploying the voices of friends, family and Whemsy users to achieve your goal - receive new comments and push yourself a little bit further.
  • Check your progress. Find out what areas you need to focus upon and push forward to reach the final stretch of your goal.

Whemsy - everywhere, all the time

Whemsy will be free - that’s one thing we decided on day one. We take privacy seriously, too. We won’t sell data about your passion for classical music. We won’t show ads and your data will be accessible in three places: on Android, iPhone and on the web.

Funding will allow us to create a web app - to go alongside our Android and iOS app that launched on July 4th 2013 and the 21st of December 2012 respectively - the day the world ended for some, but started for us.

So here’s the problem...

We are growing - but like any startup, funding is required to take the next big leap. We saved, but it takes much more than that to launch an app, let alone a platform. We can’t stay in a simple state and expect to grow at the rate we want to - so we ask you to help us - to bring our passion and development skills into Whemsy, and we know we can deliver something beautiful and something innovative.

We want you to be a part of Whemsy either as a fan, a supporter, an early stage user or as fierce critic with constructive feedback. No matter who you are we want you to join us and help us change the future. The world becomes a much better place when everyone around us develops good habits and conquers bad ones.

Changing behaviour is not easy. It does not happen overnight, but with the right tool and the right approach we can do it. We are in search of the right formula and with your help we will find it. Let’s shape a better future together.

What will I get in return?

  • 2€  Become a part of Whemsy: that’s right, you will live with us forever on the Whemsy.com website.
  • 10€ Postcard from the Whemsy team: want something more physical? We’ll deliver it straight to your doorstep.
  • 25€ Ebook of One Habit, delivered to you.
  • 50€ Skype Call: talk with Whemsy’s CEO, Martynas Kairys - talk with him about your concerns how to reach your goals, develop habits.
  • 200€ We will create your own goal with content, so that you can strive towards it on day one.
  • 5000€ White label App

How we gonna spend money


Meet our Team

story:
Android and iOS!

Will my product look like the video and photos?

No. This is a working prototype to show what we have accomplished. The crowdfunding will go towards a custom printed circuit board, better connectors and components, and overall superior design. The case depicted is the identical one and we list the exterior dimensions below in the details. Please keep in mind that this project is aimed at basic model rocketry out on a Sunday with kids using A-E engines. It is not for the HPR community. 

 

Why BlueNose Mobile Mission Control (MMC)?

Model rocketry is a lot of fun, but let's face it - the launch process is a little antiquated. Who amongst us hasn't cursed those shiny little alligator clips that barely hang on, except when they're trying desparately to touch each other? And every amateur rocketeer knows the frustration of performing a countdown, pressing down the safety key, holding your breath, and jamming the launch button only to have nothing happen.

Imagine this instead. You open the missile cover on your Mobile Mission Control (MMC) and flip the toggle switch. The app on your phone immediately recognizes the launch module and activates the control interface. You connect to the igniter using the supplied professional hook clips. They grab on, don't let go, and are fully insulated to prevent short circuits. You plug the cable into the MMC and your smartphone shows you the wiring status. Almost always, that status is Good to Go. But if the igniter was split or squashed when that little plug went in, you know immediately. Status lights on the launcher and an alert in the app tell you whether a short circuit or open circuit would have delayed your launch.

Then you perform your countdown and touch the button. Inside that little box, a sophisticated four-wire sensing circuit is activated to deliver a precision controlled launch current, and with a sharp whoosh, your rocket disappears into the sky. The launch times you see in the video are the real thing. You press the button and it launches immediately.

 

 

Why back us?

Model rockets are great for people of all ages. They are fun to build and even more fun to launch! We are passionate about model rocketry and technology, and we want to bring them together to help take the hobby to the next level.

Improving your launches is just the beginning. With your support, we can reach our stretch goals and achieve integrated telemetry. An embedded altimeter and accelerometer will let you log and wirelessly transmit flight metrics such as acceleration, flight time, height, speed and so on. One more wireless hop and your adventures are shared with friends and competitors online. Have a look at our stretch goals below, especially #2 and #3.

 

This IS rocket science!

Lighting some powder on fire in a cardboard tube to launch a rocket is a pretty simple idea. Doing it efficiently and reliably, however, does require a bit of finesse.

Did you know that the launchers from that big rocket company work by short circuiting your expensive batteries across the igniter?

The MMC fires the igniter under precision microcontroller supervision. Which means you get a strong current for a rapid positive ignition without treating your batteries harshly (so they last longer) and also ensuring that the igniter will glow a nice bright orange for the duration of the ignition, but won't be overdriven and burn out prematurely. 

We increasingly live in an untethered world. And let's face it - remote control is fun! We feel that Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) is the perfect choice. Not only because the range and security work so well for wireless launching. The exremely low power requirements and minimal payload impact make BLE suitable for communicating that crucial launch data that you want to see and share. 

While it's not in scope for right now, the design of the launcher takes into consideration the requirements of multi-engine rockets, and simulataneous launches of multiple rockets.

 

App

With the base project funding goal, we will be releasing an iPhone app. We have this working in our proof of concept trials communicating over Bluetooth Low Energy. The app will be used to wirelessly trigger the launcher to ignite the model rocket motor engine by sending a burst of power to the igniter. The iPhone must be running iOS 6 or later. We can support any iPhone, iPod Touch, and iPad that has BLE (Bluetooth Low Energy). In the case of iPhones, that means iPhone 4S or better.

Should we reach a higher funding level (stretch goal #1) per the details below, we will be able to develop an Android app as well. We have Android app development experience and know we can do this.

But the real adventure starts with stretch goals #2 and #3. A tiny sensor module, attached to the nose cone of the rocket, will capture real time flight data: acceleration, altitude, flight time, maximum velocity, etc. When the rocket lands, this data will be transmitted back to the app and displayed graphically to visualize and share, at the launch site and online. Now that would be AWESOME! Imagine comparing engine performance across flights or competing with your brother-in-law to see who can hit the stratosphere! We know we can do this, it just takes more time and money.

 

How did we make it?

Bluetooth low energy system-on-chip, custom circuit board, wires, duct tape and bubblegum. :)  Seriously, we have worked through several challenges to achieve a working prototype. Specifically being able to have a controlled and sufficient amount of power delivered to trigger the igniter in the engine and working on implementing 4-wire sensing to detect if there are any problems with the igniter.

Getting a custom circuit board ready for this (not the ugly prototype one in the video) is where a lot of the time and money will be used. This is not something we are able to do in our garages and why crowdfunding makes sense.

 

Enclosure

ExternalMeasurements of the MMC are:  81⁄2" x 4" x 17⁄16"

We thought using this 0.55 litre clear plastic case would be cool for this crowdfunding project. People will be amazed when they see you launching your model rocket with your smartphone and you can see all the electronics and wires in the case. It also helps provide some element of water resistance when launching out in the field.

 

Why do we need you?

We need you to help promote our project (website, twitter, facebook, email to friends) and help us reach our goals. Model rocketry should be wireless for the launch and we would love to reach our stretch goals so flight metrics can be collected wirelessly and shared online!!

Purchasing the components required for this project alone in single units is much more expensive than being able to buy them in bulk. Getting our custom circuit board printed requires quantity.  Reaching our stretch goals will permit us to also support Android smartphones.

 

Production plan

Assembled kits starting to ship after 30 days of project funding.

Optional Android app within 60 days (based on stretch goal 1 funding achieved).

Optional Wireless Altimeter and Accelerometer within 180 days (based on stretch goal 2 funding achieved).

Optional Share Your Flight Metrics Online within 210 days (based on stretch goal 3 funding achieved).

 

Help get us to higher levels for more features!

STRETCH GOAL #1

NOW INCLUDED! - We are adding Android support. Everyone who purchases an MMC kit will have the option to download this version for their Smartphone at no additional charge. No additional perks will be added if we achieve this goal, all people obtaining an MMC will be notified of how to download the Android version of the App.

 

STRETCH GOAL #2

If we can reach $50,000 in funding, we will be able to create a Bluetooth altimeter and accelerometer that will attach to a nose cone. This module will collect flight metrics such as maximum height achieved, fastest speed achieved, and total flight time. When you recover your launched rocket, the module will send the information to your app wirelessly. We have already been conducting tests for this and feel confident it can be done. New perks will appear if we achieve this stretch goal.

 

STRETCH GOAL #3

If we can reach $70,000 in funding, we will be able to have the app share your flight metrics online with your friends. This would be AWESOME. Brag about how high or fast your model rocket was. Have a history of flights. Compare with others identical model kits with different engines used and what effect it has. New perks will appear if we achieve this stretch goal.

 

Meet the team

    David Papp - Blogger, uber-Tweep, Author, Speaker, Trainer, IT & SEO Consultant, Enginerd, and Entrepreneur. Check out my blog on http://davidpapp.com/blog/ and tweets at http://twitter.com/DavidPapp/

    Jason Palm - The real brain behind this project with serious talent in the area of integrating electronics hardware and software. Fellow enginerd.

 

Safety

Model rockets do involve igniting a rocket motor/engine. We recommend an adult is always involved, the launch area is roped off and adults only enters the secured area to connect the igniter ensuring beforehand that the master switch is off on the launcher control box and cable to igniter is disconnected.

Only use prepackaged rocket engines. Check the engines before to ensure your defects or cracks. Inspect the rocket. Do not use any metal parts.

Always do a countdown before the launch (which is part of the fun), that way everyone is aware of an imminent launch.

Do not fly in high winds or threatening weather. Do not fly in unsafe locations.

This is a very fun and exciting hobby however always keep safety as your first priority. Fun can be a close second. :)

 

Risks and challenges

Bluetooth low energy has a small range and uses 2.4 GHz frequencies. It is possible to have interference, possible that multiple smartphones in the same area with the app can cause problems. Having weak batteries can cause issues with igniters and electronics.

 

Disclaimer

You are building and launching rockets at your own risk. You will be responsible to check if everything is safe. Rocketry and related activities is not without risk. You agree not to hold liable any owners, affiliates, employers, Indiegogo, or us. SAFETY ALWAYS COMES FIRST.

Always observe any local safety codes such as by NAR or TRA. Make sure you comply with local, municipal, state/provincial, and/or federal laws and regulations.

Safety isn’t just with the launching of the rockets, it is also when assembling or preparing anything. Wear appropriate protection such as gloves, eye protection, and such as needed.

You are responsible for ensuring the location and weather conditions are safe, and that everything being used to launch the rocket is safe and stable.

Do not back this project unless you understand and agree with this disclaimer and are of sufficient age to do so.

 

FAQ

 

Is the app compatible with iPhones, iPod Touch, and iPads?

   The iPhone must be running iOS 6 or later. We can support iPhone, iPod Touch, and iPad that have BLE (Bluetooth Low Energy).
   iPhone4S, iPhone5, iPhone Touch (5th Generation), or iPad (3rd Generation, "new" iPad, retina, and mini) or newer.

 

Does it work with Androids?

   YES! Both iOS and Android will be supported for anyone obtaining an MMC kit. Your smartphone must support Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) to communicate with the MMC.


Can I collect flight data?

   Only if stretch goal 2 is achieved.

 

Can I share flight data information?

   Only if stretch goal 3 is achieved.

 

Is there a safety/security concern regarding accidental ignitions?

   As far as malicious/accidental launches from interference or other phones, we will protect against that. BLE has encrypted PKI authentication. We'll use that if it works; otherwise we'll roll our own based on a shared secret during initial setup. The app will let you set an identifier for your phone.  We will throw a tiny pushbutton into the circuit on one of the BLE module pins to let the endusers put the thing back into "setup mode" if we end up needing that. If not, it can either be a no-op or simply not populated on the board, depending on when we make the decision. This depends on level of funding available and number of units we need to assemble.

   The key safety mechanism overall is that you don't plug the firing cable in till you're ready to launch. There were will be a master switch as well on the case in addition to LEDs indicating status of the system. Ultimately there is always a chance that the hardware or firmware will fail. The only completely reliable safety is the lack of connectivity (physical cable going to the igniter being disconnected).

   Keep in mind that the current leading model rocket launchers do not have this as a safety feature (the removable launch cable). While the key-in-launcher system is perfectly safe in practice, with our version you can plainly SEE that the thing is disconnected and can't fire. That beats hoping the kid holding the launcher isn't jaming something into the keyhole. We feel our system can be more secure if used properly.

 

Is it possible for me to write my own software interface to it (either do my own app or via Ardruino/rPi)?

   As for "hacker" accessibility, we are fine with publishing schematics and the BLE protocol we use. In addition, we figure we'd keep the female headers - the ones we had in the prototype - in the production version, as well as keeping the BLE (male) programming header in place. These allow testing/troubleshooting for us, as well as last minute reprogramming. Hackers can use these to reprogram the BLE module itself or monitor/control it.

 

Do I need to add shipping to my pledge?

     If you live in the US or Canada, shipping is included. For all other countries, please add $30 to your pledge. Local import taxes may apply, we are not responsible for any additional charges.

 

I contributed to a perk but forgot to add $30 for shipping. How can I fix this?

  If you need to add funds for shipping, you can make another contribution and select "No Perk, Just a Contribution." or you can select the "FORGOT INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING" perk. 

 

I cannot get my PayPal payment to work, what should I do?

  Email the Indiegogo Customer Team at support@indiegogo.com - they should be able to track your transaction and help with any issues you have. Provide them with as many details as possible (date/time, amount, etc).

 

What if we fail to reach our funding target?

 We appreciate all the support we get and will still send out any perks that were contributed.  

 

Do any warranties apply?

    Unfortunately there are no warranties provided with any of these perks. However we are nice guys and will definitely help out. Contact us with whatever problems you have encountered.

 

What if my question is not answered here?

    We are more than happy to answer any other questions you may have. Just contact us and we'll try to get you a quick response.

 

What is the range possible between my smartphone and the MMC?

 We are using Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) which has a nominal range of 160 ft (50 m). This project is aimed squarely at the "sunday afternoon with kids" "Estes rockets" market. Hope this helps put things into perspective. Our target audience is NOT the HPR crowd.  

 

Is it possible to have interference issues?

 In terms of radio noise triggering the device, that is impossible. The mobile device communicates with our MMC launch box using the Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) protocol. The BLE module in the launcher contains an embedded microcontroller that controls and monitors the launch circuitry. The only way that the launcher will fire the igniter is if it receives a properly formatted, authenticated bluetooth protocol message. This is definitely NOT a "see this radio frequency, turn on a switch" type device. See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bluetooth and http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bluetooth_low_energy for more background information. By way of analogy, there are no circumstances under which rubbing a 9V battery on your HDMI cable would put your picture on the TV or interference on your WiFi causing you to accidentally receive a copy of Microsoft Office. This is the same thing.

In terms of accidental or malicious launching by third parties, the mobile device and launcher are associated using BLE pairing and bonding. Launch (and other) messages are encrypted and authenticated. See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bluetoo...ng_and_bonding for more background information. No one else can fire your rocket.  

 

What are some other safety mechanisms?

  The cable running from the launch box to the igniter is removable at the launch box end. We are using a simple and easy to remove connector. The safety protocol is that you only plug the cable into the launcher after you have attached the clips and walked away.

The launcher detects and reports the following conditions, which are indicated on the launch box with LED's, and also on the app immediately (which is great for instant troubleshooting): 1) launch cable disconnected, 2) launch cable connected but igniter connection open (broken), and 3) igniter short circuited (wires touching somewhere). For those who want the technical details, this is accomplished with Four-terminal sensing. See http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Four-terminal_sensing for background information.  

 

Are the hook clips good enough for my igniters?

  The current requirement to reliably fire an Estes igniter with no perceptible delay is approx 1.5 Amperes. The igniter fire time is less than one second. The hook clips used in the project are rated for 5.9 Amps (continuous duty).  

 

Will my MMC kit have a homemade looking circuit like in the video and photos?

  No. As posted in the project description above, the product will ship with a printed circuit board, not a perfboard. This is one of the reasons for the crowd funding.  

 

Are these model rockets re-usable?

  The model rockets we supply are reusable. You can send them up for multiple launches. You just need extra engines and igniters.  

 

I am thinking to back one, but not sure which level should be backed. I am looking for complete solution.

  The $149 everything you need kit has everything you need. :) As some have already discovered, you could save $10 by going with the “beginning model rocket kit” at $60 and the “early bird assembled mmc kic” at $79. This totals only $139 for both because you are benefitting from obtaining an early bird kit (same mmc kit, lower price).  

 

What are “A” Engines and Igniters?

  An “A” sized engine represents the physical size of the engine and the amount of power it has to launch. A/B/C engines are all the same size. B engines are twice as powerful as an A and C engines are twice as powerful as a B (so four times more than an A). This is needed sometimes for heavier/larger rockets, or if you want to launch a lot higher.

The A engine kits provided as perks are ideal for beginners. You could launch in a football field sized area. The higher you go with stronger engines, the more space you need to have due to wind potentially carrying your model rocket back (it has a parachute that ejects near the height of the launch).

Our beginner kit includes 3 engines and igniters so you can launch 3 times. It is very inexpensive to buy more engines if you really like it to launch your rocket some more. You can decide if you want to go with B or C sized engines which will also fit in the model rocket we supply. You can also use the MMC and launch pad to launch other model rockets. You will have what you need, so this gets you started in a great hobby.
story_txt:
Android and iOS!



Will my product look like the video and photos?
No. This is a working prototype to show what we have accomplished. The crowdfunding will go towards a custom printed circuit board, better connectors and components, and overall superior design. The case depicted is the identical one and we list the exterior dimensions below in the details. Please keep in mind that this project is aimed at basic model rocketry out on a Sunday with kids using A-E engines. It is not for the HPR community. 
 

Why BlueNose Mobile Mission Control (MMC)?
Model rocketry is a lot of fun, but let's face it - the launch process is a little antiquated. Who amongst us hasn't cursed those shiny little alligator clips that barely hang on, except when they're trying desparately to touch each other? And every amateur rocketeer knows the frustration of performing a countdown, pressing down the safety key, holding your breath, and jamming the launch button only to have nothing happen.

Imagine this instead. You open the missile cover on your Mobile Mission Control (MMC) and flip the toggle switch. The app on your phone immediately recognizes the launch module and activates the control interface. You connect to the igniter using the supplied professional hook clips. They grab on, don't let go, and are fully insulated to prevent short circuits. You plug the cable into the MMC and your smartphone shows you the wiring status. Almost always, that status is Good to Go. But if the igniter was split or squashed when that little plug went in, you know immediately. Status lights on the launcher and an alert in the app tell you whether a short circuit or open circuit would have delayed your launch.

Then you perform your countdown and touch the button. Inside that little box, a sophisticated four-wire sensing circuit is activated to deliver a precision controlled launch current, and with a sharp whoosh, your rocket disappears into the sky. The launch times you see in the video are the real thing. You press the button and it launches immediately.
 
 

Why back us?
Model rockets are great for people of all ages. They are fun to build and even more fun to launch! We are passionate about model rocketry and technology, and we want to bring them together to help take the hobby to the next level.
Improving your launches is just the beginning. With your support, we can reach our stretch goals and achieve integrated telemetry. An embedded altimeter and accelerometer will let you log and wirelessly transmit flight metrics such as acceleration, flight time, height, speed and so on. One more wireless hop and your adventures are shared with friends and competitors online. Have a look at our stretch goals below, especially #2 and #3.
 

This IS rocket science!
Lighting some powder on fire in a cardboard tube to launch a rocket is a pretty simple idea. Doing it efficiently and reliably, however, does require a bit of finesse.
Did you know that the launchers from that big rocket company work by short circuiting your expensive batteries across the igniter?
The MMC fires the igniter under precision microcontroller supervision. Which means you get a strong current for a rapid positive ignition without treating your batteries harshly (so they last longer) and also ensuring that the igniter will glow a nice bright orange for the duration of the ignition, but won't be overdriven and burn out prematurely. 
We increasingly live in an untethered world. And let's face it - remote control is fun! We feel that Bluetooth Low Energy (BLE) is the perfect choice. Not only because the range and security work so well for wireless launching. The exremely low power requirements and minimal payload impact make BLE suitable for communicating that crucial launch data that you want to see and share. 
While it's not in scope for right now, the design of the launcher takes into consideration the requirements of multi-engine rockets, and simulataneous launches of multiple rockets.
 

App
With the base project funding goal, we will be releasing an iPhone app. We have this working in our proof of concept trials communicating over Bluetooth Low Energy. The app will be used to wirelessly trigger the launcher to ignite the model rocket motor engine by sending a burst of power to the igniter. The iPhone must be running iOS 6 or later. We can support any iPhone, iPod Touch, and iPad that has BLE (Bluetooth Low Energy). In the case of iPhones, that means iPhone 4S or better.
Should we reach a higher funding level (stretch goal #1) per the details below, we will be able to develop an Android app as well. We have Android app development experience and know we can do this.
But the real adventure starts with stretch goals #2 and #3. A tiny sensor module, attached to the nose cone of the rocket, will capture real time flight data: acceleration, altitude, flight time, maximum velocity, etc. When the rocket lands, this data will be transmitted back to the app and displayed graphically to visualize and share, at the launch site and online. Now that would be AWESOME! Imagine comparing engine performance across flights or competing with your brother-in-law to see who can hit the stratosphere! We know we can do this, it just takes more time and money.
 

How did we make it?
Bluetooth low energy system-on-chip, custom circuit board, wires, duct tape and bubblegum. :)  Seriously, we have worked through several challenges to achieve a working prototype. Specifically being able to have a controlled and sufficient amount of power delivered to trigger the igniter in the engine and working on implementing 4-wire sensing to detect if there are any problems with the igniter.

Getting a custom circuit board ready for this (not the ugly prototype one in the video) is where a lot of the time and money will be used. This is not something we are able to do in our garages and why crowdfunding makes sense.
 

Enclosure
ExternalMeasurements of the MMC are:  81⁄2" x 4" x 17⁄16"
We thought using this 0.55 litre clear plastic case would be cool for this crowdfunding project. People will be amazed when they see you launching your model rocket with your smartphone and you can see all the electronics and wires in the case. It also helps provide some element of water resistance when launching out in the field.
 

Why do we need you?
We need you to help promote our project (website, twitter, facebook, email to friends) and help us reach our goals. Model rocketry should be wireless for the launch and we would love to reach our stretch goals so flight metrics can be collected wirelessly and shared online!!
Purchasing the components required for this project alone in single units is much more expensive than being able to buy them in bulk. Getting our custom circuit board printed requires quantity.  Reaching our stretch goals will permit us to also support Android smartphones.

Optional Android app within 60 days (based on stretch goal 1 funding achieved).
Optional Wireless Altimeter and Accelerometer within 180 days (based on stretch goal 2 funding achieved).
Optional Share Your Flight Metrics Online within 210 days (based on stretch goal 3 funding achieved).

story:
"Always Be Connected" High Quality Bluetooth® Watch With Notification Alerts From Your Smart Phone

Synced with your iPhone or Android* platform via Bluetooth® Smart Technology, you will receive important alerts all on your watch. 

WHAT is the DOOZY Watch? 

The DOOZY WATCH is a trendy, fashionable well designed analog watch with Bluetooth® Smart Technology.  This specially designed watch syncs with your cell phone displaying L.E.D. notification, Vibration and Series of beeps, immediately when you receive an alert.  Keeping the simplicity of the 3 hands movement design, we have implemented today's technology into a well built, eye catching watch.

WHY the DOOZY Watch? 

There are many "Smart" watches in today's market that looks good, but functionality is not up to standard. What makes the DOOZY WATCH stand out from the rest?  Most smart watches in the market are "match box" like which consumes a lot of power causing constant charging. Many of their designs are dot matrix, cubic shaped, which makes it difficult to read the display. We have believe in our concept of FUNCTIONALITY, SIMPLICITY, and STYLE of a basic analog watch with comparable smart watch capabilities. With a style that you can wear both formally or casually, you will never leave your DOOZY WATCH at home.

The Doozy Watch Concept: "SIMPLICITY"

With our style and capabilities of the DOOZY WATCH we know that this product is one of a kind geared up to the newest and latest software in the market. How our concept differs: 

What FEATURES are there? 


The DOOZY WATCH focus is very simple: NOTIFICATION ALERTS 

and Many More...!

Most of the time your cell phone is with you.  So why have a DIGITAL Display Bluetooth® Watch with a hard to see screen?

I Misplaced My Phone! 

Don't worry!  The DOOZY WATCH can locate that for you. You can simply hit the "Find Phone" feature on your watch and it will communicate with your phone which will sound an alert on your phone so you can find it. 

"Forgot Phone Alert," not only if you left the phone in your house but also if it gets stolen or you simply forget it somewhere, your watch will sound and alert. This automatic alert function on the watch would appeal to forgetful people, party goers, and people who just have the tendency to misplace or forget their phones.

"Forgot Phone" Alert 

Low Battery Alert

The DOOZY WATCH will actually alert you and let you know that your battery is running low on your phone.

"SNAP" Self Portraits 

Don't need to ask help from strangers ever again. No one will be left out of the picture, and best of all, you can take self photos together with your favoriite background. You can now be in priceless photos with just a click on the DOOZY WATCH. You can also remotely take pictures on your smart phone without any assistance.

Our Unique Designs

With many variations of designs for the DOOZY WATCH, we have come to a conclusion to our current design.  We wanted our design to be simple but yet modern with a unique Bluetooth® feature.  Below are the styles and colors that can be readily produced with our funds. We are hoping to have various colors in the future. 

Click Here To Enlarge

First Working Prototypes. Final Dimension May Vary

First Working Prototypes. Final Dimension May Vary

First Working Prototypes. Final Dimension May Vary

Basic Watch Features 

Original in design, our DOOZY WATCH qualities can be overseen by the functions of the features of the watch.

- Water Reistant up to 3 ATM (working on 5 ATM) 

- Up to 1 year battery life for mobile sync features 

- Up to 3 years battery life on timekeeping function

- Japanese 3-hand analog movement 

- Straps are available in comfort silicone strap, classic leather strap, and  stainless steel. 

Left to Right - Leather, Silicone, Orange Silicone, Stainelss Steel Silver, Stainless Steel Black

- Anti- Scratch, Hardened mineral lens

- Replaceable coin battery model CR2032

Don't Need To Recharge Battery

We can't emphasize how happy we are that you DON'T have to recharge your watch daily like most of the smart watches.  There are two conventional easy to change batteries that powers the watch which lasts about a year on the Bluetooth® Smart and 3 years on the functionality of the watch. I often forget to charge my phone daily, another unit to charge can be a hassle for me.

At The Right Place, At the Right Time

Right Place - Indiegogo platform which is the best fund-raising platform to gather people like YOU! 

Right Time - All related technologies and mobile OS platforms are ready to support to build a smart watch. We can be one of the first ones to develop a smart watch with Bluetooth® Smart, iOS 7, and Android v4.3. 

Bluetooth® Smart Technology

How does  Bluetooth® Smart Ready effect the DOOZY WATCH? 

Bluetooth® Smart Technology: Ultra low energy wireless technology which allows your smart watch (i.e. DOOZY WATCH) to be connected (with your mobile) without charging. Bluetooth® Smart Ready also consumes a lot less battery than the current Bluetooth® Operating system. 

Click: Bluetooth® for full article 

APPLE iOS 7

Source: Bluetooth Blog

With the DOOZY WATCH we are writing our programs to gear for the iOS 7 launch! This means that there are more functions than most Bluetooth® notification existing watches.

Current iOS Problems - For MOST smart watches in today's market the convenience of connecting to an iOS device might have some flaws.  As you know when you lose signal from your Bluetooth® devices (such as speaker box, watches, other devices that supplement your phone) or vise versa, you will have to re-connect the set up on your current device manually.

With the "auto connect" pairing recovery system, you won't have to worry about reconnecting your watch because of the NEW iOS 7 platform. Missing any important calls, messages, and alerts with the DOOZY WATCH is obsolete. 

Any types of "Push Notifications" from your phone which sends you an alert can be notified on the DOOZY WATCH with the iOS 7 platform. 

Updates on iOS 7 will be updated through out the project

Android v4.3

Good news to ANDROID USERS.... The most updated information of the Bluetooth® Smart Technology

Click Here for full article: Android Update

Just like the APPLE iOS 7 update.. We are as proud that in a few months, Android will be adapting the Bluetooth® Smart System.This is a big step for ANDROID.  Now with this in hand, we are able to adapt with the DOOZY WATCH with the Android system going hand in hand and having no operating issues in regards about receiving alerts via Bluetooth® from our DOOZY APP. 

*Updates on the ANDROID 4.3 will be updated throughout the project*

DOOZY APP

By syncing the Doozy watch to your smart phone, you will need to download our Doozy Application on your phone from "iTunes App Store"(Apple) or "Play Store" (Android). The APP is FREE.  You may toggle the following features:

...And Many More! 

Here is the first look of our DOOZY APPS page: 

Please note: Final display on Apps may not reflect actual picture 

OUTLINE

Measurement

Dimensions of the DOOZY WATCH: (approx):

Case: 42mm  Opening: 32mm  Thickness: 14mm  Crown: 4.5mm

The approximate weight of the watch is about 191 grams (6.73 ounce) for the stainless version. 

The silicone version is about 115 grams (5.32 ounce).

Process of building the DOOZY Watch

From the sketching, design, to the actual prototype, we have came a long way in our process. With technology these days we have completely build a watch module by computer. Below is the core module of the watch.

First Sketches of the DOOZY Watch

Module of the core 

Bluetooth® Module 


Backing of the watch

Working Prototype - Final Dimensions May Vary

Months later we have finally got a first look at the iOS7 platform which we has been completed at this stage. As you can see in the video, we have a full functional watch that corresponds with the iOS7 platform and Application. From the drawing to the working prototype these were the following steps to get us where we are: 

1.) Drawing/Sketching

2.) Computer 3d sketching 

 3.) Internal Circuit Board / Working Module

 4.) LED implementation into the board 

 5.) Bluetooth® Smart component and sync 

 6.) iOS7 and Application design/syncing 

 7.) Working stages of the first prototype and designing Android v4.3 application


Packaging 

We came up with an unique packaging for the DOOZY WATCH.  Not only that the watch box is attractive, it also serve a dual purpose as a mobile stand!  How cool! 

*Cover Not Shown

Our Style

First Working Prototypes. Final Dimensions May Vary

First Working Prototypes. Final Dimensions May Vary

Our Work

As the DOOZY WATCH is slowly coming together we have put in a large amount of effort and time into it.  Starting with our design, we have worked closely with watch expertise to finalize what we have visioned. With the new Bluetooth® technology we have custom a tiny Bluetooth® PCBA for the watch.  Working countless hours designing the APPS software for the iOS 7 was a challenge but have nailed down the functionality to sync with the DOOZY WATCH.  In regards about the ANDROID 4.3 system, it is a little more complicated of a system but we are near completing this platform.

DOOZY Watch Team 

The original concept came upon with two family members who is into new innovation products.  As we learned that two people can not accomplish a feat like this, we have 2 additional skilled designers to come up with the DOOZY Watch.  From designing, testing, and development we have came to the stage we are at right now.  

The IDEA 

While I was sitting at the local coffee shop I have done some research on Smart Watches.  I was wondering how can I differ from the existing smart watches out there. I was looking for a simple, functional watch with a lower price point than the existing Digital Smart Watches. There are a lot of smart square faced digital watches which was not appealing to my personal lifestyle.  I am an Analog type of person when it comes to watches.  I wanted simple functionality with Bluetooth® that performs basic alerts.  After all, I always have my phone nearby if I really need to use it.  That is when I came up with an alert watch with Bluetooth® functionality. Even with the idea I had, our team had implemented more features and made it user friendly.  Reality kicked in when we saw the first working prototype. 

Where are we at now? 

Prototypes are finished. We are currently testing the DOOZY App with the iOS 7 platform anticipating the release from Apple very shortly. Once that is completed, we will be working on the Android v4.3.  

TIMELINE

Help get the DOOZY Watch from the prototype stage to production

With our talented team, we have made the prototype, finalized the style, and developed applications. With this well built time piece with Bluetooth® Smart features we need Indiegogo and especially YOU to bring this product live into the market late December. Getting to the next step is the biggest obstacle.  We need funds to for initial set up, quality control, and get the DOOZY WATCH to a full capacity working stage. Please pledge to get the DOOZY WATCH into production. 

We need funds for development. production, licensing, and materials. We also want to expand this watch to be Android capable which will widen the market. 

There are many ways to fund this project such as getting investors, business loans, however we have decided to use Indiegogo  because we believe this community has a one of kind lifestyle and people like you can help us to our goal. 

With Indiegogo we can interact with updates and comments and we can assure you everything will be addressed in a timely manner. We hope to "connect" with you not with just the DOOZY Watch but to be part of the Doozy life! 

CONTACTS 

Follow and "LIKE" us on: FACEBOOK

"Follow" us on: Twitter

Check out our website: www.doozy-inc.com

Please support us by pledging on your favorite DOOZY Watch! Thank You!
