story:
The Soldiers and Sailors Civil Relief Act (SSCRA) provides an umbrella of legal protection for our deployed service members while serving in combat.
Such as the following: Reduced interest rate on mortgage payments ; Reduced interest on credit card debt ; Protection from eviction if your rent is $1,200 or less ; "Delay of all civil court actions, such as bankruptcy, foreclosure and/or divorce proceedings".

"There is no such protections for deployed civilian personnel that provide vital services in support of our troops while in the same combat environment".


My name is Donald Schell and I'm a father fighting for my basic parental rights! If I had similar protection offered in the SSCRA, I would be home right now with my daughter. Here is my story...

 

In late 2009 I was deployed to Afghanistan as a Civilian Firefighter both as a patriot and to provide a better life for my family. In May 2010 my ex-wife had an issue leading to her losing custody of our daughter to her parents, and because she was proven an unfit parent by her parents.

We (My ex-wife's parents and I) made an arrangement over the phone allowing my daughter to reside with them until I completed my contract and acquired a home. They agreed to watch her until my return, as I would gain full custody. They assured me that they would uphold their end of the bargain and my normal visitation rights wouldn't be interrupted.

In August I called to speak to my daughter and let them know I was returning for my holiday visit in December.  I was informed by my ex-wife's parents that I need to speak to their lawyer and my phone calls with my daughter were terminated until I acquired counsel.

I retained a lawyer only to discover that some how my Marriage Settlement Agreement (MSA) in Florida had been dissolved, my visitation rights terminated, and her schools had been directed not to release any details of my daughters' progress to me. I also discovered that my ex-wife's parents were filing for custody.

When I arrived back in the USA from Afghanistan in December 2010 to see my daughter it had been roughly 6-7 months since my last visit with her (Our longest separation from each other at that time). I spent nearly a week in court and nearly $19,000 in fees / expenses just to get 10.5 days visitation with my daughter. My ex-wife's parents filed false claims... such as my daughter not knowing me and/or afraid of my family and I... All which were proved to be false accusations. To prove these allegations false I has to pay my daughters attorney fees ($250/hr) for a 2-3hr assessment, just to see if my daughter would recognize me and/or was afraid of me as claimed. The results of the assessment allowed a 24hr visit with my daughter over the weekend and then in court the following Monday I was granted a 10.5 day visit with her that December.

Up until that point I've not had any interruptions or hard times visiting my daughter, other that my ex-wife moving around the country numerous times and not finding out till the last minute. I spend as much quality time with her as possible and every chance I can.

I spent the last 3-4 years battling my ex-wife's parents. My legal fees and traveling expenses from Michigan & Afghanistan to Texas have exceeded over $70,000 to gain visitations and battle for my rights as a father. In January we had a "Trail by Jury" and the case was "Mis-Trialed" and reset for August 2014.

I still owe roughly $14,000 to my lawyer from the trial in January, along with his $20,000 retainer for the upcoming trail in August. I also owe my daughters' court appointed lawyer about $5,000 in fees, as ordered by the judge from trial; this doesn't include the fees needed for the upcoming trial in August.
Furthermore this does not include the fees / expenses to fly my daughters lawyer to Michigan this summer to evaluate my home, meet the rest of my family (Estimate$5,000-$10,000 in legal fees/expenses). This doesn't include the fees / expenses so I can have a summer visit with my daughter upon my return from Afghanistan this summer.

I fly back to the USA from Afghanistan to see my daughter every chance I get; I've met nothing but resistance, resulting in thousands of dollars in fees just for visitations with my daughter. When I should've been able to come home on leave an enjoy good quality daddy/daughter time.

If similar protection in the SSCRA had been provide to both deployed troops and my fellow civilians supporting the war fighters. My rights as  a father wouldn't have been hindered, I would've been able to return home long ago and have full custody as I should.

The only thing I'm guilty of is going to Afghanistan to work. I have no criminal record outside of a few traffic violations over the years... I'm a Veteran of the United States Air Force and a Firefighter currently in Afghanistan till mid-summer 2014.

I've been wrongfully accused of abandoning my daughter, even though I have made every effort on my own to spend as much time with her as possible and bring her back home to Michigan with my family.

One of the questions I'm most commonly asked is "Why haven't /don't you come home, get a job and then get your daughter?"

Answer is simple... Had I been working a normal 9-5 job; with the extreme costs this case has racked up; there is no way I would've been able to afford the legal fees and travel expenses. My job afforded me an opportunity to establish and furnish a home to provide a safe and loving environment for my daughter to grow and prosper...

So yes, I chose to do what it takes to provide and fight for my daughter! The money I made in the time here, has allowed me to continue the fight, acquire a home for my family and allowed me up to 45 days to fight for and visit my daughter. With the "Harsh economic conditions" we have now in Michigan, there is no way I would've been able to afford it, if I had stayed home.

 
My Goals:

Why I set my goal for $200,000 you may ask...?

So far this case has cost me about $70,000 in fees / expenses, to include two personal loans (Totaling $45,000) to aid in the legal fees / expenses involving the case.
I still owe a remaining $19,000 from the "Mis-Trial" back in January to my daughters lawyer (Approx. $5,000) & my attorney (Approx. $14,000 due by June 1st 2014)
My daughters' lawyer fees will be about $10,000 for the trial
My daughters' lawyer trip to Michigan will cost up to about $10,000 for her several day stay to evaluate my family, my home, neighborhood and schools...
My trip to Texas for the trial in August will cost about $4,000 for airline, hotel, car rental and gas...

This case will roughly cost me a total of $133,000 altogether. $63,000 in fees / expenses that I need to come up with before August; $34,000 due by June 1st 2014.

The site has a 4% fee (Up to $8,000) if the goal is successfully reached or 9% fee (Up to $18,000) if your goal isn't reached. (I need $141,000 up to $151,000 depending on if the goal is reached or not).

This doesn't include the cost to fight for a prolonged summer visit with my daughter before the trial. Pat history proves this will run several thousand more... Lets say best case $4,000 in legal fees (My lawyers rate is $350/hr & his Legal Assistant $100/hr & my daughters lawyer $250/hr) and lets not forget the court filing fees after the lawyers are done going back in forth (Total needed now is $145,000 up to $155,000)

The remaining $45,000-$55,000 will go towards the "TAXES" that Uncle Sam will hit me on the funds raised, any other unexpected costs that may result from the case, my daughters' future education and retaining counsel to push my case to a higher court as an example of why deployed civilians need similar legal protection like in the SSCRA! All this money wasted could've gone to a better purpose involving my daughters future, but I had to redirect my time, money and resources towards the case instead of investing in her future.

Your Impact:

As I stated before, each time I requested to see my daughter since this case began... I've met nothing but resistance by days/weeks of time wasted by unnecessary court hearings and false claims resulting in more fees exceeding several thousands of dollars that could've gone towards my daughter' future. This robbed my 12 year old and I of precious quality daddy/daughter time together and has been a huge burden on my family that has created a financial hardship and most of all stressed my relationship with my daughter.

By presenting my case to a higher court and approaching congress if needed to modify the SSCRA and/or creating a separate piece of legislation to help protect deployed civilians; would save valuable resources, money & time not only in our judicial system, but reduce those stresses for the impacted family members. Instead of having long drawn out proceedings.

 If I don't reach my goal:

If I don't reach my set goal, the money I do raise will still go towards gaining my rights as a father. I plan to use my case to push for legislation similar to the Soldiers and Sailors Civil Relief Act but for the Civilians working in Combat Zones. There are currently thousands of civilians providing vital support and services to our war fighters that would benefit from a relief act for civilians.

 
Many thanks for your time and consideration:

I'd like to thank you in advance for contributing to my efforts to bring my family back together. I've sacrificed about 4 years in Afghanistan away from my family, supporting the troops and doing what is necessary to fight for my basic rights as a father.

It is "Unbelievable" how they were able to get the judge to sign off on a ruling against me when I wasn't even served any paperwork!!
Why were my "Parental Rights" violated by another state?
How were they legally able to get my Florida MSA dissolved in Texas?
My ex-wife was proven an unfit parent, not I... So why did the courts cast judgment against me?

I'm a good citizen, a patriot and a proud father of a growing young lady. I'm confident in the outcome of my case and feel the impact will pave way to provide legal protection to deployed civilian parents battling for their basic parental rights; by providing legal protection similar to those provided to or armed services members.

Just because a person's job requires them to travel and spend long durations of time away from home... Doesn't mean they're bad parents and/or unfit to raise their own children!

Even if you can't contribute, please share with your friends and family to raise awareness of the unfair treatment that some parents must endure.

If you have any questions you can e-mail me at donaroobaby@gmail.com and I would be glad to answer any questions that you may have.

 

Thank you for your time and consideration,

Donald Schell
story_txt: The Soldiers and Sailors Civil Relief Act (SSCRA) provides an umbrella of legal protection for our deployed service members while serving in combat.Such as the following: Reduced interest rate on mortgage payments ; Reduced interest on credit card debt ; Protection from eviction if your rent is $1,200 or less ; "Delay of all civil court actions, such as bankruptcy, foreclosure and/or divorce proceedings"."There is no such protections for deployed civilian personnel that provide vital services in support of our troops while in the same combat environment".My name is Donald Schell and I'm a father fighting for my basic parental rights! If I had similar protection offered in the SSCRA, I would be home right now with my daughter. Here is my story... In late 2009 I was deployed to Afghanistan as a Civilian Firefighter both as a patriot and to provide a better life for my family. In May 2010 my ex-wife had an issue leading to her losing custody of our daughter to her parents, and because she was proven an unfit parent by her parents.We (My ex-wife's parents and I) made an arrangement over the phone allowing my daughter to reside with them until I completed my contract and acquired a home. They agreed to watch her until my return, as I would gain full custody. They assured me that they would uphold their end of the bargain and my normal visitation rights wouldn't be interrupted.In August I called to speak to my daughter and let them know I was returning for my holiday visit in December.  I was informed by my ex-wife's parents that I need to speak to their lawyer and my phone calls with my daughter were terminated until I acquired counsel.I retained a lawyer only to discover that some how my Marriage Settlement Agreement (MSA) in Florida had been dissolved, my visitation rights terminated, and her schools had been directed not to release any details of my daughters' progress to me. I also discovered that my ex-wife's parents were filing for custody.When I arrived back in the USA from Afghanistan in December 2010 to see my daughter it had been roughly 6-7 months since my last visit with her (Our longest separation from each other at that time). I spent nearly a week in court and nearly $19,000 in fees / expenses just to get 10.5 days visitation with my daughter. My ex-wife's parents filed false claims... such as my daughter not knowing me and/or afraid of my family and I... All which were proved to be false accusations. To prove these allegations false I has to pay my daughters attorney fees ($250/hr) for a 2-3hr assessment, just to see if my daughter would recognize me and/or was afraid of me as claimed. The results of the assessment allowed a 24hr visit with my daughter over the weekend and then in court the following Monday I was granted a 10.5 day visit with her that December.Up until that point I've not had any interruptions or hard times visiting my daughter, other that my ex-wife moving around the country numerous times and not finding out till the last minute. I spend as much quality time with her as possible and every chance I can.I spent the last 3-4 years battling my ex-wife's parents. My legal fees and traveling expenses from Michigan & Afghanistan to Texas have exceeded over $70,000 to gain visitations and battle for my rights as a father. In January we had a "Trail by Jury" and the case was "Mis-Trialed" and reset for August 2014.I still owe roughly $14,000 to my lawyer from the trial in January, along with his $20,000 retainer for the upcoming trail in August. I also owe my daughters' court appointed lawyer about $5,000 in fees, as ordered by the judge from trial; this doesn't include the fees needed for the upcoming trial in August.Furthermore this does not include the fees / expenses to fly my daughters lawyer to Michigan this summer to evaluate my home, meet the rest of my family (Estimate$5,000-$10,000 in legal fees/expenses). This doesn't include the fees / expenses so I can have a summer visit with my daughter upon my return from Afghanistan this summer.I fly back to the USA from Afghanistan to see my daughter every chance I get; I've met nothing but resistance, resulting in thousands of dollars in fees just for visitations with my daughter. When I should've been able to come home on leave an enjoy good quality daddy/daughter time. If similar protection in the SSCRA had been provide to both deployed troops and my fellow civilians supporting the war fighters. My rights as  a father wouldn't have been hindered, I would've been able to return home long ago and have full custody as I should.The only thing I'm guilty of is going to Afghanistan to work. I have no criminal record outside of a few traffic violations over the years... I'm a Veteran of the United States Air Force and a Firefighter currently in Afghanistan till mid-summer 2014.I've been wrongfully accused of abandoning my daughter, even though I have made every effort on my own to spend as much time with her as possible and bring her back home to Michigan with my family.One of the questions I'm most commonly asked is "Why haven't /don't you come home, get a job and then get your daughter?"Answer is simple... Had I been working a normal 9-5 job; with the extreme costs this case has racked up; there is no way I would've been able to afford the legal fees and travel expenses. My job afforded me an opportunity to establish and furnish a home to provide a safe and loving environment for my daughter to grow and prosper...So yes, I chose to do what it takes to provide and fight for my daughter! The money I made in the time here, has allowed me to continue the fight, acquire a home for my family and allowed me up to 45 days to fight for and visit my daughter. With the "Harsh economic conditions" we have now in Michigan, there is no way I would've been able to afford it, if I had stayed home. My Goals:Why I set my goal for $200,000 you may ask...?So far this case has cost me about $70,000 in fees / expenses, to include two personal loans (Totaling $45,000) to aid in the legal fees / expenses involving the case.I still owe a remaining $19,000 from the "Mis-Trial" back in January to my daughters lawyer (Approx. $5,000) & my attorney (Approx. $14,000 due by June 1st 2014)My daughters' lawyer fees will be about $10,000 for the trialMy daughters' lawyer trip to Michigan will cost up to about $10,000 for her several day stay to evaluate my family, my home, neighborhood and schools...My trip to Texas for the trial in August will cost about $4,000 for airline, hotel, car rental and gas...This case will roughly cost me a total of $133,000 altogether. $63,000 in fees / expenses that I need to come up with before August; $34,000 due by June 1st 2014.The site has a 4% fee (Up to $8,000) if the goal is successfully reached or 9% fee (Up to $18,000) if your goal isn't reached. (I need $141,000 up to $151,000 depending on if the goal is reached or not).This doesn't include the cost to fight for a prolonged summer visit with my daughter before the trial. Pat history proves this will run several thousand more... Lets say best case $4,000 in legal fees (My lawyers rate is $350/hr & his Legal Assistant $100/hr & my daughters lawyer $250/hr) and lets not forget the court filing fees after the lawyers are done going back in forth (Total needed now is $145,000 up to $155,000)The remaining $45,000-$55,000 will go towards the "TAXES" that Uncle Sam will hit me on the funds raised, any other unexpected costs that may result from the case, my daughters' future education and retaining counsel to push my case to a higher court as an example of why deployed civilians need similar legal protection like in the SSCRA! All this money wasted could've gone to a better purpose involving my daughters future, but I had to redirect my time, money and resources towards the case instead of investing in her future.Your Impact:As I stated before, each time I requested to see my daughter since this case began... I've met nothing but resistance by days/weeks of time wasted by unnecessary court hearings and false claims resulting in more fees exceeding several thousands of dollars that could've gone towards my daughter' future. This robbed my 12 year old and I of precious quality daddy/daughter time together and has been a huge burden on my family that has created a financial hardship and most of all stressed my relationship with my daughter. By presenting my case to a higher court and approaching congress if needed to modify the SSCRA and/or creating a separate piece of legislation to help protect deployed civilians; would save valuable resources, money & time not only in our judicial system, but reduce those stresses for the impacted family members. Instead of having long drawn out proceedings. If I don't reach my goal:If I don't reach my set goal, the money I do raise will still go towards gaining my rights as a father. I plan to use my case to push for legislation similar to the Soldiers and Sailors Civil Relief Act but for the Civilians working in Combat Zones. There are currently thousands of civilians providing vital support and services to our war fighters that would benefit from a relief act for civilians. Many thanks for your time and consideration:I'd like to thank you in advance for contributing to my efforts to bring my family back together. I've sacrificed about 4 years in Afghanistan away from my family, supporting the troops and doing what is necessary to fight for my basic rights as a father.It is "Unbelievable" how they were able to get the judge to sign off on a ruling against me when I wasn't even served any paperwork!!Why were my "Parental Rights" violated by another state?How were they legally able to get my Florida MSA dissolved in Texas?My ex-wife was proven an unfit parent, not I... So why did the courts cast judgment against me?I'm a good citizen, a patriot and a proud father of a growing young lady. I'm confident in the outcome of my case and feel the impact will pave way to provide legal protection to deployed civilian parents battling for their basic parental rights; by providing legal protection similar to those provided to or armed services members.Just because a person's job requires them to travel and spend long durations of time away from home... Doesn't mean they're bad parents and/or unfit to raise their own children!Even if you can't contribute, please share with your friends and family to raise awareness of the unfair treatment that some parents must endure.If you have any questions you can e-mail me at donaroobaby@gmail.com and I would be glad to answer any questions that you may have. Thank you for your time and consideration,Donald Schell

story:
SwitchLok is NOT your average phone mount!

Tired of your phone slipping and sliding around your car? When you're at the gym, is your phone in a pocket or on the ground, just waiting to get crushed? SwitchLok™ is a system of phone case and mounts that's effortless to use and completely secure. It's patent pending interface auto-aligns--just get your phone close and its magnetic personality takes over, locking your phone in place. One hand is all you need to put it on or take it off and it's signature 'snap' lets you know that your phone is safe.

Featured In: 

"I was skeptical of another quick-release case mount style system designed for athletes. But this one actually impressed me."

-DC Rainmaker

“It’s as easy has blindly aiming your phone towards to mount and as long as you are close, it will engage.” 

-Brett (Beta Tester)
 

From The Creator

Hi, I'm Marc and I am the creator of SwitchLok. I'm a father of two little kids, a mediocre (but aspiring) triathlete and a bike commuter, I was frequently driving, running and riding without a great spot for my phone to come along. Why was everything so clunky, uncomfortable or bulky? Why couldn’t there be a simple, convenient and seamless way to have your phone with you?

After years of frustration, I decided to do something about it: leveraging 14 years of aerospace engineering experience, I created SwitchLok. Initially, it was just an evening project: I'd sketch some ideas, put together a model in CAD, get a 3D print and take it out for a test run or ride. The process was fun and the product was getting better all the time. Soon, people at work started asking about it and if they could buy one. Eventually, I quit my job and went all in. I poured over every detail of how the case should feel in your hand, what the perfect armband would be and most importantly, getting the SwitchLok interface just right.

Now I've brought SwitchLok to Indiegogo and I am so grateful for the opportunity to be a part of this incredible community. All of your support is deeply appreciated and I know that once you try SwitchLok, you will absolutely love it.

SwitchLok Mounts in Detail

The SwitchLok Case is the centerpiece of our system and we designed it with comfort, performance and style in mind. Textured sides, a thin profile, responsive buttons and spacious port cutouts mean its a pleasure to handle. With a rigid plate shielding the back of the phone, shock absorbing TPU (rubber-like material) around the sides, and a generous lip above the screen, your phone is well protected.  We also include an optional tether for extra security.  Our case is built for the iPhone X and XS. If you have another phone, we've got you covered! Check out the adapter below.

At just 0.1 inches thin, the SwitchLok Adapter allows you to use nearly any modern phone with the SwitchLok system. It provides the same amazing auto-alignment and security as the case. Simply peel the cover off the industrial strength adhesive, line it up and stick it on. If you love your case, this is the ticket.

Note: For the adapter to work properly, your case must have 2.5 x 2.5 inches of flat space on the back of it. Silicone coatings may prevent proper adhesion and due to the large variety of case thicknesses, we cannot promise that Qi charging will work,

Do you run holding your phone? Maybe you shove it into one of those plastic pockets? The SwitchLok Run mount was made for you! Change songs or take a quick picture without stopping--it's so simple. It's also the most comfortable armband you will ever find.  The SwitchLok Run mount has a smooth, curved profile to comfortably rest on your arm. The elastic is soft and smooth, totally different from the stiff, scratchy bands you're used to. We lined the interior of the band with grippy material to keep it comfortably in place.

If you use your phone for navigation or music in the car, you need the SwitchLok Drive mount. Do you ever  wonder if your phone is centered on that cheap magnet or get frustrated by strange clamps to pry apart?  The SwitchLok Drive mount blows everything else out of the water. Not only does it lock your phone securely into portrait or landscape but it automatically aligns it so that it perfectly engages each and every time. It's signature 'click'.

Don't believe us? Watch SwitchLok get put to the ultimate test at DirtFish Rally School.

 

 

Supports horizontal and vertical vents

Schedule

We know you don't want to wait any longer for SwitchLok, so we already started the manufacturing process. The timeline below shows each step in the process and we expect to begin shipping SwitchLok in June.

Risks and challenges

Manufacturing 
We've already started the manufacturing process so many of the risks have already been eliminated. We are working with a highly reputable manufacturer that has the capability to execute our initial launch and much more as needed. We also personally visited our manufacturer’s location overseas and met not only with the manufacturing team, but each material source vendor. This was to ensure that we could have a productive business relationship and that they ran a professional operation. We are confident our experienced manufacturing and logistics teams will overcome any potential challenges and deliver a high-quality product you’ll be excited to own and experience.

Design and Performance 
For the last 18 months before launching our project on Kickstarter we tested numerous prototypes in the field and put each case and mount system through a variety of real-world tests. Over 60 people participated in a beta test, ensuring that SwitchLok works as it should.

What Risks Remain? 
While we have done everything possible to reduce risks, there are always potential pitfalls. The most likely thing to go wrong will be some manufacturing or logistics mistake that will lead to short delays. With the engineering and manufacturing experience of everyone involved, I just can't see us failing to deliver a product. However, if we are talking catastrophic problems, our biggest concerns are: 
- Unforeseen problem: We just miss something. 
- Geopolitical Turmoil: In the last year, we have seen international disagreements affect trade in severe and unpredictable ways

Hopefully, you feel confident that once backed, we will deliver SwitchLok to you.

story:
DOIT2 is a Minimalist Smartphone & Tablet Holder for Your Modern Life.

Doit2 All-metal Foldable Holder adopts an integrated design for the smartphone, tablet, and connecting rod. Thus making it extremely sturdy. Together with the Doule-rotation shaft structure with multi-angle adjustment can realize height and front-back adjustment.

 

 

All-metal style design makes her the stunner among the surroundings. The body is made of aeronautical grade aluminum with anoxic technique processed surface, it is really stable and durable. With the most portable, fashionable, and the strongest All-metal integral molding holder on the market, let's say goodbye to a fragile and cheap desk stand.

It is made of high-quality aluminum alloy, solid and stable. 

 

The Doule-rotation shaft structure with multi-angle adjustment can realize height and front-back adjustment. 

Height Adjustable - up to 40 cm

Folding lamp type modern height adjustment mode, the height adjustment range is 0 to 400 mm, the whole product can rotate freely, any angle can be adjusted 360 degrees, can stay at any position and angle you want, very easy.

Multi-angle - Freely adjustable height

It can keep you comfortable and healthy posture, help, and prevent the relief of back, neck, and spine pain. It is a good way to watch videos, browse the Internet, play games, type, and read. 

360 gif

180gif

240gif

Doit2 is very suitable for office, kitchen, bedroom, living room, retail shop, workshop, POS Pavilion, and classroom. 

  • Help reduce neck and back pain associated with tablets or phones.   
  • Raise and positions display at an improved viewing angle.

Dual screen interaction, refusing to be a head-down tribe.

 

Doit2 All-metal Foldable Holder is suitable for 4.7 - 12.9 inch smartphone and tablet devices, iPhone 11, Samsung Galaxy, switch, iPad 1 / 2 / 3 / 4, surface, Surface Pro, iPad Pro 12.9 / 9.7, etc.

拉伸gif

Easy to be folded into a completely flat shape, easily thrown onto a rucksack/bag.

折叠gif

 

 

Innovative one-piece connection ball head adopts aviation-grade aluminum alloy material, can withstand 100,000 wear and tear fatigue.

 

The anodized aluminum structure can support ＞2.2 lb (1 kg) without any deformation.

High-density metal weighing base, the maximum weight can reach 2.2LB, equipped with 1.5 mm thick rubber cotton, which is non-slip and does not scratch the desktop.

 

The grooved base of the panel has non-slip silicone, which is strongly adsorbed and closely fits the phone and tablet without fear of slipping.

Featured with reserved charging hole, Can charge horizontally and vertically, this cell phone stand is convenient and cable for charging, and make your desk neat and tidy. You can free your hands when you use your device while charging.

Perfect for playing games, watching videos, viewing photos, reading, typing, video recording and you can charge your devices at the same time. 

Provide with a safe and elegant mount for your smartphones, tablets, switch, e-reader. Now it is time to give your hands a break, enjoying watching the video, reading, FaceTime call, doing live internet broadcast, etc.

story:
Short Summary

Have you ever broken a cord, whether that be an iPhone cord, laptop cord, or even an auxiliary cord? If so, how expensive were the replacements? Now, ask yourself this: how great would it be to have a product that prevents cord damage, and still be affordable? That's where LyfeCord comes in. We offer a cord that is reinforced with a nylon blend that will fortify not only the weak points of the cord, but the whole cord itself to prevent damage, dirt and debris, all while coming in a vast amount of colors and sizes so that every LyfeCord is personalized just for you! 

Apple cords from the Apple store or other leading retailers can cost nearly $20-$30, and with the USB power adapter, total costs can go up to nearly $50. However, with the LyfeCord, you get a much more affordable cord, with reinforcement to prevent cord damage, with fantastic quality, and a USB power adapter for free!

Check out our website (www.lyfecord.com) for more information. 

MFi Certification

All LyfeCords are MFi Certified ("Made for iPhone/iPod/iPad") which means Apple® has looked, verified, and licensed every single LyfeCord to fit the developers of hardware and software peripherals that work with Apple's iPod 5th Generation and iPhone 5/5S/5C/6/6+, so that you will not get the "This cable or accessory is not certified and may not work reliably with this iPhone" message when you plug a LyfeCord into your iPhone or iPod.                                                    


Compatibility 

Future Color Options

Here are some future color options for your own personal LyfeCord!

 Who's talked about us

All we need is a little support from you guys to make this happen. Even if you cannot donate, please get the word out there. Please use the share tools! All is appreciated! Thanks!!

story:
Update for Trial Production

Your Blade4000 is ready!

 

Update for Android User

As we got many Android users' inquiries, we are providing a new version with Micro USB input for normal users. You do not need to own a Lightning data cable now.

 

Meet Blade4000

Blade4000 Is  the World 1st Universal OTG Card Reader for All Devices, Including Apple, Android, Type-C device, Gopro, Camera, GPS, TV, Projector, PC, Laptop, Mac OS...

All Devices, One Blade!

Particularly,  there are three things Apple users hate:

Blade4000 resolve all of them in simple & portable design. The smartphones & tablet PCs  can read and write to the TF card directly, no matter it is Apple and Andorid OS system.

Blade is the first MFi certified portable charger using Apple’s officinal Lightning port.

Besides, Blade4000 is simple to use via your data cable no matter it is: Lightning, Micro USB or Type C connector.

 

Why You Need Blade4000?

Your smartphone is your baby, your right hand! But inevitably you know after only  8 hours your precious phone will die on you forcing you to scramble to find an outlet.  And with 16GB storage after a weekend trip your forced to “make room” and delete apps, pictures or music. You need more from your smartphone!

And there are more awkward situations:

Want to share a file with your family or friend with different system?

Want to transfer files from your Gopro to your smart phone?

Want to draw the pictures from your Digital Single Lens Reflex to your social media?

Want to deal with your business files in different Format in your mobile device during your travelling?

……

What we should do? We need to take our Laptop or PC and find a chair, take out your card reader or USB flash drive, copy to your computer from your digital device and then connect to your smartphone copy again.

Keep it “Simple and Portable”---that is what “Forcharge” is trying to provide.

Forgot your PC, you do not need to take it everywhere. The only stuff you need to keep is the Blade4000.

Blade4000 is designed to extend not just the battery and not just the memory for Apple devices, but both! Blade4000  is a combination of an OTG TF card reader and 4000mAh charger, using Apple authorized Lightning input.

You see, "Forcharge" feels your feeling.

 

Why We Need You?

When supporting Blade4000, we want to say thank you by providing you with an exclusive discount of 25%-50%s. By joining us, and contributing to our campaign you are helping us to improve the App and accelerate production - getting you more charge, and more memory, faster!


Portable chargers are becoming a must for daily life. Blade wants you to enjoy more battery, more fun and more space to share these memories.. All this can be possible and portable with our  simple charger which is easy to keep in any pocket.
 

What You Get?

We heard everything you’ve been missing and combined them into the Blade4000 including: :

  • Universal OTG TF Card Reader for All Devices
  • Super-slim 4000mAh Portable Charge

There are 3 opitional colors as you can see:

Black, Blue and Grey.

 

Blade4000 Are More Powerful:

Multiple Devices, One Blade: Fit for all devices: The current iOS flash drive only works with Apple devices. In contrast, Blade4000 works with Apple devices, Type C devices, and Android devices, GPS, Drones, Gopro, Cameras, TVs, Speakers, Projectors…

Fit any case: Keep your favorite phone case! Unlike other portable chargers and OTG flash drive we fit with any case all the time.

More Possibilities for Less Money: We are proud to provide you with more memory, more battery and more possibilities at a at much cheaper cost.

Smarter & Powerful App:  Our App. functions with showing the user the details of battery (The Blade's & Smart device's) including cell temperature, voltage, standby time, the real capacity…

The App can analyse the smart device details too, including the system, storage information...

Contacts Backup: Want to transfer your contacts between Apple and Android? You are able to save or transfer your contacts in easy way.
 

The Main Features of Blade4000

Memory Capacity:    8/ 16/ 32/ 64/ 128/ 200/ 256GB

Data Cable Type:     USB to Lightning/ Type-C/ Micro USB

OS Compatibility:    iOS 6.1 or above/ Android/ Mac OSX/ Windows XP/ 7/ 8/10

Compatible Devices: Apple device, Android device, Camera, GPS, Drone, Gopro

Optional Color:       Black/ Blue/ Gray

Power Capacity:      4000mAh  

Input/Output:        5V/ 2.4A

Warranty:           12 months  

Join Us!

When you support Blade4000 you will receive :

  • 18-months warranty on you Blade.
  • For the super early backers, you will receive one slim power bank at only $10!
  • For $59 you can easily expand your device to 64GB.
  • At $99 you can expand your device’s memory to 128GB and double your iPhone’s battery life.
  • If 128GB isn’t enough, maybe you would be interested in expanding your device to 200GB for $199 or even 256GB for only $279, including a Blade charger.

 

About our team

After finishing my MBA in Dublin, Ireland, I found there was huge demand for smart phone accessories that were both aesthetically pleasing and useful. That’s when Diven, Joy and myself found each other, and created  one company to design and manufacture gadgets.

Forcharge is trying to provide the best gadgets and keep them Simple & Portable. We focus on charging stuff like: Portable Charger, Data Cable, Battery Case, Wireless Charging...

 

Where We Started?

We started to develop the Blade4000  in 2013 since we launched the 3-in-1 keychain charger in Berlin. The keychain charger was a data-cable, flash drive and charger all in one. . With the success from 3-in-1, we kept hearing the same question: What about my iPhone?

In 2014 Apple opened the window for external memory storage (OTG). However they still prohibited any external flash memory. But we heard you the consumers and your need for more space.

Where the fund will go?

We already have 10K C37 in stock (female Lightning connector) and corresponding chips from Apple’s authorized supplier. The tooling will start with no payment necessary as soon as we pass our goal thanks to our experienced supply chain relationship and control. Now, we are investing in MFi testing, PCBAs, and Battery cells.

Risks & Challenges

We have been at work on Blade4000 and have developed several versions of App and found what works perfect samples for the latest iOS system. The next step for us is to devote securing the MFi certificate which is always tough.

Although we have enough experience on simple portable charger and iOS flash drive, we are pioneering the combination of both power and OTG flash memory.. Samples are working perfectly. MFi approval is our biggest issue due to Apple's fussy rules.

Regarding the tooling, it is ready for shell.

Update for Tooling Finish

The tooling advisement has been finished and just waiting for the trial production. All perks will be shipped in time.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Make some noise!You the consumer constantly have your ear to the tech pavement. Share with people the Blade4000 mission!

   

FAQ

What device Blade support?

Yes we do love Apple but Blade4000 not only supports iPhone, iPad, iPod but also Android device with Type C & Android device with normal Micro USB input.

Besides, Blade4000 works with all TF card devices including Drone, Camera, SLR, GPS. And also TV, Projector, all Computers...

What is MFi?

MFi means “Made for iPod, iPhone, and iPad”.

MFi certificate means Blade got Apple’s authorization.

What type of Micro SD/TF card does Blade support?

It supports any brand of HSDC TF card, including 8/16/32/64/128/256GB (512GB should work when it is available in the future).

Please note Only high speed card (Class 10 or over) is suggested to get fluent connection.

Does Blade work with my own cable?

Yes. Blade will work with your existing data cable to Recharging, Discharging, Reading & Writing.

The output is the standard female USB port.

How many times Blade can charge?

It depends on your device’s original battery. Blade4000 has 4000mAh power. 

What color of Blade are available?

There are 3 basic colors:

Black  (Black front shell and black back shell),

Grey   (White front shell and grey back shell),

Blue   (White front shell and blue back shell),

You have a great idea about color? We are happy to hear from you.

Please send email to: George@forcharge.com

I contributed but have no idea where to choose the color?

Thanks for your great contribution. One survey about the color option would be sent to you when the campaign ended.

Where can I get the App.?

The App. Is available on Apple Store and Google Play in free. But the Blade4000 will automatically lead to download the App. as soon as it is connected to your device.

What is the life cycle for the rechargeable battery?

The battery cell will last for at least 500 full cycles. Each cycle means from 0 to full. For example, it will be 0.4 cycle if you only use it from 100% to 60%. 

What are the specs and functions for 'Blade power bank without TF card Reader?
Then Blade4000 will be a simple slim portable charger with 4000mAh battery.

What feature about the 10inch Lightning cable?

It is made of silicone cable and finished in UNIBODY. It is perfect for power bank and on-the-go. Super Bendy and durable!

 

Other Questions?

Please send the question to george@forcharge.com.

Appreciate your participation for any question.

story:
We are a relatively new company specialising in the development of open source 3D printers. Our mission is to make these revolutionary machines available to the mass market, at a realistic price and with a guarantee of printing success.
We are offering backers the opportunity to own one of the first 100 eMAKER Huxley 3D printing machines, as part of our beta program, for a very competitive price in return for feedback on any aspect of the machine, from the packaging, to the assembly, and ease of use.

The eMAKER Huxley

The eMAKER Huxley 3D printer is a Replicating Rapid prototyping machine, or RepRap for short. It is derived from the open source RepRap project which was started at Bath University, UK, about 6 years ago. The machine uses a process known a Fused Filament Fabrication, which it uses to build 3 dimensional objects in a range of plastics and in a variety of colours.
This process enables the user to create almost any shape which can be modelled on a computer, including some which could not be produced by traditional subtractive manufacturing techniques. Many examples of the objects people have made with similar machines can be found on thingiverse.

The eMAKER Huxley is one of the smallest 3D printers available at the moment in terms of footprint but not in terms of build volume. Its primary design goals were to offer a printer which was small enough to be portable, fast to replicate, and fast to assemble and commission. Since its inception at the end of 2010, the eMAKER Huxley has undergone brisk development and heavy testing. Two prototype machines have been built, although neither now looks the way it started life. The great thing about these machines being self replicating is that they can print upgrades and replacement parts for themselves.

The machines have been put through hundreds of hours of printing, with a variety of materials, and the design refined to end up with what we believe is a robust and high quality 3D printer. Examples of parts printed with these machines can be found on our blog, showing the range of features which can be produced, as well as the consistently high print quality which can be achieved.

We fully understand that merely assembling a 3D printer will not guarantee good prints, so we are also offering backers all the software and knowhow to produce high quality parts. As well as access to online support, all of this information will be made available to backers on our website.

You can see the eMAKER Huxley in action on our youtube channel here.

We also have an active development plan for the eMAKER Huxley 3D printer, so users will also have access to software updates and designs for upgraded parts which they can print themselves.

Machine specifications:
- Build volume: 140x140x110mm
- Overall size: 260x280x280mm
- Printing materials: ABS, PLA, 1.75mm diameter thermoplastic.
- Build surface: Heated to ensure parts do not warp.
- Resolution: 0.0125mm
- Speed: 12000mm/min
- Deposition rate: 33cm3 / hr
- Motion: Linear bearings on X and Y axes, Igus low friction bushings on Z axis.

Sources of plastic filament:
We are working on having our own plastic filament suplpier, and will provide more details in the next few days.
In the meantime, here are currently available sources of 1.75mm diameter filament:
www.ultimachine.com, www.reprapsource.com,www.shop.grrf.de, www.pp3dp.com
Cost ranges from $36/kg to $50, and both ABS and PLA are available in a range of colours.
PLA tends to be a little cheaper and easier to obtain, and available in more colours.

Who we are

eMAKER was founded to help promote affordable 3D printing machines to an international audience. Although a small company, we are passionate about making this technology available to the mass market. This not only means at an affordable price, but we have put a lot of effort into developing a robust printing process and see this as an integral part of our products.

Our experience covers many aspects of machine tool technology, from programming and operating CNC machines to designing and developing control systems for them.

Project time scales

We are running this indiegogo crowd funding campaign to enable us to bulk purchase parts for the 100 eMAKER Huxley 3D printer kits in order to offer you a great price.

Due to the overwhelming demand for these kits, we have reviewed our manufacturing strategy and teamed up with some of the most qualified RepRappers in the world to increase our capacity. On completion of this campaign, we will aim to ship the first 150 beta kits in August (this gives us time to order and receive all of the bought in items), and the Round 2 kits in September/early October. All kits will be shipped from our RepRap factory in the UK.

Kits will be sent to backers in the order that funding is received, so the sooner you invest, the sooner you will receive your kit.

We will keep everyone informed of our progress with regular updates on www.emakershop.com as well as through our twitter account.

Included in the eMAKER Huxley kit

Backers will receive a complete kit of parts to enable them to assemble and use an eMAKER Huxley 3D printing machine. The only things which will need to be provided will be some simple tools, (including soldering equipment) and a few hours to assemble and commission the machine.
Some sample filament will also be included to get you started.

Please note: shipping costs will be added based on location, but will be charged at cost and should be less than $70.

If you have any questions regarding this campaign, please feel free to contact us at info at emakershop dot com.

story:
Thanks to all our supporters who have made the Air Dock possible.

For all things Air Dock, please visit our website at theairdock.com


The Air Dock is a wireless charging station for your mobile device. Simply place your device onto the Air Dock to wirelessly charge!

HOW DOES IT WORK?

The Air Dock is a wireless car charger and dock for smartphones and tablets that are equipped with Qi inductive charging technology, which creates an electromagnetic field to transfer energy between two objects, such as your device and The Air Dock.

The face of the Air Dock is made of nano suction foam, so mounting your device is as simple as placing it on the dock. 


The minuscule suction cups secure your phone to the dock without leaving any residue. Magnets hold the device tight to the foam face, allowing for easy removal along with excellent grip strength.


MOUNTING OPTIONS

We like options, so we offer 4 mounting options for the Air Dock 2.0. 

1 - Standard mount for textured surfaces
This is the most versatile mounting option. Its suction cup can be used on many different surfaces. It attaches to textured dashboards, even if they are slightly curved.  

2 - Standard mount for smooth surfaces
This mount is a classic suction cup meant for any flat, smooth surface. It works especially well on windshields.


3 - Long flexible mount
This mount has a long, flexible arm that can be bent into many different configurations. It mounts to the windshield or any other flat, glossy surface. 

4 -CD mount
This unique mount is meant to re-purpose your car's CD player. It slips into the CD slot and then expands to hold itself firmly in place.  

DEVICE COMPATIBILITY
Many of the newest generation smart phones work on the Air Dock. We are continually testing phones for compatibility as they are released.

SUPPORTS MOST NEWER SMART PHONES
We work hard to support as many phones as possible for use on the Air Dock. Every phone is different, and has its own requirements. For a detailed description of what is required for each supported phone please visit the Air Dock device compatibility page. For more info on the Nexus 6 on the Air Dock 2.0 please see the FAQ below.

Please make sure you understand exactly what your phone will need to work properly on the Air Dock. If you have questions, feel free to email us at info@theairdock.com before contributing to the campaign.

CASES and THE AIR DOCK 2.0
The Air Dock works great with plastic cases that are less than 3mm thick. The nano suction foam works best on glossy surfaces, so we recommend glossy-backed cases.

OPTIONAL MAGNETIC STICKER
Phones or cases with non-glossy surfaces, such as satin or other textures, may slip on the nano suction foam. To promote compatibility with as many devices as possible, we provide a magnetic sticker which guarantees reliable attachment to these non-glossy surfaces. Every dock comes with a complementary magnetic sticker, so you can decide whether to use it after trying the dock with your particular phone or case. Visit our website to read more about the magnetic sticker.

PERKS
Check the pricing sheet below to find the best fit for you. Campaign pricing is significantly discounted from the retail price that will be available on the website. Act now and get the best pricing we have ever offered with the limited quantity Super Early Bird Pricing!


THE AIR DOCK 2.0 - NEW & IMPROVED
We have made various improvements to the Air Dock that we are proud to introduce in this updated version. 

  • New Qi transmitter - This allows for a longer charging range, enabling the use of thicker cases. More aftermarket receivers are compatible with the improved transmitter.
  • NFC enabled - Use the built-in NFC chip to trigger events on your device. You can open apps, start music, or go to dock mode.
  • Functional design improvements - Thinner design, USB port re-location, and other small improvements.


DELIVERY OF PERKS

We know from our first campaign how hard it is to bring a product like this to market and to deliver perks on time. We have set a very reasonable funding goal, and as soon as we hit it, work will begin. Our delivery timeline takes minor manufacturing and supply setbacks into account. The timeline is aggressive, but we feel it is reasonable.
FAQ's

Q: How will I receive my Air Dock 2.0?
A: Once the campaign is funded you will receive a unique code via email that corresponds with your specific order. Once you receive this code you will then need to go to our website and place your order with that code which in turn will give you 100% off of the price of your Air Dock.

Q: Will I have to pay for shipping?  How much will it be?
A: When you enter your code in our website you will then be able to select different shipping services depending on your preference, and location. We only charge actual shipping costs.  1-Air Dock shipped via USA Standard Shipping will be$5.  1-Air Dock shipped via International Standard Shipping will be $19.

Q: Do you ship internationally?
A: The Air Dock will only be available to ship to USA, Canada, and Europe.

Q: What if the nano-tech foam gets lint all over it and no longer sticks?
A: Simply wipe the foam face with a damp cloth, air dry, and its restored!

Q: Nexus 6?
A: We will be supplying a special version of the Air Dock 2.0 for the Nexus 6. It will have a curved face to match the curve of the back of the Nexus 6. Before your perk ships you will have the chance to select which version of the Air Dock 2.0 you want. 

Q: LG G3?
A: We will be supplying a special version of the Air Dock 2.0 for the LG G3. It will have a curved face to match the curve of the back of the LG G3. Before your perk ships you will have the chance to select which version of the Air Dock 2.0 you want.



HOW THE AIR DOCK CAME TO BE
 I was always told as a kid, “Necessity is the mother of all invention.” That is why the Air Dock was born. 

My brother and I had just gotten brand new Nexus 5 phones. Our previous phones had docks built specifically for them, and we had become accustomed to using them in the car. I started looking for a car dock for the Nexus 5 and nothing existed, so I began gathering ideas for how to build my own.

I bought a handful of wireless chargers, car mounts, and other parts, and started hacking them together. After a few days, I had a working car dock for my phone. 

I wasn't content with my first attempt. I kept making new ones that were better than the previous. My brother and I would brainstorm new things to try, and then test them on our phones. After a dozen or so iterations, I had a good functioning dock. 

It was then that I realized there might be other people who would like a dock like this. I had always wanted to try a crowd funding campaign, so I decided to give it a go.

I knew if I was going to sell the Air Dock, it had to be very polished and work properly. I went through several more versions until I had something I thought was good enough to sell to people. 

We reached the funding goal for the first campaign quickly and easily. It was a lot of hard work but we fulfilled the first campaign perks, and even did it on time. The Air Dock was an official success!

During the first campaign, I received some great suggestions from customers about possible avenues of improvement. I was excited to see if I could make the Air Dock even better. After months of working in the shop, I'm pleased to announce that the Air Dock 2.0 directly implements several crucial customer recommendations.

At this point we have perfectly functioning prototypes of the Air Dock 2.0. All we need to get this product into the hands of people all over the world is another successful crowd funding campaign. I was so pleased with the response of the first campaign that I wanted to do it again. I wanted to let the people who are interested in this product fund it, and bring it to market. 

Lessons Learned from The Air Dock 1.0.
The engineering and prototyping phase of the first campaign was nothing new to me, but there were many hard lessons to learn about supply chain timelines and streamlining the manufacturing process. Our plan for the Air Dock 2.0 takes these lessons into account. We are confident we can get this product to you in the timeline we have planned.
story_txt:
Thanks to all our supporters who have made the Air Dock possible.For all things Air Dock, please visit our website at theairdock.comThe Air Dock is a wireless charging station for your mobile device. Simply place your device onto the Air Dock to wirelessly charge!



HOW DOES IT WORK?

The Air Dock is a wireless car charger and dock for smartphones and tablets that are equipped with Qi inductive charging technology, which creates an electromagnetic field to transfer energy between two objects, such as your device and The Air Dock.
The face of the Air Dock is made of nano suction foam, so mounting your device is as simple as placing it on the dock. 








The minuscule suction cups secure your phone to the dock without leaving any residue. Magnets hold the device tight to the foam face, allowing for easy removal along with excellent grip strength.







MOUNTING OPTIONSWe like options, so we offer 4 mounting options for the Air Dock 2.0. 



1 - Standard mount for textured surfacesThis is the most versatile mounting option. Its suction cup can be used on many different surfaces. It attaches to textured dashboards, even if they are slightly curved.  
2 - Standard mount for smooth surfacesThis mount is a classic suction cup meant for any flat, smooth surface. It works especially well on windshields.3 - Long flexible mountThis mount has a long, flexible arm that can be bent into many different configurations. It mounts to the windshield or any other flat, glossy surface. 

4 -CD mountThis unique mount is meant to re-purpose your car's CD player. It slips into the CD slot and then expands to hold itself firmly in place.  

DEVICE COMPATIBILITYMany of the newest generation smart phones work on the Air Dock. We are continually testing phones for compatibility as they are released.SUPPORTS MOST NEWER SMART PHONESWe work hard to support as many phones as possible for use on the Air Dock. Every phone is different, and has its own requirements. For a detailed description of what is required for each supported phone please visit the Air Dock device compatibility page. For more info on the Nexus 6 on the Air Dock 2.0 please see the FAQ below.Please make sure you understand exactly what your phone will need to work properly on the Air Dock. If you have questions, feel free to email us at info@theairdock.com before contributing to the campaign.

CASES and THE AIR DOCK 2.0The Air Dock works great with plastic cases that are less than 3mm thick. The nano suction foam works best on glossy surfaces, so we recommend glossy-backed cases.

OPTIONAL MAGNETIC STICKERPhones or cases with non-glossy surfaces, such as satin or other textures, may slip on the nano suction foam. To promote compatibility with as many devices as possible, we provide a magnetic sticker which guarantees reliable attachment to these non-glossy surfaces. Every dock comes with a complementary magnetic sticker, so you can decide whether to use it after trying the dock with your particular phone or case. Visit our website to read more about the magnetic sticker.

story:
Overview

Currently the only ways for 3D artists to display their work online is by taking pictures of their models, or videos of their animations. I am developing an interactive portfolio application that currently runs on both PC and Android.

My program shows off 3D models, levels/environments and animations using the Unity 3D game engine. Potential employers are able to zoom, rotate, light, and animate your models and scenes all online via their computer or phone!

My goal is to enhance this online portfolio application and make it available to all the 3D artists around the world, but there are some hurdles. 

If I had made this application in a way that allowed users to just drag and drop their 3D work into the application themselves, they would actually need to download the entire game engine along with my extension, and then learn how to use both.

Instead of making every 3D artist that wants an interactive portfolio do all of that; I am going to be providing a service that does it for them, and if my campaign is funded, I will be creating a business that is dedicated to developing custom 3D Portfolios for 3D Artists. All the artists will need to do is simply email their exported files and they will be emailed back with either a link to their new application, an executable PC file, or the APK file to play on Android devices.

 

Try The Alpha Version

(Unity web extension will need to be downloaded)

https://db.tt/2IfkSoPa 

 

Campaign Costs

Development Fees

  • License for Unity 3D Development - $1,500
  • License for Android Development - $1,500

Software for New Custom Graphics

  • Adobe Photoshop CS6 - $700
  • Adobe Illustrator CS6 - $600
Business Start Up Costs for Legal Services
  • Corporate Formation Start Up Package - $2,500
  • State Filing Fee - $500 for MA LLC
  • Operating Agreement Drafting Services - $2,200
  • Trademarks and Patenting- $500

Website

  • Domain and Setup - $1,000
  • Dropbox Business Services - $1,000 
  • Advertising - $3,000

 

TOTAL - $15,000

 

Other Ways To Help

If you can’t contribute, that doesn't mean you can’t help! Remember you can always use the Indiegogo share tools to help spread the word!

About Me

The link to my own portfolio with all of my information is just below, along with my twitter feed where I will keep everyone constantly updated on the progress of this campaign. You can also contact me via email at MikeWiseman@Mail.com if you have any questions, comments or concerns and I will get back to you as soon as possible.


Receiving Your Perks

When donating, please put your email instead of your name when asked for your shipping address so that I can verify who is paying how much. Otherwise anyone can see your name and email me saying I'm so and so the one who donated $500, so please don't forget to include a valid email address before submitting your donation.
